loans.name: Ismaila

texts.en: Ismaila L. is 40 years old and married with four children. He has a welding shop where he renders welding services. He is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more welding materials. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more welding materials

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach S. was born in 1971 and resides with other family members in Siem Reap Province. She owns a medium-sized grocery store where she sells many wares to earn a living. She sells items such as cooked ingredients, soft drinks, canned foods and some snack foods for kids. She earns around of $5 a day to contribute to her family's living expenses.

She is married to Not Savy, age 36, who is a local statue carver. He owns a handicraft shop and has employees to provide his service. The couple has three children who are students and under their care.

Lach S. is applying for a loan to increase her business capital in order to better meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Jelilat

texts.en:
Jelilat A. is 32 years old and married with three children. She offers rental services, renting out canopies and chairs.

She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more chairs and canopies. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more canopies and chairs to rent

loans.name: Esmyrna

texts.en: Esmyrna C. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 47 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Esmyrna owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2003, Esmyrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Esmyrna is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her 13th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Oyinlola

texts.en: Oyinlola is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She sells planks to make a living. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Oladayo

texts.en: Oludayo A. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She sells planks.  She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more planks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna T. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 55 years old. Edna is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding their fishing business

loans.name: Abimbola

texts.en: Abimbola is 35 years old and married with 2 children.  He sells bags of flour.  He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more bags of flour to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour to sell

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en: Kayode is 40 years old and married with 2 children. He is a tailor and he also sells tailoring materials. He is requesting the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more tailoring materials.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Adebola

texts.en: Adebola I. is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She has a tailoring shop where she sews clothes and also sells sarongs and tailoring materials. She is requesting the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more tailoring materials.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her work

loans.name: Oladepo

texts.en: A. Oladepo is 39 years old and married with two children. He has a shop where he sells gas and cylinders.  He is requesting the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more gas and cylinders to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gas and cylinders to sell

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Шодиева Мухайо женщина, которая имеет бизнес продажи детской одежды. Мухайо планирует получить кредит и съездить за товаром в Истаравшан и привезти ассортимент летнего товара. Она более четырёх лет кредитуется в Фонде и смогла расширить свой бизнес. Мухайо в числе добросовестных клиентов Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Muhayo S. is a woman who has a business selling children’s clothing. Muhayo plans to get a loan and to travel for products to Istaravshan and to bring back an assortment of summer products. She has been a borrower of our Fund for more than four years and was able to expand her business. Muhayo is one MicroInvest's honest clients.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Ouyètiè 6 Group

texts.fr:
Ouyètiè 6 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Nitabogoro de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et au moins 4 enfants. 
Elles  cultivent  essentiellement de l’arachide et du mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 6 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide et de mil, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Koutiala. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 6 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ouyètiè 6 is a group of married women of the village of Nitabogoro in Koutiala City, Region of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional extended families with their children, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They average 32 years of age and have at least four children. The women essentially grow peanuts and millet. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. After having correctly repaid the first loan, they are now on their second farm loan. The current loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds for planting peanuts and millet; some minor supplies and equipment; and some fertilizers and the like, for farming. These items are procured at the grand marketplace of Koutiala. Following the off-season, the harvests are stored for a time, so that they gain in value. And then they are sold at the same marketplace and at surrounding marketplaces at the retail level (often wholesale), in cash transactions, to customers generally from large cities. The group members each intend to realize, after selling their produce, an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Kassa

texts.fr: Kassa, 47 ans mariée avec 07 enfants en charge est membre de banc villageois depuis 6 ans Elle s’active dans le maraîchage et le petit commerce. Le prêt sollicité sera utilisé pour acheter des produits phytosanitaires, des engrais, du matériel, des semences et réfectionner  la clôture pour augmenter sa production. Elle participe à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kassa, 47, is married and raising 7 children. She has been a member of her village bank for 6 years. She works as a market gardener and petty trader. The requested loan will be used to buy products for her plants, fertilizer, seeds, etc. and to repair the fence so as to increase her yield. She is helping to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of items for agriculture and for petty trading

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Хобилова Дилафруз молодая женщина , предприниматель , которая продаёт в аптеке разнообразные лекарства и медикаменты. Она живёт и торгует в Костакозе, товар покупает с Истаравшана , а также привозит Российская фирма.  Дилафруз планирует на полученный кредит пополнить заканчивающиеся медикаменты.
texts.en:
Dilafruz Hobilova is a young woman, an entrepreneur, who sells different medicines and medical supplies at a pharmacy. She lives and sells in Kostakoz and purchases her products in Istaravshan and her products are also brought by a Russian firm. Dilafruz plans to use the loan to purchase medical supplies that are running out.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine sales

loans.name: Sounkar

texts.fr: Sounkar, 60 ans mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre de banc villageois depuis 4ans et demi  Elle  veut renforcer sa boutique en sucre, huile, riz,lait, thé, Omo, cigarette et  pile. L’approvisionnement se fait au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires et à Kolda. Avec l’appui de sa petite fille, la vente se fait au comptant. Elle contribue à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sounkar, 60, is married and raising 5 children; she has been a member of her village bank for four and a half years. She wants to stock up on sugar, oil, rice, milk, tea, Omo (detergent), cigarettes, and batteries for her little shop. She buys her merchandise at the weekly markets and in Kolda. With the support of her granddaughter, she sells retail. She contributes to improving the living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise for her little shop

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en: Yetunde A. is 36 years old and married with 3 children.  She is a tailor and she also sells rechargeable phone cards and tailoring materials.  She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and rechargeable phone cards  to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and rechargeable phone cards to sell

Elles cultivent  principalement   de l’arachide et du mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 7 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.

Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. And then they are sold at the same marketplace and at surrounding marketplaces at the retail level (often wholesale), in cash transactions, to customers generally from large cities. The group members each intend to realize, after selling their produce, an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Munana

texts.en:
J. is married and has five children. Living in Mbingo, Belo, Cameroon, he has two sources of income: farming plantains and raising goats. With this loan, J. would like to purchase four goats, some fencing, plantain suckers (for planting) and some salt.

This is J.’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary on Valentine’s Day in 2008. He has experience using loans and knows that his products will sell because “people like plantains” and goats are used in traditional ceremonies, as well as eaten regularly.

J. has been through times where he was sick or he could not afford to pay his children’s school fees. With the profits from this loan he plans to pay those fees and purchase more food for his family. J. takes out GHAPE loans because they are a transparent organization and he sees that the members “love one another.”

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Four Goats, Plantain Suckers, Salt, Fencing

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She sells electronics to make a living.  She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 26-year-old single man who lives with his parents and three youngest brothers. He owns a grocery store and is requesting a loan to expand his business by purchasing supplies of new products. Given this chance, he will earn more and save more, allowing him to meet the needs of his family. Bassam is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: To expand the supply of new products for his store

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Мавлонова Манзура, женщина которая берёт кредиты на расширение своего бизнеса. Её бизнес состоит из  продажи детской одежды. За товаром раз в месяц ездит её сын, а торгует она сама. Манзура пунктуально работает с Фондом и довольна всеми условиями. Манзура планирует получив займ пополнить свой бизнес летним подростковым ассортиментом товаров.
texts.en:
Manzura M. is a woman who takes out loans to grow her business. Her business is the sale of children’s clothing. Her son travels for products once a month and she sells herself. Manzura is punctual in her work with the Fund and is happy with all the conditions. Manzura plans to use the loan to add an assortment of teenage summer products to her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Timchia Clement

texts.en:
Timchia is married and has seven children. In his home town he runs a small shop selling provisions as well as a piggery. This loan will be used for extending his piggery and purchasing piglets along with the necessary feed for them. This is Timchia’s second loan from Kiva partner, GHAPE, since he became a beneficiary in 2008. He has been raising pigs long enough to know that what he does works well. He notes that there is a 'high demand for pig products and that local provisions have [a] high demand in the community.' By having an opportunity to sell his pigs and provisions close to home, Timchia believes he is saving his community money.

After battling severe illness, Timchia plans to use the profits from this loan to not only pay his children’s school fees, but pay for his health care costs. Timchia takes out GHAPE loans because he sees GHAPE as a 'locally oriented community bank [that] promotes community understanding in all spheres of life.'

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en: Omowumi S. is 50 years old and married with two children. She sells second-hand rugs and foam. She is requesting the loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more second-hand rugs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand rugs to sell

loans.name: Bello

texts.en:
Bello O. is 29 years old and single. He is a photographer and he also has a business center where he offers computer services.

He is requesting the loan of N60,000 to rent a shop that he can use as a studio to take pictures for his customers and to purchase more film. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To rent a shop and to purchase film

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.en: Ismaila K. is 43 years old and married with five children. He makes and sells baking pans of various sizes and shapes. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more materials in order to make more baking pans. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make more baking pans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Anghie Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is married to five women and has 21 children. With such a big family, he generates income by selling many things at his provisional store. With this loan, Alfred will purchase a number of umbrellas and bags, as well as other small provisions that his community needs. 

This is Alfred’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2008. With his previous loan, he financed some goats that he raised. Alfred used to raise a lot more goats, but one day he lost a herd of goats due to disease. He also lost a young forest farm in a fire. 

Alfred’s new business strategy lies in his timing. Rainy season is upon Cameroon, and so the need for umbrellas is very high. Also, schools will reopen at the end of summer and Alfred wants to be prepared to sell bags to the school children. With the profits from this loan, Alfred plans to pay for health care costs and fund his children’s educational needs. Alfred takes out GHAPE loans because he thinks they have good policies, the center is near his house, and he enjoys the fact that GHAPE is made up of people within the same community, who work to develop together.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Umbrellas, Bags, and Other Provisions

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leira R. is a Tanzanian micro-businesswoman. She runs a clothing shop in the Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases commodity goods from the wholesale and retail shops at the Kariakoo shopping city center and sells them to her retail customers. She has been in the business for three years. She also runs a business in which she prepares and sells juices to customers. She is requesting a loan of TZS 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her retail store

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: COUMBA M. est une jeune femme née en 1977 à thies;elle est mariée et vit avec son époux au quartier som ,après les travaux ménagers elle fait du petit commerce de produits divers qu'elle a démarré depuis 2005 sur fonds propres,elle s'approvisionne en gambie presque tous les deux mois en fonction de la commande de ses clients
texts.en:
Coumba M. is a young woman who was born in 1977 in Thies. She is married and lives with her husband in the Som neighborhood. When she has finished her household duties, she works as a petty trader selling diverse merchandise, a business she began in 2005 using her own funds. She goes to Gambia every two months or so to stock up, according to the orders of her clients.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing her working capital

loans.name: Darou Salam Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Darou salam regroupe quatre (4) vendeurs de légumes et condiment d’un marché de quartier de la ville de Mbour. Le groupe crée depuis deux (2) ans permette à ses membres de réunir chaque jour des cotisations de cent fracs CFA qui sont versées chaque jour à un membre du groupe à tour de rôle. Cette somme est injectée dans le commerce pour renforcer le fonds de roulement du groupe. Face à l’insuffisance ses cotisations à régler leurs besoins en fonds de roulement, le groupe  sollicite un prêt. La plus part des membres du groupe ont quitté leur village pour s’installer à la ville à fin d’avoir de quoi nourrir leur famille.
texts.en:
The group Darou Salam is composed of four vendors of vegetables and condiments from an area marketplace in the city of Mbour. Created two years ago, the group enables its members to gather each day 100 francs CFA in dues, which are submitted daily to a group member by turns. This sum is injected into commerce to bolster the group’s working capital. Facing a deficiency in dues for meeting the need for working capital, the group is requesting a loan. Most of the group members have left their village to become settled in the city in order to have something for feeding their family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing two more cows

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose M. owns a small shop in the Mnyaman ward of Dar es Salaam. She makes a living selling clothing, and buys her goods from wholesalers. She uses the income generated by her business to meet her family's daily needs and continue her operations. She has applied for this loan to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: Buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Yuh

texts.en:
G. is married and has six children. She makes a living selling pigs and goats. With this loan she plans to buy two goats for about $30 each and two piglets for about $40 each, along with two bags of feed. She also plans to do small repairs to her home.

This is G.’s second loan from GHAPE in the last year. She has purchased goats before, and has experience in using a loan for this purpose. She believes she will succeed because she has already built a pig and a goat house, and knows that there is enough land for the goats to feed on. 

G.'s living situation  does not work well for her. Her husband has married a second wife and she is not pleased with his decision. On top of that, she has lost her parents in the last two years. With this loan, she hopes to continue feeding her family and pay for her children’s school fees. 	

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy two goats, two piglets and animal feed as well as do some repairs

loans.name: Khoudia Sall

texts.fr: KHOUDIA SALL D. est une jeune femme née à thies en 1980;elle exerce la  fonction de couturière depuis plus de sept ans ,elle a ouvert un atelier chez elle avec l'aide de son frère qui est enseignant;avec le financement qu'elle sollicite elle envisage de renforcer son petit commerce d'articles de mercerie et de produits cosmétiques
texts.en:
Khoudia Sall D. is a young woman born in Thies in 1980. She has been working as a seamstress for over seven years. She opened a workshop in her home with the help of her brother, who is a teacher. With the financing she’s requesting, she envisions bolstering her small business in sewing supplies and in cosmetics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A small business/ sewing supplies and cosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two new cows

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema T. is married and runs a small business selling second-hand clothes in the Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam. She buys her items wholesale from various supplies and sells them retail. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: El Adji

texts.fr: EL HADJI D. est membre de la mutuelle depuis plus de deux ans et a une grande expérience dans le commerce de détail,il a ouvert une boutique chez lui au quartier som de thiès;après l'obtention de ce financement,il envisage de renforcer son stock de marchandises
texts.en:
El Adji D. has been a member of the mutuelle for over two years and has much experience in retail commerce. He opened a shop in his home, in the Som district of Thiès. After obtaining this financing, he envisions bolstering his stock of merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To augment his working capital

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: aida konté est une femme mariée qui a quatre enfants à sa charge;avec une expérience de quinze ans dans le métier de la restauration ;elle y associe du petit commerce ,elle vend du riz, de la boisson ,de la glace et d'autres denrées alimentaires;c'est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement qu'elle sollicite ce pret
texts.en:
Aida Konté is a married woman who is raising 4 children. With 15 years of experience in food service, she also does petty trading, selling rice, drinks, ice, and other groceries. She is requesting this loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: food service and petty trading

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni A. makes a living selling tomatoes and green vegetables and is applying for this loan to buy more green vegetables to sell. Poni is 29 years old and single. With the income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to buy a taxi and open up a new business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Wude

texts.en:
Wude R. is currently in the business of selling tea and is requesting a loan to purchase chairs and tables for her restaurant. Wude is 32 years old and married to a security guard. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase plastic chairs and tables for her restaurant

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr: mr abdourahmane sène est un commerçant originaire du village de sangué,il a démarré ses activités commerciales depuis l'an 2000 avec un capital personnel de 50000 FCFA,son activité consiste à acheter du foin de bétail ,de l'aliment de volaille ,du mais et de l'arachide en zone rurale pour les revendre sur le marché urbain :avec ce pret ,il envisage d'augmenter ses stocks avant l'arrivée de l'hivernage
texts.en:
Mr. Abdourahmane Sène is an entrepreneur whose roots are in the village of Sangué. He started up his business in the year 2000 with a personal capital of 50,000 F CFA. His business is buying cattle fodder, chicken feed, maize and peanuts in rural areas to re-sell on the urban market. With this loan, he expects to be able to add to his stocks before the arrival of the off-season.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to his stocks of animal feed for re-sale

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to make more paste to sell.  Kaku is 30 years old and married to a health worker. She has one child who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Make more paste to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Paraguayas Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Paraguayas”, está constituido  por 21 señoras muy activas y solidarias, todas de la misma zona cerca de Ciudad del Este

Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser venta de:  cubiertos, ropa, comida , condimentos, chipa, 
frazadas, verduras,

Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 a Gs 1400.000

Las integrantes y sus actividades son:

texts.en:
The committee is named "Mujeres Paraguayas", the members are 21 very active and solidary women, all from the same area close to Ciudad del Este.

They carry out different activities such as the sale of cutlery, clothes, food, condiments, "chipa" (bread), blankets, vegetables.

The ladies need loans from Gs 300.000 to Gs 1400.00.

The members and their activities are: Justa P. Food sale Felicia G. Pantry Ana Patiño Cutlery sale Maria S. Cutlery sale Maria R. Clothes sale Angelina C. "Menudo" sale (tripe soup) Aurora R. Pantry Rufina L. Food Sale Zulma G. Clothes sale Lorenza C. "Menudo" sale Virginia M. Pantry Julia G. Fruit sale Maria C. Clothes sale Eulalia C. Condiments sale Apolonia V. Chipa sale Esmelda D. Fruit and vegetable sale Ana Rosa B. Clothes sale Adela V. Blanket sale Wilma R. Used rose sale Ana Zorilla Dressmaker Juana M. Cutlery sale

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, tripes, condiments, beverages, cutlery, plastic objects, clothes ,food, meat, cooking oil, blankets, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married and has seven children. Her sole activity for this loan will be to buy and sell “dry fish” in the market in Baingo. Here, dry fish is used in many dishes as it is ground up and added in for flavor and protein. Helen will buy 100,000 CFA (about $200) worth of dry fish and use the remaining money to transport it.  

This being nothing new to Helen, she is confident she will be successful with this loan. She knows that the fish always sells in the market due to the high demand for it. This will be Helen’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2008.

In the last three years, Helen has lost three of her children. Although saddened by this unfortunate circumstance, Helen still has to take care of her other children. She plans to use the profits from this loan to pay for food for the family, pay her children’s school fees and increase her business. 

Helen takes out GHAPE loans because the loan conditions are right for her, as she pays back her loan in small installments, instead of all at once. She also benefits from the training on loan management.  

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Dry fish and transport

loans.name: Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité la contacto fue la Señora Elena D., quien vive en la zona del km 7 Monday Presidente Franco.  Ella es madre de 7 hijos y se dedica a la venta de verduras.  Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en dicha zona.

El comité se denomina “Santa Clara” está constituido por 15  señoras muy activas y solidarias, todas de la misma zona.  Todas las integrantes tienen actividades diferentes como ser venta de: ropa, verduras, comidas, joyas, artículos de primera necesidad, cubiertos etc. Todas las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000.

El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para la venta.

Las integrantes y sus actividades son:  

Maria Elena D.. 	Venta de Verduras.
Norma Z.. 	Venta de Ropa.
Celia B.. 	Venta de ropa.
Vilda M.. 	Venta de Ropa Interior.
Claudia C..	Venta de Ropa y Cosméticos.
Aida V.. 	Despensa.
Mercedes L.. 	Venta de Joyas de Plata.
Graciela S..	Venta de Comida Rápida.
Pabla P..	Venta de Cartera.
Cristina S..	Venta de bebidas y Carne.
Julvia A..	Despensa.
Blanca V..	Venta de cubiertos de Plásticos.
Adela A.. 	Despensa.
Rosa G.. 	Venta de Huevo.
Marina R..	Venta de Frutas.
Zunilda S..  Venta de comidas.
texts.en:
To set up this committee Mrs. Elena D. was the contact person. She lives in the area of km 7 Monday Presidente Franco. She is the mother of 7 children and sells vegetables for a living. She contacted her neighbors and friends to start the committee in the mentioned area.

The committee is named "Santa Clara", the members are 15 very active and solidary ladies, all living in the same zone. The members carry out different activities such as the sale of clothes, vegetables, food, jewellery, basic necessities, cutlery, etc. Each lady needs a loan of Gs 300.000.

The loan will be spent to buy merchandise and articles of basic necessities to be sold.

The members and their activities are: Maria Elena D., Vegetable sale Norma Z., Clothes sale Celia B., Clothes sale Vilda M., Underwear sale Claudia Cardoza, Clothes and cosmetics sale Aida V., Pantry Mercedes L., Silver jewellery sale Graciela S., Fast food sale Pabla P., Wallet sale Cristina S., Beverage and meat sale Julvia A., Pantry Blanca V., Plastic cutlery sale Adela A., Pantry Rosa G., Egg sale Marina R., Fruit sale Zunilda S., Food sale

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, eggs, cosmetics, beverages, cutlery, plastic items, clothes, food, flour, cooking oil, meat,silver jewellery,etc.

loans.name: Kamolidin

texts.ru:
Ашуров Камолидин, 1988 года рождения, холост. Он студент юридического факультета, у него любимое дело. Камолидин производит и продает национальный табак - «Нос». Этот бизнес он унаследовал от своего отца. Вот уже 5 лет у него собственная лавка, где он продает свой продукт. Ему в этом деле помогает старший брат.  
 Он хочет получить займ в сумме 1000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев для закупа табака.
texts.en:
Kamolidin A. was born in 1988 and is single. He is a law student, and he has a favorite activity. Kamolidin makes and sells traditional tobacco, called Nose. He inherited this business from his father. He has had his own shop for 5 years in which he sells this product. His older brother helps him. He wants to take out a loan for 1000 somoni to buy tobacco.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tobacco

loans.name: Progreso Hacia Adelante 2 Group

texts.en:
Damaris is a mother of three small children, ages five, three, and nine months. Damaris will use the loan to purchase clothes, toys, and phone cards to resell from her home, primarily to people in her community. Her dream is to have a big store one day, with a lot of variety. But more than anything she would like to support her three children, send them to school and see them succeed in life.

We have all heard of the saying, "Give a man a fish and he will eat one meal. Teach a man to fish and you will feed him for a lifetime." Well, how about: teach a man to fish and give him the capital to buy proper equipment, and with that you will feed a man, his family, and his community for generations to come. 

Please help Damaris and her group of entrepreneurs. Thank you.

loans.use: Purchase new clothes, toys, and phone cards to resell

loans.name: Lisungi Plus Group

texts.fr: Louise E. est active dans la micro entreprise depuis 2003. Elle a commencé par vendre des poissons salés avec un capital initial de $2 dont les bénéfices se sont vite accumulés et lui ont permis d’ouvrir un petit restaurant en 2004. La lenteur du développement du petit restaurant en chiffres d’affaire, a poussé Louise de l’abandonner la même année et reprendre la vente des poissons qu’elle maitrisait plus. Etant très limitée en moyen financier et vu le nombre de sa clientèle qui ne cessait de croitre, Louise décide en 2005 d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope dénommée « Lisungi » qui signifie Aide en français, dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et accroitre le revenu de son affaire. Elle est une cliente fidèle qui a reçu plusieurs fois les crédits de Hope et les a correctement remboursés à temps. Actuellement, son capital propre est de $200. Le crédit qu’elle obtenu au mois de mai dernier lui a servi d’acheter un gros panier des poissons fumés qu’elle a ajouté à coté des poissons salés, des champignons, des chenilles et des fretins qu’elle vend déjà. Son affaire lui génère un bénéfice $80 par mois. Son rêve est d’ouvrir une boutique d’articles divers. Louise est marié âgée de 44 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 18 et 26. Un seul parmi leurs enfants reste avec eux et va à l’école.
texts.en:
Louise E. has been working in micro-business since 2003. She began by selling salted fish with an initial capital of US$ 2, and her profits swiftly accumulated, allowing her to open up a little restaurant in 2004. The slowness with which this little restaurant developed, as far as turnover is concerned, pushed Louise to abandon it that same year and take up the selling of fish again, a business she was better versed in.

Being limited as far as financial means go and in view of her ever growing clientele, in 2005, Louise decided to join one of the groups of HOPE, called "Lisungi" which means "aid", with an eye to satisfying the needs of her customers and growing the income from her business. She has been a faithful client who has had several loans through HOPE and has correctly reimbursed them. Presently, her working capital stands at US$ 200. The loan she received this past month of May is being used to buy a big basket of smoked fish which she has added to her offerings along with salted fish, mushrooms, grubs (moth larvae, an important source of protein) and small fry (very young fish) that she already sells.

Her business generates a profit of US$ 80 per month. Her dream is to open a general store. Louise is married, 44 years old, and the mother of 6 children from 18 to 26 years of age. Only one of them is still living with the parents and attending school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a big basket of smoked fish for re-sale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: La señora Benigna es cliente antigua trabaja con la institucion desde el año 2006, la actividad economica que realiza es la atencion diaria de la tienda de barrio que esta ubicada casi al frente de su domicilio en la cual expende viveres, conservas, golocinas, lacteos y fruta.  Los dias viernes y sabados vende fruta de temporada en el Mercado Rodriguez, popular mercado de La Paz.  Ella vive en la casa de su suegra conjuntamente con sus hijos que son quienes le ayudan en la atencion de la tienda. La señora Benigna invertira el dinero del prestamo en la compra de viveres(arroz, fideo y azuar) por mayor ademas tambien comprara fruta para surtir el puesto que tiene en el mercado.
texts.en:
Señora Benigna has long been a client with the institution (since 2006). The economic activity in which she is engaged is tending a neighborhood store every day which is located in the front of her house. She dispenses provisions, canned foods, sweets, milk products and fruit. On Friday and Saturday she sells seasonal fruit in the Rodriguez Market, a popular market in La Paz. She lives in her mother-in-law's house together with her children who also help her with tending the store. Señora Benigna will invest her loan funds in buying provisions (rice, noodles and sugar) for the most part, but she will also buy fruit to stock up the stand that she has in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Warun

texts.en:
Warun R. is currently in the business of selling cakes and is requesting a loan to purchase the ingredients to make cakes. Warun is thirty-two years old and married. Her husband is a security guard. She has two children, both of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, educatio, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. This microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make cakes for sale

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana vive en casa propia con su esposo en la calle Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que ella tiene es la venta de comida, debido a que ella vende en la calle, sin la comodidad necesaria, fue sancionada por la Alcaldía. En vista de que tiene mucha afluencia de clientes, ella solicita un crédito para comprar un Kiosco donde el producto que ella vende sea higiénicamente conservado.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007 y su historial de pagos es muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Emiliana lives in her own home with her husband on Jaimes Freyre Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz. The business that she has is selling food. Since she sells on the street without the necessary equipment, she was fined by the mayor's office. In view of the fact that she has a number of clients, she is asking for a loan to buy a kiosk where the product she sells will be hygienically preserved.

She is a client of IMPRO since 2007 and her payment history is very good, so she can get a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lee Bruner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a kiosk to keep her product hygienically preserved.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro vive en alquiler en la calle Francisco Bedregal de la zona de Ciudadela ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz; está separado de la esposa;  tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como transporte publico en una compañía de radio taxi de la zona sur y con esta actividad  cubre sus necesidades de alimentación y ropa. El crédito que solicita es para pagar el costo de mantenimiento del auto y poder mantener su fuente de trabajo.

No es cliente antiguo de Impro, pero califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Genaro lives in a rental on Francisco Bedregal Street in the Ciudadela Ferroviaria neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He is separated from his spouse. He has a car with which he works providing public transport on the south side for a radio taxi company. With this activity he is able to cover the basic necessities of food and clothing. The loan he is requesting is to pay the cost of maintenance for the auto and be able to preserve his source of work. He is not an established client of IMPRO but he does qualify for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia vive en casa propia en la calle Alberto Ostria de la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; en la casa instaló un Snack, lugar donde vende Sándwiches, café, y comida ya que en el lugar hay una parada de Minibuses, el negocio marcha bien motivo por el cual ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cemento, arena y cerámica para el piso, como también cubrir el costo de la mano de obra, y de esta manera ampliar su negocio y tener mayor clientela, pues esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro y tiene un historial de pago muy bueno y por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in her own house on Alberto Ostria Street, Alto Soposachi zone, in the city of La Paz. She set up a snack stand in her home. She sells sandwiches, coffee, and meals. There is a bus stop there; the business is going well. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, tile for the floor, and labor costs to expand her business and have more customers. This business is her only source of income. She is a client of Impro, and she has a good history of payment. She is, therefore, able to have a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, sand, tile, and pay for labor to expand her snack stand

loans.name: Juan C.

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene un vehículo que trabaja como radio taxi en la empresa Apolo.
Es casado y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar Vive en la zona de Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión ( reparación y mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo y compra de repuestos en general)
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva.
Es una persona responsable por lo cual le califica como cliente bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos has a vehicle and works as a taxi driver for the Apolo Company. He is married and has two school aged children. He lives in a rented house in the Villa Copacabana zone, in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used for repairs, to complete maintenance of his vehicle, and to buy replacement parts. This is the fourth time he has asked for a loan from Impro, and the second time he has needed support from Kiva. He is a responsible person, and that qualifies him as a good client in regards to making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene una pensión (pequeño restaurante) donde vende chicharrón de pollo y chicharrón de cerdo, trabaja con una empleada y este su negocio le ayuda para poder solventar sus gastos de alimentación.
Vive en la Zona de Villa Copacabana sector Escobar Uria de la Ciudad de La Paz
El crédito será destinado para Capital de inversión ( compra de mesas y sillas para la pensión)
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva. Las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Celia has a “pensión” (small restaurant) where she sells “chicharrón” (crispy, fried chicken and pork rinds). She works with one employee. This business helps her to be able to pay her food expenses. She lives in the Villa Copacabana zone, Escobar Uria sector, city of La Paz. The loan is to buy tables and chairs for her pensión. This is the third time she has asked for a loan from Impro, and the second time she has needed help from Kiva. Her desire to improve herself has given her the opportunity to be eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for her small restaurant

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es:
Norberta tiene un vehiculo del cual recibe renta por el servicio de transporte y es el único ingreso que tiene para poder solventar sus gastos de alimentación.
Es casada y por su edad no puede hacer trabajos pesados por lo cual requiere el crédito para la compra de ovejas y así comenzar su actividad de crianza de ovejas.
Vive en la Zona de bajo Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa propia.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de poder acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Norberta has a cart from which she receives rent for transportation services and this is the only income that she has in order to be able to resolve her expenses for nourishment. She is married and because of her age she is not able to do heavy labor. And so she needs a loan in order to buy sheep and in that way begin her work raising sheep. She lives in her own house in the Bajo Llojeta neighborhood of the city of La Paz. This is the first time she has sought a loan from IMPRO. The earnings from her improved situation will give her the means of being able to obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald tiene una imprenta donde realiza los trabajos de elaboración de sobres, papel membretado y folders.
Es soltero y trabaja solo, y la actividad que realiza es para poder cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y estudios.
Vive en la zona de Villa Fátima sector Huaychani de la ciudad de La Paz en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de una computadora y así poder realizar los trabajos de diseño grafico y también le servirá para sus estudios en la universidad.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Ronald has a printing business where he makes envelopes, paper with letterheads, and folders. He is single, and he works alone. He does this to be able to cover his food and educational expenses. He lives in his parents’ house in the Villa Fátima zone, Huaychani sector, city of La Paz. The loan is to buy a computer in order to be able to do graphic design. It will also help him with his university studies. This is the third time that he has asked for a loan from Impro. His good payment history makes him a good client. He has been a client since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer for graphic design work in his business

loans.name: Temps De La Grace Plus Group

texts.fr: Mazebo N. a été initiée dans le monde de micro entreprise par sa mère depuis 1980. Elle vendait des arachides et des légumes. Elle a commencé sa propre activité en 1988 avec un capital de $5. De 1988 – 1990, son commerce a bien prospéré jusqu’à réaliser un capital de plus de $500 qui lui avait servi de renforcer le stock de sa marchandise et d’acheter les machines de fabrication de la patte d’arachides. En 1991 et 1993, les pillages viennent emporter tout le matériel ainsi que le stock de sa marchandise et causer la faillite de son affaire. Mazebo repris la même activité timidement vers la fin des années quatre vingt dix. Après des différentes guerres et dépréciations de la monnaie locale qui ont déstabilisés son affaire, Mazebo est aujourd'hui encouragée par la stabilité progressive de la politique et de l’économie dans le pays. Car son activité en dépend. Le crédit qu’elle a reçu au mois de mai passé lui a permis d’acheter un gros sac d’arachides à revendre en vue d’accroitre le bénéfice lequel est actuellement de $10 par jour. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une boutique générale. Mazebo est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants âgés entre 8 et 24 ans. Trois d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Mazebo N. first got her start in the world of micro-enterprise together with her mother in 1980. She sold peanuts and vegetables. She began her own business in 1988 with a capital of US$ 5. From 1988-1990, her business prospered and reached a capital of US$ 500, which allowed her to increase her inventory and buy machines for making peanut butter.

In 1991 and 1993, the pillaging carried off her equipment and her whole inventory and thus caused her business to go bankrupt. Mazebo took the same business back up, timidly, around the end of the 90s. After the various wars and depreciations of the local currency, which destabilized her business, Mazebo today finds himself encouraged by the progressive stability of the politics and economics of her country. Her business depends on this stability. The loan she received this past month of May allowed her to buy a big sack of peanuts to resell, so as to increase her profit which presently stands at US$ 10 per day.

Mazebo is 42, married, and the mother of 5 children between 8 and 24 years old. Three of them are enrolled in school. Her ambition is to open a general store.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of one big sack of peanuts

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is a native of Cardona, Rizal, in the Philippines. She is forty-eight years old and has three children. Her oldest son, Chad Nezzar, is eighteen years old and a high school graduate. The youngest, Christian, is in elementary school. She also has a 9-year-old boy. Her husband, Victor, is forty-five years old and a partner in their business.

In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI partner of KIVA in the Philippines. With her first loan, she ventured into the retail selling of charcoal. She had observed the demand for charcoal in the market and knew that selling charcoal would bring them enough profit for their day-to-day living. Now on her second loan, she is requesting 10,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. The loan will be used to pay for 101 sacks of charcoal and a brand new weighing scale. Josephine is hopeful that, with the financial access that she has from ASHI, she can improve her business and make it grow.

Josephine came from a poor family. During her childhood, she dreamed of finishing her studies, but due to financial shortages she was not able to make it. Now, her dream for her own children is to send them to school until they finish college and find jobs, so that they will not suffer the life that she had. She hopes that her business will grow and be sustainable, and is looking forward to having a space at the market someday.

loans.use: To buy 101 sacks of charcoal and a new weighing scale.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario vive en casa de su madre en la calle Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; en la casa donde vive instaló una tienda donde vende llantas y repuestos de automóvil, este negocio lo inició con su esposa y ambos trabajan en el mismo. El crédito que solicitan es para aumentar su capital, comprar más llantas y repuestos y poder mantener esta fuente de ingresos con la cual mantienen a su familia.

Mario es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007 y su historial de pagos tiene calificación 1, lo cual significa muy buena, razón por la cual puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mario lives in his mother’s house on Jaimes Freyre Street in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz. He has set up a store in his house where he sells tires and replacement parts for automobiles. He started this business with his wife, and they both work in it. The loan is to buy more tires and replacement parts to be able to maintain this source of income with which he supports his family. Mario has been a client of Impro since 2007. His payment history is rated 1, which is very good. For that reason he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and vehicle replacement parts for his business

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche is thirty years old and married with a child. He sells sewing machine oil and sewing materials.  He is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more material to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Wumi

texts.en: Wumi is thirty years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and medicines.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El microempresario Justo García R. tiene 46 años de edad es acompañado, tiene 6 hijos, no puede leer y escribir, pero administra una pulpería desde hace mas de 6 años, además se dedica a comprar ostiones por canastas (con concha) y las vende por galones lo que le da un buen negocio ya que esta concha es bastante consumida en esta ciudad de Bluefields.

Con estos dos negocios don Justo ha podido mantener su hogar y darles estudios a sus hijos quienes además en los tiempos libres le ayudan con el negocio de las ostiones, este microempresario ya ha sido beneficiado con un préstamo por parte de kiva el cual pago puntualmente y le permitió hacer algunas mejoras en su casa y negocio.

Sin embargo el señor Justo García necesita se le financie para poder tener mas productos en su pulpería y poder comprar mas canastas de ostiones, ya que no cuenta con suficiente recursos para hacer dicha inversión.

Quiere comprar: 100 canastas de Ostiones que le cuestan US1 cada de canasta, 3 quintales de  azúcar que le cuestan US30 cada quintal, 3 frijoles que le cuestan US34 cada quintal, 3 harina que le cuestan US45 cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite que le cuestan US30 cada bidón, 12 unidades de café presto que le cuestan US3 cada unidad,5 bolsones de  papel higiénico que le cuestan US12 cada bolsón,  5 cajas de sopa maruchan que le cuestan US5 cada caja,  28 sacos de carbón que le cuestan US2 cada saco y 3 quintales de arroz americano que le cuestan US44 cada quintal.
texts.en:
The mirco businessman Justo García R. is 46. He is in a common law marriage, and he has six children. He cannot read or write, but he has been running his mini market for over six years. Also, he buys baskets of oysters (with the shell) and sells them by the gallon. This is a good business because they consume a lot of oysters here in the city of Bluefields. With these two businesses Justo has been able to support his household and give his children an education. The children help with the oyster business in their free time. This micro businessman has received one loan from Kiva, which he paid back punctually. This allowed him to make some improvements on his house and in his business. Nevertheless, Justo García needs a loan to be able to have more products in his mini market and to be able to buy more baskets of oysters. He does not have sufficient resources to cover those costs now. He wants to buy: 100 baskets of oysters at $1 per basket, 300 pounds of sugar at $30 per 100 pounds, 300 pounds of beans at $34 per 100 pounds, 300 pounds of flour at $45 per 100 pounds, 2 drums of oil at $30 per drum, 12 units of coffee at $3 per unit, 5 packages of toilet paper at $12 per package, 5 cases of Maruchan soup at $5 per case, 28 bags of coal at $2 per bag, and 300 pounds of American rice at $44 per 100 pounds.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oysters, sugar, flour oil, instant coffee, toilet paper, Maruchan soup, coal, and American rice

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 45 years old and married with six children. She sells bags of garri (roasted cassava) to make a living.  She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beef, sugar, beans, chicken, cooking oil, sodas, eggs, Presto coffee, charcoal, and American rice.

loans.name: Rafiu

texts.en:
Rafiu is 33 years old and single without a child. He is an aluminum fabricator and makes aluminum windows.

He is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more fabricating materials. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fabricating materials

loans.name: Rotimi

texts.en:
Rotimi is 49 years old and married with three children. He has a shop where he sells electronic parts.

He is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more electronic parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic parts to sell

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
ESTADO CIVIL, SOLTERA.

ELLA ESTUDIO LA CARRERA DE MEDICO GENERAL, CON SUS GANAS, PUSO EL CONSULTORIO MEDICO, PARA EMPEZAR CON EL NECESITA MEDICINAS, PARA PODER OFRECER SUS SERVICIOS.

COMENZO CONSULTANDO A DOMICILIO, Y POR PRACTICAS DE SU CARRERA.

DESDE EL AÑO 1999, QUE COMENZO SU PROPIO CONSULTORIO 

APOYEMOS ESTE CASO DE ESTA GRAN MUJER TAN EMPRENDEDORA.
texts.en:
Rocio is single. She studied general medicine and due to her personal drive she opened a medical practice; to be able to offer her services she needs medicines. She began consulting at individual’s homes and while practicing during her studies. Since 1999 she has had her own practice. Lets support this greatly entrepreneurial woman.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.es: Bonifacia de 51 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y decidida, vive en su propia casa, junto a su querido hijo Brando de 11 años, a quien quiere dar una buena educación. Cuando dejó su querido Pucará (Distrito de Puno) para venir a Juliaca, sólo tenía 17 años, pero traía consigo muchos deseos de superarse, fue entonces cuando decidió trabajar en la actividad que le habían enseñado sus padres. Desde ese momento, el tejido artesanal ha sido su actividad primordial y su principal fuente de ingresos, ya son 33 años que lleva en este negocio y sigue tejiendo con las mismas ganas que cuando comenzó, todo ese gusto por las artesanías lo refleja en sus tejidos, lo cual logra que sus prendas se vendan rápidamente. Bonifacia se divierte mucho tejiendo, puesto que así se distrae de sus problemas, anhela que su negocio prospere y tener una tienda de artesanías, donde pueda atender mucho mejor a sus clientes. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y quiere cumplir con todas sus cuotas, por que sabe que ha adquirido una responsabilidad con su banco comunal y con ella misma. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana y así podrá incrementar la cantidad de su producción.
texts.en:
Bonifacia is a hard working and determined 51 year old woman. She lives in the house she owns with her beloved 11 year old son Brando. She wants to give Brando a good education.

When she left her beloved Pucara (District of Puno) to go to Juliaca, she was only 17 years old. However, she brought with her the strong desire to improve her condition. It was then that she decided to work in the trade that her parents had taught her. From that time on, weaving has been her fundamental activity and the principle source of income.

She has been weaving for 33 years and continues weaving with the same enthusiasm as when she started. This love for her craft is reflected in her weaving, which helps them sell quickly. Bonifacia really enjoys weaving because it distracts her from her problems. Her greatest wish is that her business prospers and that she'll have a handicraft store where she can better serve her customers.

This is her third loan with MFP. She wants to repay all of the installments because she knows that she has assumed a responsibility with her community bank and with herself. With the requested loan for 1500 Nuevos Soles, she will buy more wool and in that way be able to increase her production capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Efe

texts.en:
Efe is 28 years old and single without a child. He is a shoe maker.

He is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more shoe materials to make more shoes to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make more shoes to sell

loans.name: Eda

texts.es: Eda es una mujer de 28 años muy trabajadora, que pone todo de su parte para salir adelante, trabaja desde que era muy joven, puesto que siempre tuvo en mente el querer mejorar su vida y lograr su independencia. Los sacrificios que hizo en su juventud empiezan a dar frutos, son ya más 10 años los que lleva trabajando como cobradora en combis (camionetas de transporte público), pero ya desde hace un año pudo hacerlo en su propia combi, la cual compró con sus ahorros y la ayuda de sus padres, su ruta es la Nº 14, una de las más transitadas de la ciudad de Juliaca. Lo que Eda espera para un futuro es comprar más carros y formar su propia empresa de transportes, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con los pasajeros y hacerles más amenos los largos viajes, pero lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día parada, abriendo y cerrando la puerta de la combi, aun así sabe que es su trabajo y que gracias a éste ha podido ir mejorando su vida. Es la segunda vez que Eda accede a un préstamo con MFP, su banco comunal la apoya y quiere que salga adelante, ya que es la socias que más se preocupa en que todos se beneficien por igual. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas llantas para su combi, para así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eda is a hardworking, 28 year old woman that does everything she can to get ahead. She has worked since she was very young, since she has always had the mentality of wanting to better her life and be independent. The sacrifices that she made as a child are now starting return results. She has been working for more than 10 years as ticket collector on combis (public transportation trucks) and for the past year she has been working with her own combi, which she bought with her savings and her parent's help. She works the #14 route, one of the most heavily trafficked in the city of Juliaca. In the future Eda hopes to buy more cars and form her own transport company. What she likes most about her work is talking with the passengers and making the long trips more enjoyable for them. The most difficult part is having to spend the whole day standing, opening and closing the combi's door. Even so, she knows it's her job and thanks to it she has been able to improve her life. This is the second time that Eda is requesting a loan from MFP; her communal bank supports her and wants her to get ahead, since it's the members themselves that are most concerned about everyone succeeding. With the 1,000 Nuevos Soles requested, she will buy new tires for her combi in order to provide a better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new tires for her public transport truck

loans.name: Miluska

texts.es: Miluska es una joven soltera de 19 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, a los cuales quiere ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ya que siente que es hora de poner su granito de arena para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Vendiendo zapatos ha sabido progresar en su vida, los novedosos modelos que ofrece la han convertido en la vendedora más solicitada del mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), sus clientes siempre se van muy contentos y satisfechos, además que reciben una buena atención por parte de Miluska. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y lo que no le agrada es permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, sin poder darse tiempo para algunas cosas personales. Para el futuro, le gustaría tener una tienda donde pueda vender mayor cantidad de zapatos y así, poco a poco ir ayudando a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, para que ellos ya no tengan que trabajar tanto. Miluska desea pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, siendo éste su tercer préstamo con MFP, ella no tiene dudas en poder lograrlo, sabe que tiene el apoyo de su banco comunal y es por eso que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus compañeros. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más zapatos, para incrementar la cantidad que vende normalmente.
texts.en:
Miluska is a single 19-year-old young woman. She lives in the home of her parents, who she hopes to help with household expenses, as she now feels it is time for her to contribute to improving her family's quality of life. Selling shoes has led her to progress in life. The new models she offers have made her the most popular vendor in the market of San José (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Her customers always leave very happy and satisfied, for they receive great treatment from Miluska. She has been in this line of work for three years, and what she does not like about it is staying in her stall all day, unable to take time for personal matters. In the future, she would like to have a store where she can sell a greater quantity of shoes, and thus help her parents little by little with their household costs so they won't have to work so much anymore. Miluska hopes to make her repayments punctually. This being her third loan with MFP, she doesn't doubt her ability to do so. She knows that she has the support of her communal bank, and she cares about the well-being of her partners. With the 1,800 soles she is requesting, she will buy more shoes to increase the quantity she can sell.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Benno Group

texts.fr: Ce groupement est composé d’une fille et de cinq(5) hommes, qui s’activent respectivement dans la couture et  au sein d’un   même atelier de couture, le  transport l’aviculture ; et le commerce. Ce groupe de jeunes dont la moyenne d’âge  est de 27ans habite a Mbour ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar le prêt sollicité leur permet de développer leur activité respective.
texts.en:
This group is composed of one girl and 4 men, who are active in sewing, in the same sewing workshop, transporting poultry, and commerce respectively. This group of young people whose average age is 27 live in Mbour, a coastal town situated 70 km from Dakar. The requested loan will permit them to develop their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering their little businesses

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: Petronila tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy sincera y alegre, vive en su propia casa junto a su familia y lo que más desea es darles una mejor calidad de vida. Su negocio es la venta por campaña, vende de todo; desde flores de plástico, sobreros, adornos, etc, según la temporada que se avecine, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado Las Mercedes (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca) y es muy concurrido por sus clientes, puesto que siempre tiene cosas novedosas que ofrecer. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su puesto sin poder salir a realizar sus asuntos personales. Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda más grande, no sabe muy bien de qué, tal vez ropa o electrodomésticos, pero está muy entusiasmada con la idea. Es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y ha decidido ser muy cuidadosa en la inversión de ese dinero, además que tiene siempre presente los consejos de los miembros más antiguos de su banco comunal. Los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en su capital de trabajo, así podrá comprar más productos en para mejorar su stock.
texts.en:
Petronila is 33 years old. She is a very sincere and happy woman. She lives in her own house with her family and what she desires most is to give them a better life. Her business is selling everything: plastic flowers, hats, decorations, etc., depending on the upcoming season. Her stall is located in the Las Mercedes market (an important market in the city of Juliaca), and she is very popular with her customers because she always has something new to offer. What she likes most about her work is conversing with the vendors around her and finding out what's going on around the market. She has been doing this work for five years, and the most difficult part for her is having to stay in her stall all day without being able to attend to her personal matters. In the future, she hopes to have a larger store. She is not sure what she would sell, maybe clothing or home electronics, but she is very enthusiastic about the idea. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has decided to be very careful with the investment of this money, and she always has the advice of the older members of her communal bank. The 1,500 soles she is seeking will be invested in working capital so she can buy more products to stock.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia es una madre de familia muy amorosa, tiene 29 años y vive en la casa de su esposo Carlos, de 30 años, tienen una pequeña hija de 2 años, Marilyn, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo al que Claudia se dedica es la impresión gráfica, su local está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, por lo cual, es muy concurrido por sus cliente. Trabaja a pedido, y entre las solicitudes más comunes que tiene están los calendarios, recordatorios de celebraciones familiares, volantes, afiches, etc. Ya son 5 años los que viene realizando en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su negocio es diseñar los trabajos para luego verlos impresos, pero lo más difícil es tener que soportar los fuertes olores que sueltan algunos químicos que usa en su imprenta, aun así sabe que tiene que realizar un buen trabajo, ya que es la actividad que escogió. Para más adelante desea tener una imprenta mucho más grande, y así poder brindarle una mejor vida a su familia. Este es el primer préstamo de Claudia con MFP, se siente muy segura de poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y participativa. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará materiales nuevos para mejorar la calidad de sus impresiones.
texts.en:
Claudia is the mother of a very loving family. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband, 30-year-old Carlos, and their young daughter, two-year-old Marilyn, who is her motivation. Claudia's business is graphic printing. Her shop is located in the center of the city, so it is very busy with customers. She works by order, and among her most popular orders are calendars, reminders for family events, flyers, posters, etc. She has now been doing this work for five years, and what she likes best is designing the work and then seeing them printed. The hardest part is having to stand the strong odors of the chemicals she uses to print, but she knows that she must do a good job, and this is the work she chose. In the future, she would like to have a much larger printing office, and thus be able to provide a better life for her family. This is Claudia's first loan with MFP.
