She is very confident that she will be able to make her payments on time. She is a very happy and participative member in her communal bank. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will buy new materials to improve the quality of her printing.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for printing

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime tiene 50 años, y aunque el tiempo ha pasado, no ha perdido las ganas de salir adelante, vive solo en su propia casa, ya que sus hijos se hicieron independientes rápidamente. El trabajo que realiza actualmente le brinda muchas comodidades, se dedica a repartir licores a tiendas y bodegas en los distintos distritos de Puno, sus productos los compra de una distribuidora local, es por eso que siempre tiene mercadería para llevar y cubrir los pedidos que le hacen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite viajar por toda la región de Puno, conociendo nuevos lugares. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y espera en el futuro comprar su propio auto para trasladar sus productos, ya que la que usa actualmente es alquilado, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es subir y bajar las cajas de la movilidad, ya que esto le resulta muy cansado. Este es el quinto préstamo de Jaime con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy responsable. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería, para así tener más productos para vender.
texts.en:
Jaime is 50 years old, and although time has passed, he has not lost his determination to get ahead. He lives alone in his own house, as his children became independent very quickly. The work he does now brings him many comforts. He distributes liquors to stores and warehouses in different districts of Puno. He buys his products from a local distributor, so he always has merchandise on hand to fill his orders. What he likes most about his job is that it allows him to travel all around Puno, getting to know new places. He has been doing this work for four years, and hopes to buy his own car in the future to move his products, as the one he uses now is rented. The most difficult part of his job is loading and unloading the boxes from the vehicle, as it leaves him very tired. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He hopes to be punctual in his repayments so he doesn't cause any problems for his communal bank, in which he is very responsible. With this loan of 3,000 soles, he will purchase more merchandise so he can sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 60 años, es un vecino muy querido y conocido en su barrio, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. Uno de los restaurantes más conocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca es el “Fundo Viejo”, el cual está administrado por Luis, quien a la edad de 30 años decidió ingresar al negocio de la comida, hoy, 30 años después, se da cuenta que la idea no fue mala, y que con el pasar de los años sus ingresos económicos, gracias a la fama que tiene su restaurante, han ido creciendo. Además Luis no solo administra el restaurante, sino que también es el cocinero, y la sazón de sus comidas es exquisita, es por eso que su negocio siempre está repleto de clientes. Su deseo a futuro es abrir una sucursal, con la cual pueda hacer más conocido su negocio, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo, es atender a la gran cantidad de comensales que tiene y aunque sabe que eso lo tiene que hacer todos los días, no decae en su afán de seguir trabajando hasta alcanzar sus metas. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Luis con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso, por lo cual es muy querido en su grupo. Los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en la compra de nuevas sillas, mesas y en el arreglo de la infraestructura del restaurante.
texts.en:
Luis is 60 years old, and a very beloved and well known neighbor in his area. He lives in his own house, and what he desires most is a quiet retirement. One of the most well known restaurants in the city of Juliaca is "Fundo Viejo", which is run by Luis. At 30 years of age, he decided to start a food business, and today, 30 years later, he realizes this was not a bad idea. With the passing years, his income, thanks to the popularity of his restaurant, has grown. Not only does Luis manage the restaurant, he is also the chef, and the flavor of his food is exquisite--that is why is business is always full of customers. In the future, he wishes to open another branch to make his business more well known. The most difficult part of his job is attending to the large number of diners. Although he knows this is what he has to do everyday, it does not detract from his eagerness to reach his goals. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He has always been very punctual in his repayments and hopes to do so again. He is a very responsible and respectful member in his communal bank, for which he is well liked in his group. He will invest this loan of 3,000 soles in the purchase of new tables and chairs, and to repair the infrastructure of the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture and make repairs

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús M. A.  vive el municipio de Cojutepeque ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. A sus 54 años de edad Manuel sigue siendo un hombre muy trabajador él se dedica a la manufacturación de diversos artículos en lamina, Manuel tiene 45 años de experiencia comenzó cuando era tan solo un pequeño niño, ahora el continua ampliando su negocio y con toda su experiencia obtenida le permite que muchas personas confíen en su trabajo es por ello que Manuel tiene una clientela muy estable, ahora el está solicitando un crédito para compra de materia prima, para la elaboración de canales.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús M. A. lives in the Cojutepeque area of Cuscatlán. At 54 years of age Manuel continues to be a very hardworking man who makes things out of laminate. Manuel has 45 years of experience since he began when he was a young boy. He continues to grow his business and has a stable base of clients who trust his work since he has gained so much experience over the years. He is asking for loan to buy raw materials to build canals.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y carismática, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 queridos hijos, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio es muy concurrido, sobre todo por los niños, tiene una local de videojuegos, el cual le ha dado buenos resultados, ya que le deja el dinero necesario para brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos. Juegos como Tekken, Winning Eleven, Smackdown vs Raw, son los que ofrece a sus clientes, quienes prefieren su local debido a los juegos novedosos y a las máquinas en buen estado que tiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la alegría que sienten los niños al jugar, lleva 10 años en esta actividad, y lo que considera más difícil es controlar a los niños, ya que mucho quieren salir sin pagar, aun así Maria se siente muy feliz con su trabajo. Para un futuro cercano espera incrementar el número de máquinas de videojuego que tiene actualmente. Este es el tercer préstamo de Maria con MFP, en sus primeros créditos ha sido muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará otra máquina de videojuegos, con la cual espera aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hard working and charismatic woman who lives with her two dear children. What she most wishes for is to improve their quality of life. She has a very busy video arcade that is popular with children. This business has produced good returns and provides her with the money to give her children a good education. She has original games like Tekken, Winning Eleven, Smackdown vs Raw so her clients prefer her arcade (also because the machines are in good condition). What she likes most about her business is watching the kids enjoy themselves while they play. She’s been in this business for ten years. The most difficult part for her is controlling the children as many want to leave without paying. Even so, Maria is happy with her job. In the near future, she would like to increase the number of video game machines she has. This is Maria’s third loan with MFP. She was very punctual with her first loans and expects to be again. She is a very lively and responsible member of her communal bank. She will buy another video game machine with the 800 soles asked for and hopes to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una máquina de video juegos

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadores Sin Limites Group

texts.en:
Angela E. is the group leader of the Mujeres Luchadores sin Limites group. Business runs in Angela’s blood. Both of her parents had small business and taught her business skills since she was a girl.

Angela now has three businesses of her own. Her main business is a clothing business, where she takes orders for clothing in the community and buys her inventory on a per-order basis. In addition, she also runs a small store out of her house that sells candy, snacks and other staple food items. Her businesses have suffered from the current recession, as she notes: “There is less money on the street these days.” Angela will use the loan to restock her inventory.

Angela is the single mother of three boys, ages 18, 13 and 10. Since her husband left her, she has become the breadwinner of the home, and has had to support her sons with the income from her businesses. Angela has big dreams for her businesses. She hopes to be very successful, to expand her businesses and to be able continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Myrho

texts.es: Myrho es una joven luchadora y persistente en sus metas, tiene 27 años y vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a sus 2 hijos; Brigith de 7 y Alex de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Sus días son largos y agotadores, camina por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca distribuyendo cajas de licores a las diversas tiendas y bodegas, pero también lleva su mercadería hasta otros distintos del departamento de Puno. Para Myrho, la actividad que realiza es muy beneficiosa, ya que aprovecha muy bien sus ratos libres para atender los deberes de su hogar, lleva 5 años en este negocio y lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar tanto, ya que esto disminuye sus fuerzas y evita que venda su mercadería con muchas más ganas, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo para salir adelante. Para un futuro cercano espera tener un negocio propio en un local estable, tal vez una tienda de abarrotes, todavía no se decide por el rubro. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada, por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados aumentará la mercadería que distribuye, para poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Myrho is a young fighter who perseveres in order to reach her goals. She is 27 years old and lives in a rented room with her two children: Brigith who is seven and Alex who is three. Her children are what motivate her to do all she does. Myrho’s days are long and arduous. She walks the streets of Julilaca distributing boxes of liquor to various stores and warehouses. She also brings her merchandise to districts outside of Puno. This business is beneficial for Myrho and she takes advantage of her free moments to take care of her household chores. She has been doing this for five years and what she likes least is having to walk so much because it makes her weak and too tired to sell with much gusto. But she knows she has to do this to get ahead. In the near future, she would like to have her own business in an established place – possibly a grocery store. She hasn’t decided exactly what it will be yet. This is her third loan with MFP and she expects to be able to make her payments on time so she doesn’t cause any problems for the other members of her communal bank. She is well respected because she is so responsible. She will increase the merchandise she sells with the 1, 500 she has requested in order to improver her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Cheikh est un commerçant, il vend des objets d’arts dans la zone touristique de saly située à 80 km de Dakar la capitale sénégalaise. Il a 32ans, il est marié et est père de deux enfants. Il est dans ce secteur depuis 2000. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille et de renforcer son commerce. Avec le prêt solliciter il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement  acheté plus de marchands pour préparer la saison touristique.
texts.en:
Cheikh is a businessman. He sells souvenirs in the touristic area of Saly, situated 80 km from Dakar, the Senegalese capital. He is 32, married, and the father of 2 children. He has been working in this sector since 2000. The income from his business allows him to support his family and bolster his business. With the requested loan, he is going to add to his working capital and buy more merchandise in preparation for the tourist season.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Clotilda

texts.es: Clotilda tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 15 años se dedica a las actividades ganaderas y agrícolas, tiene 5 vacas, 4 ovejas y cultiva maíz y papa. Después D. varios meses D. cuidar sus productos, venD. sus cosechas a los intermediarios, que son las personas que compran las verduras directamente a los agricultores y luego las distribuyen a los comerciantes minoristas en los diferentes mercados. Clotilda también venD. sus animales en las ferias ganaderas D. su localidad, su esposo y sus hijos la ayudan a realizar ambas tareas, las cuales, muchas veces, requieren D. largas jornadas D. trabajo, pero que son compensadas con las ganancias obtenidas.Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y viene participando del trabajo en un banco comunal, por lo que se siente respaldada por sus compañeros y compañeras D. grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será utilizado en la compra D. sacos D. abono para su próxima campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Clotilda is 54 years old and lives with her husband and four children in their own home. She has worked with cattle, and in agriculture, for 15 years and has five cows and four sheep. She cultivates corn and potatoes. After caring for her products, she sells them to the intermediaries, the people who buy vegetables directly from farmers and then sell them to small business owners in different markets. Clotilda also sells her animals in the cattle fairs of her area. Her husband and children help her with all of her tasks, tasks that sometimes involve long days of work, but they are compensated with what they earn. This is her third loan with MFP and she is a member of a communal bank. She feels supported by her fellow group members. She will use the money asked for to buy sacks of fertilizer for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de abono

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Itzel

texts.es:
CASADA Y TIENE UN HIJO DE 4 AÑOS EDAD 

SE DEDICA A A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE JOYERIA DE PLATA.

COMENZO CON EL NEGOCIO, POR LA RAZON DE QUE QUERIA APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, DESDE EL AÑO 2005 QUE LA IDEA DE UN NEGOCIO PROPIO SE HIZO REALIDAD, GRACIAS AL APOYO DE SU MADRE QUIEN LE ACONSEJO QUE SERIA BUENA IDEA.

EL CLARO EJEMPLO DE SU MADRE QUE SE DEDICO ALA VENTA DE LIBROS, PARA MANTENER A SU FAMILIA, LA IMPULSO PARA PODER SEGUIR ADELANTE, AHORA PIDE AL APOYO PARA ASI COMPRAR MAS JOYERIA Y PODER OFRECER MAYOR VARIEDAD A SUS CLIENTES.
texts.en:
Itzel is married and has one 4-year-old child. She dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of silver jewelry. She started this business because she wanted to help her husband with household expenses. Her idea of her own business became a reality in 2005 thanks to the support that her mother gave her by advising her that it would be a good idea. Her mother who dedicated herself to the sale of book to support her family set the example, which impelled her to continue moving forward. Currently she is asking for support to purchase more jewelry, which will allow her to offer a better variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo tiene 25 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, con sus hermanos. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, fue aceptada por la línea de belleza por medio de la recomendación de unas amigas, ahora vende ofreciendo sus productos diariamente por medio de catálogos. También aprovecha sus momentos libres en su centro de estudios para vender, desde que empezó con esta actividad ha visto los resultados de su trabajo, los cuales le permiten tener sus propios ingresos económicos. Lo que a Consuela la motiva son las comisiones que recibe cuando cumple  sus ventas y los obsequios. Para más adelante desea vender también prendas de vestir. Esta es la primera  vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de su actual banco comunal, el cual ya tiene más de 2 años, por su parte, se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando será para invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en cosméticos.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 25 years old and lives at home with her parents and brothers and sisters. She has been selling cosmetics for more than a year now. She was hired by the beauty line on the recommendation of some friends. She now sells her products on a daily basis by catalog. She also takes advantage of the free time she has at school to sell. Since she began doing this, she has seen that her efforts allow her to have her own income. Consuela is motivated by the commissions she earns when she makes sales, as well as the gifts. In the future, she would like to sells clothing. This is her first loan with MFP and she was invited to participate by her current bank, which is two years old. She promises to be punctual with her payments and will invest the requested money in the purchase of a greater quantity of cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael Antonio C. vive en un pequeño cantón llamado el espino ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Rafael vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas Maria de 6 años de edad y Ruth de 5 años de edad, ambas niñas van a kínder. Rafael se dedica a la agricultura siembra granos básicos y también comercializa frutas; Rafael se las ingenia mucho de cómo aumentar sus ingresos familiares es por ello que a veces se va a trabajar como albañil ya que estos son trabajos eventuales y  le dejan un poco más de su margen de ganancias mensuales, pero ahora el solicita un crédito por que quiere invertir en la compra de frutas.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio C. lives in a small neighborhood called El Espino located in the department of La Paz. Rafael lives with his wife and two daughters; Maria is 6 years old and Ruth is 5 years old, both girls are in kindergarten. Rafael dedicates himself to agriculture and plants basic grains and also sells fruit; Rafael is always thinking of ways to increase his family’s income and because of that he sometimes works as a mason, given that these jobs are temporary and allow him to increase his monthly earnings. He is requesting a loan because he would like to invest in the purchase of fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia tiene 44 años, vive con su hijo de 19 años en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales de marcas reconocidas, diariamente visita a sus clientes durante la mañana, para hablarles acerca de las bondades de los productos y repartir pedidos. Adicionalmente, por las tardes, vende comida en la puerta de su casa, ambas actividades las realiza generalmente sola, sólo en algunas ocasiones le ayuda su hermana. Hasta el momento estos negocios le han dado buen resultado, por lo que tiene planes de seguir trabajando e invirtiendo para el crecimiento de su capital. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo en MFP, y el dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de una caja de suplementos vitamínicos y otros productos.
texts.en:
Felicia is 44 years old and lives with her 19-year-old son in her own house. She dedicates herself to the sale of natural medicines of well-known brands; she visits her clients daily in the mornings to talk to them about her products’ good qualities and to hand out ordered items. In addition, in the afternoons she sells food at her doorstep; both activities she usually carries out alone, though in some occasions her sister helps. Up to this point these businesses have resulted well, and because of this she has plans to continue working and investing to increase her profits. This is the fifth time that she is requesting a loan from MFP, and the money that she is requesting will be used to purchase a box of vitamin supplements and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (vitamin supplements and other products).

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gavidia

texts.es: Gavidia tiene 23 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Desde hace más de un año vende libros a domicilio, desde temprano por la mañana hasta la tarde, recorre las calles de su ciudad ofreciendo libros académicos para escolares. Gavidia visita a sus clientes de casa en casa, tanto para cobrar cuando los deja al crédito, como para ofrecer las novedades. Cuando vende al crédito obtiene mayores márgenes de ganancia, pero también debe asegurarse que le pagarán a tiempo. Para más adelante, Gavidia desea tener un puesto estable de venta de libros e incursionar en la venta de útiles escolares. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de los miembros que  promueve la unidad en su banco comunal, el cual lleva el nombre de “Unión Cahuide al Tambo”. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de libros para aumentar sus posibilidades de ventas.
texts.en:
Gavida is 23 years old and lives with her parents. For over a year she has been selling books door-to-door. Working from early morning until late afternoon, she travels the streets of her city selling school books for students. Gavida visits her clients in their homes, both to receive payments when she has sold them books on credit, and to offer them the latest arrivals. When she sells on credit she earns more, but she has to make sure she will be paid in a timely manner. Eventually she hopes to establish a locale from which she can sell her books, and in addition she wants to offer school supplies. This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she is one of the most active members of her community bank, which is called “Union Cahuide al Tambo.” The loan proceeds will be used to purchase more books to sell, in order for her to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - purchase books for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina tiene 35 años, vive en una casa arrendada junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, los cuales le solicitan cuando visita de casa en casa a sus vecinos, familiares y amigos. Todos los días, empieza su trabajo luego de preparar los alimentos para sus hijos en casa. Para abastecerse, cada quincena de mes viaja a la ciudad capital, Lima, para comprar las prendas que necesita. Este negocio le ha resultado muy rentable por la habilidad que tiene para las ventas, además de ser una actividad que disfruta mucho hacerla. Para un futuro cercano, Gina mejorar sus ventas disponiendo de mayor capital para aumentar su mercadería. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, porque le ha traído beneficios, tanto para crecer como persona y en su negocio. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de ropa al por mayor, viajará  nuevamente muy pronto a Lima.
texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and lives in a rented house along with her husband and their four children. For the past 2 years she has worked by selling clothing, for which she receives orders when she goes house-to-house visiting neighbors, family and friends. After preparing meals for her children in the morning, she goes out to work. Every two weeks she travels to Peru’s capital city, Lima, to replenish her stock of clothing. This is a good business for Gina, as she is skilled at selling and she very much enjoys her work. In the near future she wants to increase her sales volume by having access to more working capital. This will be her fourth loan from MFP, and she is pleased with the results that come from working with her community bank both in a business sense and in a personal sense. The funds will be used for the purchase of clothing wholesale, and she plans to travel again to Lima very soon.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - purchase clothing for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
CASADO Y TIENE 3 HIJOS.

SE DEDICA A ATENDER SU NEGOCIO, UN PEQUEÑO RESTAURANTE QUE TIENE, DONDE LA ELABORA LA COMIDA.

EN BUSCA DE UN INGRESO EXTRA, COMENZO CON EL RESTAURANTE EN CASA, DESDE EL AÑO 2005.

GRACIAS A SU ESPOSA, QUIEN LE DIO LA IDEA DE ESTAR EN UN TANDA, CON LA CUAL LA UTILIZARON PARA INVERTIR EN MESAS Y SILLAS, PARA ACONDICIONAR EL NEGOCIO.

AHORA PIDE AL APOYO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS SILLAS YA QUE TIENE ALGUNAS EN MAL ESTADO Y TAMBIEN PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCANCIA Y PODER OFRECER  EL MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married and has 3 children. He dedicates himself to attending to his business, a small restaurant that he owns where he makes food. In search for extra income, he opened his restaurant in his home in 2005. Thanks to his wife, who gave him the idea to become part of a tanda (an informal group in which members can borrow and lend money), he gained access to the money to be able to invest in tables and chairs and to also air-condition their business. He now asks for support to purchase more chairs given that some are in bad shape, and to purchase more merchandise to offer a better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods (chairs).

loans.name: Karla Yaneth

texts.es: Karla Yaneth V. M. vive en el departamento de La Libertad, Karla es una joven mujer de tan 21 años de edad con muchas responsabilidades, ella está a cargo de sus 3 hermanos que aun son menores de edad todos estudiando en la escuela, también Karla es madre soltera de Cristofer su hijo de 4 años de edad. Karla recibe remesas de sus padres, que por motivos económicos están lejos de ella y sus hermanos, pero Karla es una mujer muy trabajadora y hace tres años monto un comedor en el  mercado municipal del puerto de La Libertad donde todos los días vende desayunos y almuerzos, ella solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus platillos, principalmente granos básicos ya que son los que más utiliza.
texts.en:
Karla Yaneth Velasquez M. lives in the Department of La Libertad. She is a young lady, 21 years old, with a lot of responsibilities. In addition to taking care of three younger brothers, all in school, Karla also is a single mother and has to care for a young son Cristofer, who is 4 years old. Karla receives some financial help from her parents, who, for financial reasons, live very far from her. But Karla is very hard working, and three months ago she set up a stand in the city market in the port of La Libertad from which she sells breakfast and lunch. She is requesting this loan to purchase the food she will need for the meals – especially cereal grains which she uses a lot.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for restaurant

loans.name: Walter Omar

texts.es: Walter Omar R. M. vive en el departamento de La Libertad junto a sus padres, un hermano, su hijo de 6 años de edad y su esposa. Walter tiene 26 años de edad se dedica a su negocio familiar que se encuentra ubicado en un rancho donde el  mismo es el propietario, en ese rancho se venden bebidas y comida, también Walter tiene un  empleo fijo en la Alcaldía municipal, pero este crédito lo solicita por que quiere invertir  en productos para comercializar en el rancho.
texts.en:
Walter Omar R. M. lives in the department of La Libertad with his parent, a brother, his 6-year-old son, and his wife. Walter is 26 years old and dedicates himself to his family business, which is located on a ranch that he owns; at this ranch they sell drinks and food. Walter also has a permanent job in the municipal mayor’s office. He is requesting this loan because he would like to invest in products to sell at his ranch.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his business.

loans.name: Rufina Antonia

texts.es: Rufina Antonia M. D. R. vive el municipio D. Soyapango ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Rufina tiene  40 años D. edad, tiene dos hijos Geraldina D. 21 años D. edad que está cursando 2do año D. bachillerato y José D. 12 años D. edad  que estudia 6to grado. Rufina es una madre muy trabajadora para sacar adelante a su hijos, ella se dedica a la confección D. ropa y para aumentar sus ingresos los días sábado y domingo elabora almuerzos y pupusas, este crédito ella lo solicita por que quiere comprar tela para fabricar prendas D. vestir y también quiere comprar suficiente materia prima para la elaboración D. las pupusas.
texts.en:
Rufina Antonia M. D. R. lives in municipality of Soyapango located in the department of San Salvador. Rufina is 40 years old, and has two children; Geraldina is 21 years old and in her 2nd year of high school, and José who is 12 years old is in 6th graD.. Rufina is a mother who works hard to get her children ahead in life; she dedicates herself to making clothing and to increase her income she sells lunches and pupusas (a stuffed thick tortilla like El Salvadorian dish) on Saturdays and Sundays. This loan that she has solicited is to purchase fabrics to make clothing, and she would also like to purchase enough basic materials to make pupusas.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials.

loans.name: Umbrella Of Komeh Avenue Group

texts.en:
This is Abdul J. K., Aminata K. and Musa L.. They called their group “Umbrella of Komeh Avenue”. This will be the third time these entrepreneurs are seeking a loan from Kiva lenders. Previously, each one of them received Le 600,000 which they have successfully repaid with ease.

Now, they are requesting a new loan of Le 800,000 for each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. This will help them a lot. It will enable them make more profit and improve their standard of living.

Abdul (left) is the leader of this group. Abdul was born in the town of Magburaka, fifteen miles from Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-one years of age, and married with six children. One of his children is in a teachers training college and the others are in secondary schools.

Abdul sells medicines and owns an Okada (a motorbike used as a taxi). He will invest this loan in his pharmacy. He has been a businessman for over twenty-two years now.

loans.use: To invest in his pharmacy

loans.name: Maladoh Group

texts.en:
This is Issa M. K., Bai K., Fatmata K. and Isatu M.. They called their group “Maladoh”, named after the group leader’s middle name.

This is not the first loan they are getting from SMT/Kiva. They have received several loans and each of these loans has created meaningful impacts into the businesses and personal lives of these entrepreneurs.

Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 800,000 each to further strengthen their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and improve on their standard of living.

Issa M. K. (left) is the leader of this group. Issa was born in Mile Ninety-one, in the Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. He is thirty-two years of age, and married with three children. Two of his children are in secondary schools and one is in primary school. Maladoh’s wife is also a businesswoman.

Maladoh sells ready-to-wear-clothes, slippers and sneakers. He has been a businessman for more than ten years now.

loans.use: To invest in his clothing business

loans.name: Tawopaneh Multi-Purpose Group

texts.en:
This is Adama C., Salamatu G. and Hassanatu K.. They named their group “Tawopaneh Multi-Purpose”.

This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have created meaningful impact into the lives of these borrowers. Previously, each of them received a loan of Le 600,000.

Having repaid the last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 800,000 each to further strengthen their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to increase the size and quality of their businesses and consequently make better profit and improve on their standards of living. 

Adama C. (left) is the leader of this group. Adama is thirty-eight years of age and was born in Mabonto village, about fifteen miles from Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a farmer and they have seven children. Her children are still attending school: some are in primary and others in secondary school.

Adama sells bars of soap and market food. She has been a businesswoman for fifteen years.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es: Claudia Lisseth L. D. E. vive en el municipio D. Apopa ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, Claudia vive con su esposo y dos hijas Alejandra D. 9 años D. edad y Andrea D. 6 años D. edad ambas estudian en la escuela. Claudia se dedica al comercio,  ella venD. productos como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc. Claudia mantiene un inventario D. variedad D. productos en su casa, pero también trabaja por pedidos ya que también se ocupa D.  revista en la que las personas pueden ver los artículos y pedirlos. El método D. trabajo D. Claudia es visitar a sus clientes D. casa en casa con la revista y con un inventario D. la mercadería que ella dispone, ella solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar más productos para aumentar su inventario en existencia.
texts.en:
Claudia Lisseth L. D. E. lives in the Apopa municipality, which is located in the San Salvador department. Claudia lives with her husband and her two daughters; Alejandra is 9, and Andrea is 6. Both girls attend school. Claudia sells products like perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc. Claudia keeps an inventory of a variety of products in her house. But, she also works by taking orders. She also has a catalog where people can see items and order them. Claudia’s method of working is to visit her customers door to door with the catalog and some inventory of the available merchandise. She is asking for this loan because she wants to buy more products to increase her existing inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to increase her inventory

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Fanny Miryan

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. FANNY, vive en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de san Sebastián.

Nuestra socia tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 11 años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su profesión, ella es contadora pública y el motivo por el cuál está solicitando el préstamo es para poder invertir ese dinero en la compra de accesorios para su computadora.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Fanny lives in the city of Cusco, which is in the San Sebastián district. She is 40, and she is the single mother of an 11 year old son. She alternates her activities between her home and her profession. She is a public accountant. The reason she is asking for a loan is to be able to buy accessories for her computer. She is grateful to have this means to borrow funds, and she commits to complete repayment of the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy accessories for her computer

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gladis, ella es natural del Cusco y vive en el distrito de San Sebastián.

Nuestra socia tiene 41 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos de (20,16,11) años, ella alterna sus labores del hogar con la atención casi a tiempo completo de su Panadería, por lo que ella solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de insumos, tales como harina, levadura, leña y otros más.

Nuestra socia se muestra muy agradecida y feliz por el préstamo otorgado y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Gladis is a native of Cusco, and she lives in the San Sebastián district. She is 41 and married. She has three children ages 20, 16, and 11. She alternates between her house work and her almost full time attention to her bakery. She is asking for a loan to buy bakery supplies such as flour, leavening, and wood, among others. She is grateful and happy to have this means to borrow funds, and she commits to complete repayment of the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Eleuteria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Eleuteria de los Ángeles M. tiene la edad de 47 años, es madre soltera. Y tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de vegetales y verduras. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado central, anteriormente solo tenia un pequeño canasto de verduras todos los días por la mañana se levanta muy temprano en busca de sobrevivir. En la actualidad tiene mayor mercadería y variedad de la misma, con los créditos que se le ha otorgado sus hijos han podido estudiar y mantener este negocio. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de plátanos, cebollas, tomates, piña entre otros. Su sueño es mantener siempre este negocio que tanto le a servido en su vida.
texts.en:
Eleuteria de los Ángeles M. is a 47-year-old single mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She has been making a living selling fruits and vegetables for the past 10 years. Her business is located in the central market. Previously she only had a small basket to sell vegetables from every morning after waking up very early looking to survive. Now she has more products and more variety, and thanks to the loans she's received she's been able to maintain her business and provide for her children's education. She plans to use the money she's requesting for the purchase of bananas, onions, tomatoes and pineapple, among other fruits and vegetables. Her goal is to always keep this business that has been such an aid in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bananas, onions, tomatoes and pineapple, among other fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina S. V. tiene la edad de 53 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos y ropa. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Rosa es una buena mujer, y a pesar de las dificultades que ha enfrentado en la vida ha salido adelante con este negocio. Es por esto que solicita financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de lápiz labial, pinturas de uñas, cremas, perfumes, delineadores, ropa para niños, ropa para damas entre otros. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina S. V. is a 53-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are grown up and work. Rosa has been making a living selling cosmetics and clothing for more than three years. She is a good woman who has made headway with her business despite encountering hardships in her life. That is why she is requesting a loan to put toward purchasing lipstick, nail polish, lotions, perfumes, eyeliner, and clothing for women and children, among other items. Her biggest dream is to make improvements on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lipstick, nail polish, lotions, perfumes, eyeliner, and clothing for women and children, among other items

loans.name: Elvin Antonio

texts.es: Elvin Antonio S. C. tiene 32 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y asiste a clases. La actividad económica de Elvin es la venta de camarones. Comenzó este negocio hace más de 9 años. Inicio con muy pocos camarones por lo que no tenía mucha experiencia en este negocio y no sabia si realmente tendría algún éxito, algunas veces salía a las calles a ofrecer sus productos con su hijo porque no tenía una persona que lo cuidara, pero aun así con el cansancio de recorrer muchos lugares, su hijo y el visitaban a sus clientes con una sonrisa en su rostro. Actualmente Elvin recurre a un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo que se utilizara para la compra de camarones para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El sueño de Elvin es que su hijo logre finalizar sus estudios para que el día de mañana sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Elvin Antonio S. C. is a 32-year-old married father with one son, who is in school. Elvin makes a living selling shrimp. He started his business more than nine years ago with very few shrimp because he didn't have much experience and didn't know whether he could really find some success. Sometimes he walked the streets offering his products with his son because he didn't have anyone else who could care for him. But even though they tired from traveling all over, he and his son always received customers with a smile on their faces. Currently he is requesting a loan that he will use to purchase more shrimp to satisfy the demands of his customers. Elvin's dream is for his son to successfully complete his education and one day become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more shrimp for his business

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús Juárez Méndez tiene 63 años, es un hombre soltero. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. El negocio de Manuel nació por que anteriormente su esposa se hacia cargo del negocio, pero desafortunadamente su esposa fallece y Manuel se encarga de que este negocio no desaparezca, ya que su esposa le había puesto mucho empeño y quería mantenerlo a como fuera lugar a pesar de la difícil situación económica. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y gaseosas. El sueño de Manuel es proporcionarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús Juárez Méndez is 63 and single. He cares for his 3 children and runs a grocery store. He has had this business for more than 10 years. Manuel's wife used to have this business, but unfortunately she passed away. He took over the business so it wouldn't disappear since his wife had put a lot of effort into it. He wanted to keep it going despite of his difficult economic situation. The money he is requesting is for working capital so he can buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, oil, and soft drinks. His dream is to provide his children with a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles H. C. tiene 27 años. Es una mujer soltera. Tiene un hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica de María es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio consiste en la comercialización de cosméticos ambulantes y surge por la necesidad de continuar estudiando y es por medio de este negocio que realiza esta idea, además María es una mujer muy joven y luchadora y es por eso que solicita los financiamientos destinados para capital de trabajo para la compra de lápiz labial, perfumes y cremas. El sueño de María es ampliar su negocio para que su hijo lo administre en un futuro.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles H. C. is 27 years old. She is single and has a son. María sells cosmetics and has been doing this for more than 5 years. Her business consists of selling cosmetics as a street vendor. She needs to continue studying and it is thanks to this business that she is able to do so. María is young and determined and this is why she is requesting a loan for working capital so she can buy lipsticks, perfumes, and creams. María’s dream is to grow her business so that her son can run it someday.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Angela Calderón G. tiene 49 años de edad, esta casada y su esposo también ayuda con los gastos de hogar, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos viven por su propia cuenta y dos aun viven junto a ella, la actividad económica a la que se dedica Angela es a la venta de rifas y fritanga los fines de semana, por dificultades económicas la madre de Angela no pudo darle el estudio, es por esto que ella se gana la vida de forma humilde pero honrada, el negocio de la rifa consiste en vender una serie de números a un valor de C$ 15 de esta manera sobre quien caiga la suerte se gana C$1.000, pero ella desea hacer una rifa de mayor cantidad, para esto necesita mas capital, además ella desea invertir capital de trabajo en la compra de granos básicos para seguir cocinando fritanga y mantener a sus clientes ya que tiene muchos, pues cocina exquisito y es aseada, por lo tanto su mas grande deseo es expandir la venta de sus  rifas y hacer una pequeña comideria que le permita obtener mas ganancias, y este es el motivo que le impulso solicitar un financiamiento pues hoy en día aquí la devaluación esta haciendo los productos mas caros y aun ella debe de luchar por sus otros dos hijos.
texts.en:
Angela Calderón G. is 49 years old. She is married and her husband also helps with the household expenses. They have 4 children, of whom two live independently and two still live with her. Angela sells raffle tickets and fried foods on the weekends. For economic reasons, Angela’s mother wasn’t able to provide her with an education. This is why she earns her living in such a modest, but honorable, manner. The raffle ticket business consists of selling a series of numbers for C$15 each. The lucky winner receives C$1,000. However, she would like to do a raffle for a larger amount, and for that she needs more capital. She also would like to invest working capital in basic grains so that she can continue cooking fried foods and keep her many customers. She cooks very well and keeps a clean kitchen. Her biggest wish is to increase her raffle sales and to open a small café, which would allow her to have more income. This is what inspired her to request a loan. Currently, monetary devaluation is making products more expensive and she still needs to work hard for the two children who live with her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yanis Mercedes

texts.es: Yanis Mercedes Ríos T. tiene la edad de 32 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica de esta joven es una tienda general. Hace más de 7 años que inicio con este negocio, vendiendo cosméticos de manera ambulante, cuando era estudiante universitaria para ayudar a su Mama con los gastos de la familia, porque su Mama tuvo que criarla con esfuerzo propio. Es por este motivo que solicita el financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo destinado en la compra de ropa, calzado, ropa interior y bolsos. el sueño de Yanis es que su negocio crezca para tener un buen inventario.
texts.en:
Yanis Mercedes Ríos T. is 32 years old and is married. She has 2 children and both are studying. She has a clothing store. She began this business more than 7 year ago as a street vendor of cosmetics when she was a university student so she could help her mother with the family’s expenses, since her mother had to raise her alone. Yanis is requesting a loan for working capital so she can buy clothing, shoes, underwear, and bags. Her dream is for her business to grow so that she can have a good inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gerarda De La Concepcion

texts.es: Gerarda de la Asunción  P. tiene 48 años de edad y un solo hijo pero este ya esta casado y vive por cuenta propia, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es a la venta de hamacas y una pulperia. además con el capital que poco a poco ha ido recogiendo ha podido establecer una pequeña pulpería en su hogar de habitación. Gerarda fue ayudante de su mama cuando este trabajo elaborando hamacas, por esto cuando Gerarda formo su hogar este fue el oficio que le ayudo a obtener ingresos para su familia, inicio su negocio con un financiamiento que Fundación León 2000 le otorgo en los momentos que mas necesito, desde entonces Gerarda no ha estancado la producción de hamacas y de este pequeño negocio logro establecer otro, pues ella ha aprendido a luchar y emprender nuevos caminos cuando parece que ya no existen mas opciones, ahora a Gerarda se le ha presentado la oportunidad de incrementar aun mas sus ventas, pero realmente ella no cuenta con toda la materia prima que requiere la elaboración de una gran cantidad de hamacas y los ingresos de su pulpería tampoco puede sufragar los costos que esto infiere, por los tanto ella ha recurrido a nuestra ayuda pues su financiamiento lo utilizara para este nuevo proyecto que desea emprender en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gerarda de la Asunción P. is 48 years old. She has one son, but he is married and makes his own living. She sells hammocks and has a small grocery store. She opened the grocery store in her home with money she was able to save up bit by bit. Gerarda used to help her mother when her mother made hammocks . That’s why when Gerarda started her own household, this was the occupation that helped her to earn an income for her family. Since then, she has never slowed in her production of hammocks, and this small business helped her start another one. She has learned to fight and start over when there aren’t any other options. Gerarda has now been presented with the opportunity to increase her sales even more, but she doesn’t have all of the materials that she needs to make a large number of hammocks and the earnings from her grocery store also wouldn’t be enough for the costs she would incur. This is why she has come to us for help. The loan would be used for this new project that she wishes to start in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. JULIO, el vive en el distrito de San Sebastián en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 41 años de edad, es casado con la socia Gladis y tienen 3 hijos de (20,16,11) años de edad, el socio es taxista de profesión, el trabaja con su propio auto y ahora está juntando un capital promedio para poder comprar otro auto para alquilarlo y hacerlo trabajar como taxi también, para lo cual requiere el préstamo.

Nuestro socio está muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Julio. He lives in the San Sebastian district of the city of Cusco.

Our client is 41 years old, married to Gladis, and they have three children - 20, 16, and 11 years old. He works as a taxi driver, driving his own car. He is now saving up money to buy another car so that he can rent it out and use it as a taxi as well. For this, he needs a loan.

Our client is very grateful for the help provided, and he has committed to paying back his debt in the agreed upon time period.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital

loans.name: Santos Agustin

texts.es: Santos Agustín A. A. tiene la edad de 26 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y estudia. La actividad económica de Santos ofrece los servicios de disco móvil. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Comenzó realizando pequeñas fiestas locales en su comarca, y con el paso del tiempo fue obteniendo los equipos necesarios para su negocio, mas tarde realiza un contrato con el dueño de un restaurante para entretener las fiestas bailables. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que este trabajo requiere que sus aparatos sean mucho más modernos por lo que serán invertidos en su negocio. El deseo de Santos es de proporcionarle  su familia todo lo necesario para que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Santos Agustín A. A. is 26 years old and married. He has 1 child who is in school. Santos is a deejay and has been working at this for more than 9 years. He started by working small local parties in his county and over time acquired equipment for his business. Later on he signed a contract with the owner of a restaurant to entertain at dance parties. He is asking for a loan for working capital to invest in the business, as this job requires that his equipment be much more up-to-date. Santos´ wish is to be able to provide his family with everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa R. is from the village of San carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 58 years old, widowed and has eight adult children. Generosa owns and operates a food stall, primarily selling products such as salt, canned goods and vinegar in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Generosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Generosa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta Q. is a 39 year old entrepreneur and mother of four children. She has a sari-sari store business. She started her business in 2007 using her own savings of Php 3,000. Until today, she sells different kinds of goods. She plans to make it a grocery store someday.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to sell. The loan will really help her achieve bigger sales and income for her family.

CEVI is reaching out to many people to start and have their own livelihood. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo H. is 54 year old entrepreneur and father of nine children. Most of his children are married already. He has a fishing business where he sells different kinds of fish in their village. He started his business using his own money of Php 3,000. Until now, he is still selling fish to be able to raise money for all their needs.

He is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy additional fish to sell. The loan will help him buy and sell more fish. In that way, he will earn bigger income for his own family.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria R. has a sari-sari store business. She is a 54-year-old mother of seven children. She started her business using her own capital of PHP 3,000. The income that she earns from the store helps her pay the household expenses. She is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI to buy additional merchandise and to enroll her children in school. The loan will help in growing her business and paying her children’s tuition fees.

CEVI is reaching out to people and helping them grow and sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides loans, trainings and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise and pay her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Ma. Rowillie

texts.en:
Ma. Rowilie L. is a 31-year-old mother of two children. She has a general store business situated close to her house. She uses her income from selling different kinds of goods to meet the daily needs of her family. She started her store using her savings of PHP 3,000. Her husband, Divino L., helps her run the business. She would like to ask a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI to buy additional merchandise for her store. She plans to use the loan to grow her business, and thus increase her sales and income.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides its clients credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia C. is 40 years old and a mother of three children. She has a cassava farm. She tills as well as waters the plants to ensure a good harvest. Her husband, Samson C., is the one managing their business. They work as a team to provide for their needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. The fertilizers will help improve the soil condition. This will give her whole family a better income from their farm.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim R. currently sells a few cooking items in her village and has been earning an average of $2 per day since early 2008. As another source of income, her husband raises poultry in a stall behind their house. 
Chim is 41 years old, married and the mother of a teenage child, who is a student and under her care. The poultry business is growing, so Chim would like a $300 loan in order to purchase ducks to raise for laying eggs. Chim R. and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to raise for laying eggs

loans.name: Heam

texts.en: A small size wooden house in the Kompong Cham Province belongs to Heam T. (pictured), 37, who has established a small family with the other family members for years. She and her husband have owned some land in the village where they grow a variety of crops. The couple now has three children; all of whom are still young and are school-age. Heam T. will be spending the loan money on plowing the farmland and to grow a rice crop during this coming rainy season.

loans.use: Preparing her land to grow rice

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Farming is the major source of income in the village of Pangal Norte in Echague, Isabela, and Roberto is no exception. He has been managing his rice field for almost ten years. He wanted to develop his business but due to lack of capital, he could not sustain all the farm inputs he needed.

He is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine Pesos from the lenders as additional working capital. With the business alone, Roberto was able to support his family. He is now 36 years old and his wife Anita is a public school teacher in their village teaching elementary students. Roberto is hoping that his loan request will be approved for it is of great help towards the sustainability of his farming business. He also believes that aside from having enough capital, patience and hard work are also some factors towards the success of every business endeavor.

loans.use: Business capital for rice farm

loans.name: Cobra

texts.en: Cobra R. is from the village of Panduma Sur, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 53 years old, married, and has eight children, who are now adults. Cobra owns and operates a "sari-sari" or variety store, selling daily use products such as bread, fruit, candies etc. in the local community. Cobra has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Cobra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cobra is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Kuong

texts.en:
Kuong T., 50, is a village woman living in Kompong Cham Province. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband works driving a horse and cart taxi. He owns a cart and he also uses it to pick up passers-by and merchandise in and around his community.

Kuong T. now has one son who is no longer in school and is unemployed. She wants her son to have an occupation as a motor-taxi driver. Due to the lack of capital, Kuong T. has decided to ask a loan on Kiva to be used to buy a motorcycle for her son to begin running a taxi service.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to begin running a taxi service

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: Cirila A. is a 48-year-old entrepreneur and mother in San Miguel Bohol, a poor community with livelihoods predominantly in agriculture and fishing. She has a sari-sari (variety) store business and has been managing her business for a long time already. She started her business using her Php 3,000 savings. She wishes that, someday, she will turn her small store into a grocery where she could sell more goods and earn a bigger income for her family. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 4,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise to sell. The loan will help increase her income all the more. CEVI is reaching out to people to enable them to start and have a business. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 48 years old and married to Ma. Elena. They have two children: Daphnie - 13 years old, a high school sophomore and Hyacinth May - 12 years old, an incoming high school student. 

Vicente manages a rice-farming and hog-raising business at the same time. He would like to develop his businesses to have a higher yield for him to continuously support the education of his two children. 

He is hoping that he could obtain a loan of PHP 12,000 that he can use on his farm. This would mean a lot, not only for his business but also for his family. His wife is working abroad and they have to sacrifice to uplift their life from poverty.

loans.use: To use on his farm

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath M. is 46 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, where she earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind her house. She raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house.

She is married with four children who are themselves married, and most of them have aready started new families. Her husband’s name is Nin Sokol (pictured) who works with her in the business.

Rath M. has applied for a $500 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional feed and ducks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and ducks to raise

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita G. is a seaweed farmer. She grows "gusu," a type of seaweed common in their area. She is 50 years old and has five children. Esterlita started keeping a farm, using the 8,000 PHP that she saved. Her business is doing very well, but she needs additional capital to develop her business even further.

Esterlita would like to ask a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy a pump boat engine to be used for her seaweed farming. Esterlita thinks that this loan will really help increase the size of her seaweed farm.

CEVI reached out to many seaweed farmers for them to nurture and develop their livelihoods. CEVI provides its clients with not only loans, but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy a pump boat engine to be used for seaweed farming

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en:
Junrey A. is from the village of Dalacon. He is 20 years old and is single. To make a living, Junrey owns & operates a repair business for electrical appliances and equipment. Junrey is just starting this business.

In 2009, Junrey joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junrey is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Junrey from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support his immediate family members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse A. is from the village of Unidos. She is 31 years old,  is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jesse owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products to the local community. Jesse has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jesse joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesse has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jesse is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Jesse from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima S. is from the village of Panduma Sur, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old. Fatima is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Fatima runs a food stall, selling food and drinks to passengers at the bus terminal. Fatima is just starting this business.

Fatima joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fatima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Fatima is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase ingredients to cook more food to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Fatima from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to cook more food to sell

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji M. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste. She is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts to make into paste for sale. Keji is 34 years old and married to an army officer. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more groundnut for making paste

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni R. sells green vegetables, mangoes, and other items and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Poni is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a peasant. They have three children and they all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop to sell her produce.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel M. is 25 years old and married. He lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, in the southern part of the Philippines. He has a business buying and selling bananas.

Joel strives hard to provide for the needs of his wife and his family. Unfortunately, his income is not enough because of the smaller supplies he gets during harvest time. He wants to grow his business and be competitive enough to satisfy his customers. Joel needs additional financial assistance of Php 5,000 to buy more bananas to meet his customers' demand and generate a higher income. This will be his first loan with HSPFI (a Kiva partner), where his brother is already a client.

loans.use: To purhcase additional bananas to sell.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A. is from the village of Purok 3, Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 37 years old, married, and has four school-age children. To make a living, Elena has a "sari-sari" or general store in which she sells daily-use products, like shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, to the local community. She has run her business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more home products to sell.

location.town: Purok 3, Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Phlok

texts.en:
Phlok T. is a 64 year old widowed villager who lives in the Siem Reap province. She is the mother of seven children, five are married and the other two are single. Her husband died of senility years ago.

Phlok T. currently works as a community consultant adviser in the village. Another source of income comes from her two children who are working at different occupations. Her sixth child is a crop grower, while her youngest child works providing printed invitation letters for wedding parties and other ceremonies.

Phlok T. is requesting a loan to achieve her goal to increase the capital of her child's printing service.

loans.use: To increase the capital of her child's printing service.

loans.name: Jovymar

texts.en:
Jovymar A. is 18 years old and married. She lives in the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City in the southern part of the Philippines. She is blessed with one child. She engages in lechon (roasted pigs) production. She receives orders with specifications from customers.

Jovymar's business is new and she is requesting a loan for Php 5,000.00 through HSPFI (a Kiva partner) to purchase materials needed: piglets (to raise) and pigs for roasting. This will help her to generate income and give her family a good and comfortable living. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her a loan to start this new business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and roast.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio S., a 47-year-old father, is married and blessed with five children. He lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City in Southern Philippines. He wants to start a new business, a sari-sari (variety) store.

Antonio, being a father and head of the family, decided to start a new business. He saw that the demand and market for a store is large, especially since their village in five kilometers away from the city. By applying for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to PHP 5,000.00, he can now purchase the materials needed and the grocery items to be sold at the store. This loan will help them to have a good and comfortable living. This will be Antonio's first loan with HSPFI.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
"I have been tilling my farm for 20 years already. I started farming in 1989. Until now, I till my farm to be able to support the needs of our home. My harvest is what I use to buy our personal needs and the tuition for school. My dream is to acquire another hectare of farm to support my family more", says Jenelyn L., a 41-year-old mother of three children.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and chemicals. The loan will really help her improve her farm all the more.

Now, CEVI is helping her sustain her business more. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Mulakat

texts.en: Mulakat is 38 years old and married with four children. She is sitting close to her husband in the picture. She has a shop where she sells foodstuffs and she also has a machine for grinding tomatoes, pepper and beans.  She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mujidat
