While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more young cattle and fodder for them

loans.name: Fatimoh

texts.en: Fatimoh A. is fifty years old and married with four children. She sells sarongs and laces. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en: B. Maruf is forty years old and married with four children. He is a fashion designer and he also sells sarongs.  He is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun is thirty-five years old and married with three children. She sells provisions, medicines and clothing.  She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more provisions and clothes to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Columba

texts.es:
CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS.

SE DEDICA A LA RENTA DE LOCALES COMERCIALES.

COMENZO HACE 20 AÑOS, CUANDO SU ESPOSO FUE LIQUIDADO, LE OFRECIERON UN TERRENO CERCA DE SU CASA,EN BUEN PRECIO, DESPUES DE ESO, EMPEZARON A CONSTRUIR PARA HCER LOS LOCALES.

YA TIENE 4 LOCALES , LOS CUALES ESTA RENTANDO.

ELLA SOLICITA EL APOYO PARA PODER COMPRAR PINTURA Y MATERIAL PARA DARLE MANTENIMIENTO A LOS LOCALES, PARA PODER OFRECER LO MEJOR A SUS CLIENTES.

TIENE MUCHO EXITO CON SUS LOCALES , YA QUE ESTAN MUY BIEN UBICADOS Y APRTE LES MANEJA BAJOS COSTOS.
texts.en:
Columba is married and has 3 children. She dedicates herself to renting out commercial locales. She began 20 years ago when her husband was laid off and they were offered a small plot of land near their house for a good price; after this, they began construction to build the locales. They now have 4 locales, all of which are rented out. She is requesting support to be able to purchase paint and materials to carry out maintenance on the locales, which will allow her to offer her clients the best. She has had great success with her locales, given that they are well situated and she offers low prices.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (paint and materials).

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
TIENE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS.

SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA FULLER, DESDE AL AÑO 2002.

COMENZO CON EL NEGOCIO POR QUE NECESITABA UN INGRESO EXTRA, PARA PODER APOYAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.

COMENZO CON LA VENTA CON FAMILIARES Y AMISTADES, LE HA HIDO MUY BIEN CON ESTE NEGOCIO, TODO GRACIAS A LA SERIEDAD Y BUEN TRATO CON QUE MANEJA A SUS CLIENTES.

AHORA PIDE AL APOYO PARA COMPRAR NUEVA MERCANCIA, PARA PODER OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES LO MEJOR.
texts.en:
Amanda is 30 years old, is married, and has two children. She has dedicated herself to the purchase and sale of Fuller beauty products since 2002. She started this business because she needed extra income to be able to help with household expenses. She began by selling to family and friends, and this business has been going very well thanks to the seriousness and good treatment with which she deals with clients. She now asks for support to purchase new merchandise to be able to offer her clients the best.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: M H 2 Group

texts.en:
Anastasia D. L. R. is the group coordinator for this group of entrepreneurs. She has had a rough time since she first became a client of Esperanza International about eighteen months ago (this is her third loan cycle). She's had to change her business activity several times, going from a fried food stand to selling undergarments. Unfortunately, her undergarments sales did not go as expected; so for this new loan she has decided to try a new business. She will take orders for small appliances, purchase them with the loan money, and then collect payments from her customers. The one thing that has not varied is her clientele. They have continued to purchase from her in every business activity she has tried.

Anastasia is very concerned about having a successful business because she has seven children. She not only has to proviD. for them every day, but she hopes to be there for them until they can go to college and start their own careers.

Please help us support Anastasia and the rest of these entrepreneurs with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase small appliances to sell.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. FLOR, ella es natural de Pilcopata, perteneciente a la selva de Cusco, están a 8 horas en bus público desde la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia alterna sus labores del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene en restaurante en el pueblo, atiende desde desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, pasando por jugos y sándwich, la socia a invertido todo su capital de trabajo en su restaurante y ahora ella desea adquirir otro local en el centro mismo del pueblo para así poner su sucursal, nuestra socia está con este sistema de trabajo desde hace 3 años y le ha ido muy bien, por lo que sigue apostando en ello.

La socia se muestra muy contenta de volver a adquirir otro préstamo para continuar invirtiendo en su ahora nuevo restaurante, por lo que se compromete a seguir trabajando disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Flor is a native of Pilcopata, part of the Cusco jungle which located 8 hours by bus from the city of Cusco. She is a homemaker as well as a small businesswoman. She has a restaurant in town where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner as well as juices and sandwiches. She invested all of her capital in her restaurant and now would like to acquire another location in the center of town to start a branch. She has been working for the past 3 years and it has gone very well for her, which is why she wants to continue with it. She is pleased to be able to get another loan to invest in her new restaurant and is committed to keep working to make her repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start up a new restaurant.

loans.name: Jireh 3 Group

texts.en:
Yenisfe M. is the group coordinator of this group of five. She is twenty-two years old and has a four-year-old child. Yenisfe used to have a barber shop, but had to close down because business was slow. She moved into selling clothing. She goes to the capital or to San Pedro, the closest large city, to buy new clothes to sell. With this business, she can collect payments more frequently than her paying clients came to the barber shop. Yenisfe hopes to succeed in her business and open a clothing shop in downtown Hato Mayor. Yenisfe also expects to get her business well established so that she can go back to college and get a better education for managing her business. On behalf of Yenisfe and the rest of these entrepreneurs, thank you for your support!

Note: The lady to the left of the girl with jean jacket (Yenisfe) is not part of this loan. She was accompanying her on that visit to the Hato Mayor office.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. VICTORIA, ella es proveniente de Paucartambo, ahora radica en Pilcopata, perteneciente a la selva de Cusco, están a 8 horas en bus público desde la misma ciudad del Cusco.

 La socia vino a Pilcopata hace mas de 4 años y se quedó enamorada de su clima y de su gente, ella actualmente alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención a tiempo casi completo de su tienda abarrotes, ella tiene 47 años de edad y tiene 6 hijos los 2 últimos de (18, 14) años; ella no está casada pero vive junto a su pareja que es el padre de sus hijos hasta hoy, el se dedica a la agricultura y juntos siguen adelante ayudando a sus hijos con los estudios superiores y demás obligaciones, la socia requiere el préstamo en razón de implementar su tienda abarrotes con productos que trae de la sierra de Cusco para ser vendidos en este valle cálido y así abastecer a los pobladores.

La socia está muy agradecida con el préstamo y se ratifica en cumplir con el pago total de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Victoria is from Paucartambo but now lives in Pilcopata, which is part of the Cusco jungle and is 8 hours by bus from the city of Cusco. She came to Pilcopata more than 4 years ago and fell in love with the weather and the people. Currently she is both a homemaker and takes care of her grocery almost full time. She is 47 years old and has 6 children, the youngest two are 18 and 14 years old. She is not married but lives with her common-law husband who is the father of her children. He is a farmer and together they work to help out the children with their education and other needs. She needs a loan to stock her store with goods which are brought from the mountains of Cusco to be sold in the valley. She is grateful for the loan and confirms that she will repay it within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “zapatito Veloz” trabaja junto a  Pro-Mujer hace más de tres años,  a la fecha  cuenta con doce socias activas, ellas han  demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría estan casadas y con un promedio de 5 hijos, se ven en la necesidad de buscar  otras fuentes de ingresos ya que las necesidades de sus hijos aumentan día a día.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de zapatos, tenis, víveres, cosméticos otras también se dedican al  trenzado de mantas en macramé. La mayoría de ellas venden sus productos en ferias de la ciudad Necesitan capital para poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos, de esta manera generara mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer bienestar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Zapatito Veloz" group has worked with Pro-Mujer for more than three years. They currently have 12 active members and have proven to be organized regarding their loan payments. The majority of the group are married, with an average of 5 children. They have had to look for other sources of income to meet the growing needs of their children. There are different businesses within the group, such as sale of shoes, tennis shoes, supplies, cosmetics and others make macramé placemats. Most sell their products in markets. They need capital in order to buy a greater quantity of products which will allow them to generate more income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies

loans.name: Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Alto Lima, a este pertenece la asociación “Siempre Alegres”, formada por once miembros.
Un grupo muy alegre que  junto  a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con mucha responsabilidad.
Diferentes son las actividades de  este grupo; algunas de ellas se dedican a la venta de ropa, videos, joyas, galletas, otras tienes tiendas de barrio. 
Solicitan mayores créditos con el fin de ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan comprar productos al por mayor, de este modo sus ganancias serán mayores,  con el único de objetivo de mejorar el estilo de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Siempre Alegres" group is made up of 11 members and is located in the city of El Alto, in the center of Alto Lima. They are a very cheerful group who work responsibly with their loan officer. The group has different activities; some sell clothing, videos, jewelry, cookies and others have shops in the neighborhood. They are requesting more loans so that they can increase their sales. To do this they need to buy products wholesale and this way their earnings will be greater, with the goal of improving their families´ standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products wholesal.

loans.name: Los Ceibos Group

texts.es: El grupo "Los Ceibos" están representados por el señor Mariano y conformados por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a actividades D. costura y confección D. prendas D. vestir, al servicio D. transporte público y a L. venta D. productos como  ropa, comida, refrescos, plásticos y cosméticos. Dentro D. cada uno D. sus rubros los socios tienen gran competencia D. oferta D. productos D. buena calidad, por lo que requieren un financiamiento que cubra L. compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que coadyuven a L. elaboración D. productos mas competitivos que generen mayor ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias. Los socios cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios pues ya trabajaron con L. fundación demostrando capacidad D. manejo en fondos y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mariano represents the Los Ceibos group. The group is comprised of twelve members. For the most part they have businesses such as sewing, making clothes, public transportation services, and selling products such as clothes, meals, soft drinks, plastics and cosmetics. Within each of their fields the members are very competent; they sell good quality products. They need a loan to buy materials, supplies, and tools, which will help them make more competitive products to increase income and support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies.
Elles cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide comme  secondaire culture.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre premiers prêts, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  des semences de riz, d’arachide et des intrants  au marché de Fonfona, M’pessoba et  Zansoni. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au marché de M’pessoba et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle  composée de revendeurs venant généralement des grandes villes et de consommateurs.
Les membres du groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 Group is a group of married women from the village of Fonfona in the main city of Koutiala (in Mali's third administrative region). They have an average age of 40 and six children each and live in large, extended traditional families. Rice is their main crop, with groundnuts their secondary crop. Keen to make a profit from their agriculture business, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 group decided five years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. Having fully repaid their first four loans, they are now on their fifth country loan. The current loan will be used to buy rice and groundnut seeds and fertilizer at the markets in Fonfona, M’pessoba and Zansoni. After the harvest season, the crops are placed in storage for a certain period of time to increase in value before being sold at retail (often in bulk) at the market in M’pessoba or surrounding markets for cash to a clientele composed of retailers (mainly from the large towns) or consumers. Once the crops are sold, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 group each expect to make a profit of CFA 75,000, which will be used to repay the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Wiñay Muju Group

texts.es: El grupo Wiñay Maju" esta representado por su presidente el señor Walter y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como a la venta D. zapatos, comida, venta D. jugos y al servicio D. transporte público D. pasajeros. En general la competencia para los socios D. este grupo es llevadera ya que son únicos en sus mercados D. barrio y en sus pequeños negocios. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales e insumos que ayuden a mejorar sus herramientas D. trabajo y al incremento D. su mercadería para un mejor ingreso que brinD. a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Los miembros D. este grupo han demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus antecedentes crediticios por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo en grupos solidarios y en la fuerza D. un grupo unido.
texts.en:
Walter is president of and represents the Wiñay Maju group. The group is comprised of twelve members who have businesses like selling shoes, selling meals, selling juices, and public transportation service. In general, the competition for the group’s members is tolerable because they are the only ones in their small businesses in the neighborhood markets. The loan is to buy materials and supplies to help improve their working tools and to increase merchandise. This will bring a better income and offer their families a better quality of life. The members of this group have demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with their previous loans. They know how to work in supportive groups; they know the power of a united group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es: El grupo "Nueva Luz" están representados por la señora Mónica Jovanna y conformados por 13 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como zapatos, abarrotes, comida, leche, material escolar y ropa y otros servicios como la pintura D. viviendas, confección D. prendas D. vestir y al servicio D. cajeros . Dentro D. cada uno D. sus rubros los socios tienen gran competencia D. oferta D. productos y servicios por lo que los socios requieren D. un financiamiento que atenué sus ingresos y mejore la calida D. vida D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para capital D. operaciones y ayuD. en la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar mejores ingresos para sus familias. Los socios cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios pues ya trabajaron con la fundación demostrando capacidad D. manejo en fondos y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mónica Jovanna represents the Nueva Luz group. The group is comprised of thirteen members. For the most part, they have businesses selling products such as shoes, groceries, meals, milk, school supplies, and clothes. Others offer services like house painting, making clothes, and cashier services. Within each of their fields the members are proficient at offering products and services. They need a loan to increase their income and improve the quality of life for their families. The loan is for operating capital to buy merchandise, supplies and tools that will help them generate more income for their families. The members have experience with supportive groups. They have worked with foundation and demonstrated their capacity to manage funds and be responsible with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Juana Guillermina

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Juana es casada tiene 60 años, dos hijos de 28 y 35 años que trabajan y estudian.
Empezó en su casa  hace 15 años vendiendo licores, cervezas, caramelos baratos, todo fue poco a poco tiene su bodega grande ahora  vende  licores de calidad, su tienda esta entre las cinco mejores de la zona de Pachacamac, ella se dedica administrar su tienda.  
Desde que esta en Finca   aprendió a invertir, ahorrar, le gusta las reuniones comparte con sus amigas.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de productos por el día del padre, colonias, relojes y licores. 
El sueño de Juana es que su hija se case y que la salud de ella mejore.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano. She is married; is 60-years-old; and has two children, who are 28 and 35. They go to school and work. She started a business in her house 15 years ago by selling liquor, beer, and cheap candy. She expanded it little by little and today she has a large store where she sells quality liquor. Her store is among the five best in the Pachacamac area, and she manages her store. Since she has worked with Finca, she has learned how to invest and how to save. She likes going to meetings so she can share with her friends. Juana needs a loan of 3,000 PEN to be able to buy merchandise for Father's Day like colognes, watches, and liquor. Juana's dream is to see her daughter get married and that her health improves.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 3,000 PEN to purchase products for Father's Day like colognes, watches, and liquor.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina  es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Lina es viuda tiene 67 años, tiene 7 hijos, mayores son independientes. 
Lina tuvo un restaurante y creció que lo hizo polleria cuando todo iba bien se enfermo le dio hemiplejia, estuvo mal por varios meses, y cerrar su negocio. compro una moto-car y un carro  lo dio en alquiler, su negocio es de alquiler de taxis y moto-car. Ella administra todo  Vive de las ganancias. 
Desde que esta en Finca, los prestamos han ayudado a invertir ha podido construir su casa ahora la alquila.
Lina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para bajada de motor de su carro y compra de llantas. 
El sueño de Lina es Viajar a diferentes lugares, para distraerse.
texts.en:
Lina is a member of the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano. She is a widow; is 67; and has 7 children, who are all adults and independent. She had a restaurant which she grew, and she turned it into a poultry shop. Everything was going well when she got sick with hemiplejia. She was sick for several months and closed her business. She bought a motorcycle rickshaw and rented it out. Now her business is renting taxis and motorcycle rickshaws. She manages everything and lives off of the profits. Since she has worked with Finca, her loans have helped her invest and she has been able to build her house, which she now rents out. Lina needs a loan of 1,000 PEN so she can repair her car's engine and buy tires. Lina's dream is to travel.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lina needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to repair her car's engine and to buy tires

loans.name: Farry Hilda

texts.es:
Farry es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Farry es casada tiene 37 años, no tiene hijos.
Farry tenia un puesto en el mercado donde trabajaba con su mamá lo dejo a su mamá y abrió una bodega en su casa.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a ser perseverante, ahora y hacer responsable con los prestamos . 
Farry necesita un préstamo de  3000 soles, para la cuota inicial de un terreno. 
El sueño de Farry es tener su empresa de chompas.
texts.en:
Farry is a member of the communal bank Maria Elena Moyan. She is married, is 37, and doesn't have any children. She used to have a stand in the market where she worked with her mother, but she then opened a grocery store in her home. Since she has worked with Finca, she has learned how to persevere, to save, and to be responsible with her loans. Farry needs a loan of 3,000 PEN to make a down payment on some land. Her dream is to have a sweater business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farry needs a loan of 3,000 PEN to make a down payment on some land.

loans.name: Irma Rogelia

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Irma es casada , tiene 59 años, 6 hijos , la ultima tiene 15 años y esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Irma   trabajo  25 años enseñando en el colegio fe y alegría, también se puso a vender fruta por saco en el mercado,  con el tiempo decidió poner una librería bazar en el mercado, puesto alquilado.    
Desde que esta en Finca, valora su trabajo, la mujer debe valorarse ganarse el pan diariamente con honradez.  
Irma necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de ropa interior, buzo, medias. Panty. 
 El sueño de Irma es Irma que su hija terminen sus estudios y surga.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano. She is married, is 59, and has 6 children. Her youngest daughter is 15 and goes to public school. Irma worked for 25 years teaching in a school called "Fe y alegría." She also sold fruit by the bag in a market. With time, she decided to start a book store and bazaar in the market in a rented stand. Since she has worked with Finca, she has valued her work. Women should value themselves to earn an income with honor. She needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase underwear, sweaters, and socks. Irma's dream is to see her daughter finish her education and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Irma needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to buy underwear, sweaters, and socks.

loans.name: Aguedita Ydalina

texts.es:
Aguedita es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Aguedita recibe en herencia el negocio de sus padres una bodega, la cual se tuvo que hacer cargo, con el tiempo cambio de giró y puso  una  licorería, se gano el premio de Cerveza Cristal de 20 mil soles, en un sorteo, invirtiendo en la compra al por mayor de cerveza, gaseosa y vinos, desde entonces su negocio ha ido creciendo. también compra ropa por sacos que traen de España.    
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a distribuir su dinero, a como ahorrar y administrar mejor el negocio.  
Aguedita necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra de ropa importada de segunda.  La señora esta vendiendo zapatos por campaña (día del padre).
El sueño de Aguedita es ver sus hijos crecer y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Aguedita is a member of the Maria Elena Moyano Communal Bank. Aguedita received, as an inheritance from her parents, their grocery store which she now manages. Over time, things changed and she began selling liquor also. She won the prize of 20,000 Sols from Cristal Beer in a lottery which she invested in the purchase at wholesale of beer, soft drinks and wines. Since then the business has been growing. She also bought clothing in wholesale lots imported from Spain. Since she has been with FINCA Peru, she has learned to distribute her money, how to save and to better manage her business. Aguedita needs a loan of 1,600 Sols to buy imported used clothing. Aguedita is selling shoes for the father's day holiday. Her dream is to see her children grow up and become professional people.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Santana

texts.es:
Santana es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Santana es conviviente, tiene  59 años, cuatro hijos todos mayores.
Santana empezó vendiendo panes, con los ahorros compro un moto-car en cuotas, lo puso a trabajar y al tiempo compró uno mas y después uno mas,  actualmente con sus ahorros  ha comprado una couster, su esposo maneja y su hijo cobra.  
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a ser  una empresaria, aprendió a invertir, sacar sus cuentas, y ha trabajar para que su negocio crezca.  
Santana necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para invertir en su carro, va planchar su carro para que pase la revisión técnica.
El sueño de Santana es darle a cada uno de sus hijos un carro para, para que lo trabajen.
texts.en:
Santana is a member of the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano. She is married; is 59; and has 4 children, who are all adults. Santana started her business by selling bread. With her savings, she purchased a motorcycle richshaw. She put it to work, and with time she purchased another one and then one more. Now with her savings, she has purchased a mini-bus which her husband drives, and her son sells tickets for. Since she has worked with Finca, she has learned to be a businesswoman and how to invest and to keep her books. She has worked so her business would grow. Santana needs a loan of 2,600 PEN to invest in her car so it will pass inspection. Her dream is to give each one of her children a car so they can work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Santana needs a loan of 2,600 PEN to invest in her car so it will pass inspection

loans.name: Teodocia Felicitas

texts.es:
Teodosia es  socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Teodosia es casada tiene 50 años, dos hijos de 30 y 29 años que  trabajan.
Teodosia puso un taller de tejido, pero no le fue bien tuvo que cerrar y empezó a comprar y vender ropa, ahora ella deja  ropa a los puestos de mercado. 
Desde que esta en Finca, los prestamos le ayudan a poder invertir y son un respaldo para su negocio.
Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra de pedidos de ropa que le han hecho.
El sueño de Teodosia es poner una fuente de soda en su casa.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Maria Elena Moyano Communal Bank. She is married and is 50 years old. She has two children, 30 and 29, who work. Teodosia started a business working with fabrics, but that didn't go well and she had to close it. She then started buying and selling clothes, and now she leaves clothes at the booths at the market. Since she has been working with Kiva partner Finca, the loans she has gotten have helped her invest in and support her business. Teodosia needs a loan of 1600 soles to pay for clothing she has ordered. Teodosia's dream is to operate a soda fountain out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing/inventory purchase

loans.name: Ilda Rafaela

texts.es:
Ilda es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Ilda es conviviente, tiene 48 años  tiene  tres hijos de 26,24, y 21 años, que estudian y trabajan.
Ilda empezó  su negocio hace 10 años, cuando se separa de su esposo, por la misma necesidad que estaba pasando, en su casa puso una bodega vendiendo cosas que el  habían regalado, hasta aumentar sus ganancias y poder comprar mas mercadería; ella da desayuno en su casa, y ha podido poner  un video Pac.  
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió ahorrar, a llevar sus cuentas, ingresos egresos con las charlas que ha recibido en el Bancomunal.  
Ilda  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de licores como, cartabio y vinos.  
El sueño de Ilda es compra una combi para repartir mercadería.
texts.en:
Ilda is a member of the Maria Elena Moyano Communal Bank. She is living with her partner. She is 48 years old and has three children who are 26, 24, and 21 years old. They study and work. Ilda began her business 10 years ago when she separated from her husband. Because of this very thing, she set up a store in her house, selling things that he had given her. To increase her earnings and be able to purchase more merchandise, she also sold breakfast out of her home and installed a PacMan video game. Since she has been with Kiva partner Finca, learning to save money and handle her own finances, her revenue has increased with the help of the advice she received from the other members of her communal bank. Ilda's dream is to buy a van for distributing her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase liquor such as cartabio and wine

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Corina es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Corina es conviviente tiene 59 años, un hijo de 41 años que es independiente.
Corina empezó a trabajar limpiando casas, lo quejo por que era muy pesado y puso una  bodega hace quince años, en su casa, poco a poco 
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a valorar el dinero, a llevar sus cuentas, a invertir. 
Corina necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para invertirlo en su bodega, copra de sacos de arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche. 
El sueño de Corina es comprar un carro para ponerlo  en alquiler.
texts.en:
Corina is a member of the Maria Elena Moyano Communal Bank. She is living with her partner, and she is 59 years old. She has one son who is 41 years old, and he is independent. Corina began to work cleaning homes, which she quit because it was very unpleasant. Fifteen years ago, she set up a store in her home [which grew] little by little. Since she has been working with Kiva partner Finca, Corina has learned the value of money, how to keep track of her personal finances, and how to invest. Corina needs a loan of 2400 soles to invest in her store, buying sacks of rice, sugar, pasta, and milk. Corina's dream is to buy a car, which she would rent out.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, pasta, and milk.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Maruja es conviviente tiene 30 años, un hijo de 2 años que esta al cuidado de ella.
Maruja trabaja con su esposo, el inicio el negocio por que el trabajaba en una carpintería, y decidió independizarse alquilo un local y se pusieron a trabajar,  han puesto una carpintería, ella también ayuda en las compras y en algunos trabajos.
Desde que esta en Finca, puede invertir en mas mercadería, en cada reunión aprende algo nuevo y se distrae mucho por que ha hecho nuevas amigas.  
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para  de una compresora. 
 
El sueño de Maruja es comprar un terreno para poner su taller de carpintería por que donde están es alquilado.
texts.en:
Maruja, 30, is a member of the Maria Elena Moyano Communal Bank. She has a 2-year-old son in her care. Maruja works with her husband, who started the business because he was working as a carpenter, and decided to become independent. They rented a place and started to work as a carpenter's workshop. She also helps with purchases and in certain jobs. Now with Finca, she can invest in more merchandise. In every meeting she learns something new and is distracted often with the number of new friends she's made. Maruja needs a loan of 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency), for a compressor. Maruja's dream is to buy land for her carpenter's shop, since it is currently rented.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a compressor

loans.name: Ablamvi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbon de bois. Il  a commencé ce commerce en 2004, il a l’avantage d’être le seul qui exerce cette activité dans son quartier ce qui lui permet de réaliser de bonnes recettes. Une partie de son stock a été détruite par la pluie, il veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES  son premier crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This gentleman sells charcoal to earn a living. He began this business in 2004. He has the advantage of being the only one who sells charcoal in his neighborhood which allows him to have a good turnover. Part of his stock has been destroyed by the rain, so he wants to replenish his inventory and is thus asking WAGES for his first loan to buy 25 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Sakiratou

texts.fr: Cette femme est célibataire et très dynamique, elle a très tôt abandonné les études et s’est lancée depuis 1994 dans le commerce des appareils électroménagers dans sa propre boutique qu’elle a appelé « ETS GBADAMASSI et Fils », elle a ainsi acquit la maîtrise de ce commerce. Sa  clientèle grandit tous les jours. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, elle doit agrandir son stock, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 05 télévisions, 20 antennes, 15 ventilateurs et divers.
texts.en:
This lady is single and very energetic. She left off her studies at a young age and in 1994 began to sell household appliances in her own little store that she calls "ETS GBADAMASSI et Fils". She has lots of experience in this business. Her clientele grows from day to day. To better satisfy her customers, she needs to expand her inventory, which is the reason why she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 5 televisions, 20 antennas, 15 fans, and various items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of household appliances for re-sale

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a entamé en 2006 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, il veut agrandir son stock pour mieux vendre et réaliser plus de recettes, pour cela il s’adresse à WAGES pour obtenir son premier cycle de prêt  afin d’acheter 5 sacs de sucre en poudre, 10 cartons de savons, 5 sacs de riz et divers.
il est célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
This gentleman started selling grocery products in 2006. He wants to expand his inventory so as to make more sales and thus more income. For that reason, he has come to WAGES to request his first loan to buy 5 sacks of granulated sugar, 10 cases of soap, 5 sacks of rice and various other items.

He is single and supports himself with the proceeds from this business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Marié et père de famille, ce monsieur a ouvert en 2005 un débit de boissons à kégué, il s’approvisionne auprès de la brasserie du Togo, la plupart de ses clients sont des tenanciers de bar et des restaurateurs. Il fait face actuellement à une rupture de stock, il voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 casiers de bière et 25 casiers de sucrerie.
texts.en:
Married and the father of a family, this gentleman opened a drinks depot in Kégué in 2005. He buys his inventory from the brewery of Togo. Most of his customers are bar and restaurant owners. He has presently run out of some items so he needs to stock up and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 30 crates of beer and 25 crates of sodas.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of crates of drinks

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es: El grupo "San Miguel" esta representado por la señora Amparo Nadia y conformado por 13 miembros en los cuales no existe parentesco alguno, una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la comercialización y venta D. diferentes productos como ropa, cosméticos, pan y a actividades D. servicio D. limpieza, atención en salón D. belleza y a la educación pública. Dentro del comercio existe mucha competencia en la oferta D. mercadería y servicios, por lo que las socias deben esforzarse el doble para adquirí un ingreso diario para el sustento D. su familia, es por este motivo que requieren el crédito para la compra D. material D. trabajo y herramientas para un trabajo mas eficiente y prolijo así como para el incremento D. su mercadería que brindara a sus familias un ingreso mayor y una mejor calidad D. vida. Las socias van cursando su segundo ciclo juntas por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo D. la Fundación a la cual demostraron ser capaces D. cumplir con sus obligaciones en forma puntual y responsable demostrando unidad dentro del grupo.
texts.en:
The "San Miguel" Group is represented by Mrs. Amparo Nadia and composed of 13 unrelated female members. A majority of the members work in the commercialization and sale of different products like clothes, cosmetics, bread, and cleaning services, beauty salons, and public education. Within this commerce there exists a lot of competition in offering services and merchandise; thus, the members must work twice as hard in order to acquire a daily income to maintain their families. For this reason they require a loan to purchase work material and tools in order to be more efficient and orderly, as well as to increase the merchandise that will offer them a better income and a better quality of life for their families. The members are in their second cycle together, so they are familiar with the work methods of the Foundation, in which they proved to be capable of fulfilling their obligations punctually and responsibly, demonstrating unity within their group.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Safiro Group

texts.es: La mayor parte de las personas que componen este grupo son de escasos recursos teniendo como ingreso solo sus pequeños negocios de venta de mercadería como frustras y verduras, artesanías, pan, ropa y al servicio de cerrajería, elaboración de prendas de vestir y al servicio publico de pasajeros. Los miembros que componen del grupo "Safiro" tienen experiencia en los negocios a los cuales se dedican por lo que la competencia latente en el mercado forma parte del diario vivir de cada uno de los socios. La mayoría de los miembros del grupo tienen como destino de su financiamiento el incremento de su capital de trabajo ya que sin el no se puede mejora la calidad de los productos para una mejor competitividad en el mercado. Su presidenta la señora Leonarda y los 13 miembros del grupo cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a su participación en entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital de modo que conocen la responsabilidad y cumplimiento con sus obligaciones así como el manejo de los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The majority of people who form this group have scarce economic resources and have only their small businesses as sources of income. They sell merchandise like fruits and vegetables, crafts, bread, and clothing, and offer services as a locksmith, seamstresses, or public transportation. The members of the group, "Safiro," are experienced in the businesses they run, but the latent competition in the market is a part of their daily lives. The majority of the members will use their financing to increase their working capital since without it they can't improve the quality of their products to be more competitive. The group's president, Leornarda, and the thirteen members of the group have experience in suppot groups thanks to their participation in similar groups like Fundación Agrocapital. So they know their responsibilities and comply with their obligations like managing the funds that they are lent.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Djodassi

texts.fr: Cette femme a entamé en 2002 le commerce de miel qu’elle met dans des bidons de 1.5 litres, ses clients achètent chez elle le miel pour boire ou pour faire des médicaments. Ce commerce lui réussit bien et elle veut l’agrandir, c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 04 bidons de 25 litres elle est mariée et a 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady began selling honey in 2002. She puts it in cans of 1.5 liters. Her customers buy honey from her to drink or to make medicines out of it. This business is successful and she wants to expand it. For this reason she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 4 jerry cans of 25 liters. She is married and has 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de miel

loans.name: Cruceñitas Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Cruceñitas", esta representado por la Erica Roxana y conformado por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales se presenta un parentesco familiar entre la señora Yuvinka y su hermana la señora Laura, ambas generan ingresos independientes en su pequeños negocios. En general los integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades comerciales como  la venta ropa, comida, cosméticos, pan, flores y abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y dedicación en su trabajo. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a mejor sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos que son el sustento D. sus familias. Aunque las socias se encuentran cursando su primer ciclo junto a la fundación Agrocapital ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios según su historial crediticio.
texts.en:
The Crucenitas Communal Bank is represented by Erica Roxana and formed of 12 members who all have some family ties to Mrs. Yuvinka and her sister Laura. These women both generated income for their small, independent businesses. In general, the group members do business selling clothes, food, cosmetics, bread, flowers, and groceries in neighborhood stores. As in all business, there is always some competition with supply and demand, but the group members know how to rise above that thanks to their experience and dedication to their work. This loan will be used to diversify the products the women sell and help them purchase materials, ingredients and tools that will help them improve their sales and proviD. for their families. Although this is the group's first loan through Kiva partner Fundacion Agrocapital, the women already have experience working with business groups according to their credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Monsieur D. yawo mawuli est un jeune homme célibataire qui a très tôt abandonné les études pour se lancer dans la boulangerie, il fabrique des pains qu’il vend, ses clients viennent passer leur commande tard le soir et vont se faire livrer tôt le matin car souvent la demande est plus grande que l’offre. Afin de répondre d’une manière plus convenable à la demande de ses clients il veut se réapprovisionner en matières nécessaires à la fabrication de pain, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 03 sacs de farine de blé, 03 sacs de sucre, 10 boîtes de levures et du bois de chauffe.
texts.en:
Mr. D. Yawo Mawuli is a young unmarried man who soon dropped out of school in order to start up a bakery. He makes bread that he sells. His customers come by to place their orders late in the day. He goes to make deliveries early in the morning because the demand is often greater than what he offers. In order to respond to the demand in a more suitable manner, he wants to stock up on the necessary supplies to make bread. He’s requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy three sacks of flour, three sacks of sugar, ten containers of leavening, and some firewood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, leavening, and firewood

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Amistad” va cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y buena administración D. los fondos, se encuentra representado por la señora Graciela y conformado por 14 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como comida, abarrotes, ropa y a la prestación D. servicios como el transporte público y la confección D. prendas D. vestir. Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Elvira y su mama la señora Graciela, pero ambas cuentan con ingreso independientes una D. la otra. Las socias aceptan que existe gran competencia en el mercado D. oferta y demanda D. productos pero gracias a los D. experiencia con la que cuentan saben como salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. capital y la adquisición D. mercadería que amplié sus negocios y genere una mayor ganancia para mejorara la calida D. vida D. sus familias
texts.en:
The Friendship Communal Bank is receiving its second Kiva loan and has demonstrated responsibilty and excellent monetary stewardship. The group is represented by Graciela and is comprised of 14 members, the majority of whom operate businesses selling products such as food, groceries, and clothes, as well as offering services such as public transportation and tailoring. The members of the group share family ties to Elvira and her mother Graciela, but the women generate income independent of each other. The members accept that there is great competition in the market with supply and demand, but thanks to their experience, they know how to rise above this. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise and expand the members' businesses to generate better income and proviD. for a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital

loans.name: Georgina Amina

texts.es: La señora Giorgina se dedica a la venta de comida en su pensión ubicada en la zona de Villa Salome, tres años con esta actividad, es muy conocida por la zona, anteriormente se dedicaba a la misma actividad pero en la localidad de Coroico de los Yungas de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, y ella sola se ocupa de ellos. El crédito será invertido en la compra de víveres y verduras, y en el pintado de la pensión ya que amplió el ambiente.
texts.en:
Señora Giorgina’s job is selling food in her guesthouse located in the Villa Salome area. She has been doing this for three years and is well-known in the area. She did the same type of work before but in the neighbourhood of Coroico de los Yungas in the city of La Paz. She has the sole responsibility for her two school-aged children. The loan will be used to buy supplies and vegetables, and to paint the guesthouse as it has been enlarged.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies, vegetables, and make repairs to her guesthouse

loans.name: Genaro Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Genaro es un cliente antiguo de la institución, se dedica a la confeccion de buzos deportivos para niños y chamarras para niños y mayores. Tiene también un minibús pequeño de siete pasajeros, con el cual trabaja llevando pasajeros al centro de la ciudad, por las mañanas y a partir de mediodía se dedica a la costura. Su esposa es quien lleva sus productos a venderlos a las ciudades de Oruro y Potosí, ella también le ayuda a costurar. Don Genaro es muy puntual y responsable, el crédito será invertido en la compra de tela polar(tela gruesa y caliente) para confección de chamarras para la época de frío.
texts.en:
Señor Genaro has been a member of the organisation (Kiva partner Emprender) for a long time. His job is making tracksuits for children and jackets for both children and adults. He also has a small 7-seater minibus that he uses to transport passengers to the centre of town in the mornings. After midday he works at his sewing job. His wife sells the clothing in the cities of Oruro and Potosí, and she also helps with the sewing. Sr. Genaro is very punctual and responsible with his repayments. The loan will be used to buy polar fleece (thick and warm material) so that he can make jackets for the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Laura B. tiene 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Venezuela en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, sus planes es poder apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios y darle una buena educación ya que es madre soltera, su negocio es una tienda que desde seis años administra, el cual comenzó con fondos propios y prestamos en micro financieras el cual ha podido mantener con variedad y mercancías su negocio, este es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara ropa para niño y adulto para incrementar las ventas. Su meta es poder tener una segunda tienda en otro mercado y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y poder dar a sus hijos mejor bienestar economico.
texts.en:
34-year old Señora Laura B. lives in the Villa Venezuela neighbourhood of the capital city Managua. She has two children, and her hope is to be able to support them through school and provide them with a good education even though she is a single mother. She has owned her own business for seven years, starting out using her own savings and small loans, and managing to maintain a variety of merchandise. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner Afodenic; she will use it to buy children’s and adults’ clothing in order to increase her sales. Her goal is to be able to open a second store in another market so she can earn more money and give her children a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
El señor Mateo Núñez  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, sus cuatro hijos.
El señor Mateo es cocinero y tiene un puesto de comida rápida en la ciudad de El Alto, con cuyos ingresos  mantiene a su familia.
Sus hijos están creciendo y el espacio en la vivienda no les brinda la comodidad necesaria para desarrollar sus actividades.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de la estructura para la construcción de dos habitaciones que serán destinadas a sus hijos.
Esta es la séptima vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002.
texts.en:
Mateo Núñez lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone, the western side of La Paz city, with his four children. Mateo is a cook and has a fast food stand in El Alto city, and he supports his family with the income he earns from this business. His children are growing and the house is no longer big enough to accommodate them. The requested loan is to build two rooms for his children. This is the seventh loan he has requested and his socioeconomic (credit) analysis qualifies him to receive the loan. He has been a client of IMPRO since 2002.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of two rooms

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y sus dos hijos.
La señora Petrona es comerciante y atiende su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en su domicilio y su esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte publico de esta ciudad.
El crédito solicitado es para incrementar los productos que tiene en su tienda y así mejorar los ingresos para la familia.
Esta es la octava vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petrona C. lives in her own home in the Llojeta zone, near the city of La Paz. Petrona lives with her husband and two children. She works at a small store in her home, and her husband works as a driver for public transportation in the city. This loan will be used to increase the products in Petrona's store and thereby increase the family's income. This is the eighth time that Petrona has used a loan and her socioeconomic analysis qualifies her for access to credit. She has been an IMPRO client since 2002.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater variety of products to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ángela del carmen M., tiene la edad de 40 años habita en el barrio , San Juan , junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos , todos menores de edad , actualmente estudian y le poyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace cinco años doña Ángela trabaja con las tierras que le heredo su papá , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio esta actividad con sus propios esfuerzos . Con el financiamiento obtenido va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio en el M..
texts.en:
Ángela del Carmen M. is 40 years old and she lives in the San Juan neighborhood along with her husband, who helps her with the household expenses. They have three children, all of whom are still minors. They study and also help her with the agricultural work. Her plan for her family’s future is to improve their living conditions. For the past five years, Ángela has been working the land she inherited from her father. Her biggest difficulty is the lack of financing. She began doing this work by her own initiative. With the financing obtained, she will buy fertilizers and other inputs to improve her crop so she can have a good harvest and sell at a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other inputs to improve her crop

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Orquídeas” dirigido por la señora Eliana es uno D. los bancos que a demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus pagos D. anteriores ciclos dentro D. la institución. En su mayoría  los integrantes D. este grupo numeroso se dedican a actividades D. índole comercial como la venta D. comida, ropa, carne y a la elaboración D. tejidos hechos a mano, pan y a actividades D. servicio como D. cuidado D. niños, empleados, enfermeras y agricultores. El financiamiento esta destinado a la adquisición D. mercaderías y al incremento D. su capital D. trabajo para seguir mejorando y crecer junto a la institución que le brinda un apoyo económico para sacar adelante a su familia y brindarle una mejor calida D. vida así como ayudar a la superación personal D. cada uno D. sus integrantes.
texts.en:
Eliana leads the Orquídeas group, which is one of the banks that has demonstrated responsibility and completion of their payments during previous loan cycles with the institution. For the most part, the members of this large group are involved in the businesses of selling food, selling clothes, selling meat, making handmaD. weavings, and making bread. Some members offer services such as taking care of children, working as employees, nurses and farmers. The loan is to get merchandise and increase working capital. This is in order to keep getting better and to grow together with the institution that offers them economic support. This support helps their families to get ahead and offers them a better quality of life. This is how to help to personally improve each one of its members.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia, trabaja en una empresa de distribución de libros,  su trabajo le ayudan para solventar la alimentación de ella su hijo y su madre que esta a su cargo.
Vive en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para salud ( Tratamiento médico de su madre “Fisioterápia” ya que sufrió el año pasado embolia y esta en plena recuperación). 
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Las ganas de colaborar con su madre le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Claudia works for a company that distributes books. Her work helps her feed herself, her son, and her mother, the latter two being in her care. She lives in a rented house in the Pampahasi area of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used for treatment (physical therapy for her mother, who suffered last year from an embolism and is in the process of a full recovery). This is the second time that she is requesting a loan through IMPRO. The desire to get treatment for her mother gives her the opportunity to have access to this loan. She has been our customer since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of physical therapy for her mother, who suffered an embolism and needs therapy to recuperate.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa trabaja en una imprenta como compaginadora, tiene un hijo que esta a su cargo en edad escolar.
Sus ingresos que tiene como compaginadora le ayudan para poder solventar los gastos de alimentación y educación de su hijo.
Vive en la zona de Villa Copacabana Sector Escobar Uria de La Paz en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de una computadora y así mejorar sus condiciones de estudios de su hijo.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de poder acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Rosa works in page makeup at a printer's shop. Her school age son is in her care. Her page-makeup income helps her to pay the expenses of feeding and educating her son. She lives in the Villa Copacabana area, Escobar Uria part of La Paz. This loan will be used to buy a computer and thereby give her son a valuable tool for studying. This is the second time that she is requesting a loan through IMPRO and the second time that she needs the help of KIVA. The desire to better herself gives her the opportunity to have access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a much-needed computer for her son.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es dueña de un minibús, el cual su esposo lo trabaja para transporte de pasajeros en el sindicato Trans Miraflores.
Vive en la zona de Villa Copacabana Sector Valle hermoso de la ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehiculo, pues es la fuente de ingresos para la familia.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is the owner of a van which her husband uses to transport passengers of the labor union Trans Miraflores. She lives in the Villa Copacabana Sector Valle Hermoso area of the city of La Paz, in the home of her parents. The loan will be used for the repair and maintenance of her vehicle, which is the source of income for her family. This is the second time she is requesting a loan through IMPRO. Her payment record qualifies her as a good customer.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of her van.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores .
Asunta  es conviviente tiene  41 años, dos hijos de 12 y 8 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Asunta estudio enfermaría pero no la ejerció, se puso a vender en los mercados  como ambulante por 18 años, hasta  que decidió confeccionar buzos en su casa y también  consiguió trabajo como enfermera.   
Desde que esta en Finca Asunta aprendió a ser responsable con los pagos, ser unidas, con sus compañeras. 
Asunta necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para compra de ropa por temporada.
El sueño de Asunta es que sus hijos sean profesionales y darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of The Flowers cooperative bank. Asunta is married, 41 years old, and has two children ages 12 and 8 that are studying at the public school. Asunta studied nursing, but never practiced. She started selling at the markets by the age of 18, until she decided to make sweatsuits from her home. She also got a job as a nurse. Since she has been with Finca, Asunta has learned how to be responsible with her payments and how to work in conjunction with her colleagues. Asunta needs a loan of 1,200 soles to buy seasonal clothing. Asunta’s dream is to see her children become professionals, and to be able to provide the very best for them.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Asunta needs a loan of 1,200 soles to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifanía es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores
Epifanía  es conviviente tiene 47 años dos hijos de 19 y 17 años que están estudiando en el instituto superior.
Epifanía trabajaba en un mercado atendiendo  en una librería, se independizo y puso en su casa una librería, le esta yendo bien. 
Desde que Epifanía esta en Finca se siente respaldada económicamente, aprendió a ser puntual.  
Epifanía necesita un préstamo 2600 soles, para la compra de abarrotes  y compra de ropa  
El sueño de Epifanía es tener una tienda de ropa  en gamarra.
texts.en:
Epifanía is a member of The Flowers cooperative bank. Epifanía is married, 47 years old, and has two children ages 19 and 17 that are studying. Epifanía worked at a market tending to a bookstore. She went off on her own, and opened a bookstore in her house that is doing well. Since Epifanía has been with Finca, she feels supported economically and has learned how to be punctual. Epifanía needs a loan of 2,600 soles to buy groceries and clothing. Epifanía’s dream is to one day have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and clothing.

loans.name: Ysabel Herlinda

texts.es:
Ysabel es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores.
Ysabel es casada tiene 44 años, cinco hijos  el mayor  23, que trabaja y los de   16, 14, 12, y 5  que están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Ysabel   empezó vendiendo zapatos, por que su hija  compraba por catalogo y decidió vender zapatos también  por las mañanas cocina para un restaurante.  
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a invertir y a ser responsable con los prestamos-
Ysabel necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles,  para la compra de zapato por catalogo y quiere abrir una librería en su casa.
El sueño de Ysabel poner un negocio en su casa de buffet  por que tiene su hija que es especial.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of The Flowers cooperative bank. Ysabel is married, 44 years old, and has five children. The oldest who is 23 works, and the ones ages 16, 14, 12 and 5 are studying at the public school. Ysabel started out selling shoes because her daughter bought by catalog and decided to sell shoes also. In the mornings, she cooks for a restaurant. Since she started with Finca, she has learned how to invest and be responsible with her loans. Ysabel needs a loan of 2,800 soles to buy shoes from catalogs, and also wants to open a bookstore in her house. Ysabel’s dream is to have a buffet business in her home, because she has her daughter who is special.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes by catalog, and she wants to open a bookstore in her home.

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores.
Maria es  madre soltera, tiene 64 años, tiene 8 hijos todos mayores y casados.
Maria vende de hace muchos años se dedico a la confección de sabanas, ofrece a sus vecinas los fines de semana vende anticuchos y parrilladas.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a ser responsable, le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal por que se encuentra con sus amigas.  
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles, para la tela para hacer sabanas. 
El sueño de Maria es abrir una tienda en su casa, y la esta arreglando.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of The Flowers cooperative bank. Maria is a single mother, 64 years old, and has 8 children who are now grown and married. Many years ago, Maria dedicated herself to making bedsheets that she sells to her neighbors. On weekends, she sells anticuchos and parrilladas (typical foods of the region). Since has been with Finca, she has learned how to be responsible. She very much enjoys the meetings of the community bank because she has a chance to spend time with her friends. Maria needs a loan of 1,800 soles, for the fabric to make her sheets. Maria’s dream is to open a store in her house, and she is working on it.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric for making bedsheets.

loans.name: Carmen Justina

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores
Carmen es madre soltera, tiene 43 años, un hijo de 10 años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Carmen empezó su negocio de bodega  con  los prestamos de Finca le  ayudaron mucho, su negocio fue creciendo poco  apoco, ahora ha aumentado Bodega  bazar librería.  
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió mucho de las clases de empresa que dan en el Bancomunal. 
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para arreglo de su bodega y compras de víveres.
El sueño de Carmen es arreglar el piso de su bodega.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of The Flowers cooperative bank. Carmen is a single mother, 43 years old, and has one 10-year-old son who is studying at the public school. Carmen started her store with Finca loans that have helped her a great deal. Her business grew little by little, and today she has expanded her store into a bazaar/bookstore. Since she has been with Finca she has learned a lot from the business classes given by the cooperative bank. Carmen needs a loan of 2,400 soles to improve her store and buy merchandise. Carmen’s dream is to repair the floor of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carmen needs a loan of 2,400 soles to improve her store and buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores
Maria es casada tiene 43 años , dos hijos de 18 y 22 años que están estudiando 
Maria,   estudio corte y confección, hace 13 años  empezó de curiosidad  haciendo cortinas para su casa y después para familiares y amistades, poco a poco le fueron pidiendo y recomendando, actualmente  tiene su pequeño taller  de confección su casa, ha podido comprar maquinas y herramientas para la confección de cortinas. 
Desde que esta en Finca , su negocio ha mejorado, aprendió a invertir. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para la compra de telas de cortinas y forros de muebles. 
El sueño de Maria es tener un taller de confecciones y una casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of "Las Flores" (The Flowers) Community Bank. Maria is married, is 43 years old and has two children who are 18 and 22 years old and who are students. Maria studied tailoring 13 years ago. Out of curiosity, she began making curtains for her house and later, for familiy members and friends. Gradually, they went to her with requests and recommendations. Currently, she has a small tailor's shop in her home. She has been able to buy machines and tools for curtain-making. Since joining FINCA, her business has improved and she has learned to invest. Maria needs a loan of 2,600 soles in order to purchase curtain fabric and furniture lining. Maria's dream is to have a shop and her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 2,600 soles in order to purchase curtain fabric and furniture lining.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores
Luzmila es casada tiene 32 años, dos hijos de 11 y 2 años, el mayor esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Luzmila  es de Puno llego a trabajar a Lima  hace 9 años, se puso a vender zapatillas en gamarra como ambulante, ahora  se puso a confeccionar buzos y vende a las tiendas en gamarra.  
Desde que Luzmila esta en Finca aprendió como llevar su negocio gracias a las charlas que recibe.
Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para la confección de buzos 
El sueño de Luzmila es alquilar una tienda en gamarra.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of "Las Flores" (The Flowers) Community Bank. Luzmila is married, is 32 years old and has two children who are 11 and 2 year of age. The eldest is studying at public school. Luzmila is from Puno. She came to work in Lima nine years ago. She started selling sneakers on foot in Gamarra (area of Lima). Now she has started making sweatshirts which she sells to the stores in Gamarra. Since joining FINCA, Luzmila has learned how to manage her business, thanks to the advice she receives. Luzmila needs a loan of 3,000 soles in order to make sweatshirts. Luzmila's dream is to rent a shop in Gamarra.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Luzmila needs a loan of 3,000 soles in order to make sweatshirts.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores.
Paola es  madre soltera 32 tiene dos hijos de 13 y 11 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Paola  vende hace seis años se separo de su esposo y se puso a trabajar en la venta de sándwich vende diario 40 panes.
Desde que Paola esta en Finca  ha empezado a surgir, esta involucrada en el Bancomunal es la tesorera, y le gusta la  solidaridad.
Paola  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de un carrito sanwichero.
El sueño de Paola es comprarse un carrito sanwichero.
texts.en:
Paola is a member of "Las Flores" (The Flowers) Community Bank. Paola is a single mother who is 32 years old and has two children who are 13 and 11 and who are students in public school. Paola separated from her husband six years ago and began working selling sandwiches. She sells 40 loaves daily. Since joining FINCA, Paola has begun to break forth. She is involved in the community bank as the treasurer and she likes the camraderie. Paola needs a loan of 1,000 soles in order to purchase a sandwich cart. Paola's dream is to buy herself said cart.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sandwich cart.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.es:
Aniceta es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores.
Aniceta es  madre sotera  tiene 53 años, tiene 2 hijos, que son mayores, son independientes 
Aniceta trabajaba en una fabrica de chompas , tuvo que dejar el trabajo por que empezó  a perder la vista y ya no le respondía y se dedico a la venta de productos por catalogo. 
Desde que esta en Finca tiene muchas facilidades  para trabajar por los prestamos que dan. 
Aniceta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  para la compra de productos por el día del padre, colonias, medias, correas.
El sueño de Aniceta es llegar hacer consultora  estrella.
texts.en:
Aniceta is a member of "Las Flores" (The Flowers) Community Bank. Aniceta is a single mother who is 53 years old and has two children who are adults and independent. Aniceta used to work in a sweater factory. She had to quit that job because she began to lose her sight and she dedicated herself to selling catalog products. Since joining FINCA, she has many facilities to work for the loans they give. Aniceta needs a loan of 1,000 soles in order to purchase products for Father's Day such as colognes, belts, socks. Aniceta's dream is to become a star saleswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for Father's Day such as colognes, belts, socks

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio B. F. es un señor de 47 años de edad, quien vive con su esposa y con sus 3 hijos que van desde los 5 a los 15 años. Ellos viven  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Debido a las pocas fuentes de empleo que ofrece la  comunidad, don Emilio se propuso  incursionar como microempresario en el área de la agricultura especializándose en el cultivo de chile picante para vender  tanto en su comunidad como en lugares vecinos, que según su criterio, hay un excelente mercado ya sea por medio de venta a intermediarios o al público directamente. 
Don Emilio  ya tiene experiencia en el cuidado y el mantenimiento que se requiere para esta clase de cultivo, ya que ha sembrado chile anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Emilio es un micro crédito de ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de plantas de chile, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del chile. 
Don Emilio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Emilio B. F. is 47 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children who are between 5 and 15 years old. They live in a small, rural community in Costa Rica named Las Delicias de Upala, located in the Alajuela province. There they develop activities such as trade, dual-purpose livestock breeding (meat and milk), and farming basic grains: rice, beans, maize, among others. Due to the few sources of employment offered in the community, Emilio is focused on venturing out as a small business entrepreneur in the agricultural area, specializing in the cultivation of spicy chillies to sell as much in his own community as in neighboring places. According to his criteria, there is an excellent market to sell as an intermediary or to the public directly. Emilio already has the kind of experience in taking care of and maintaining that is required for this type of crop since he has farmed chile previously. It has provided good results at distribution. As a result, he wishes to expand his farm since, thanks to this business, his family's quality of life has improved. At this time, Emilio is requesting a loan of 300,000 colones in order to help with the soil preparation and to purchase chile plants and fertilizers, among other inputs that are necessary to guarantee an optimal crop of chile. Emilio is a member of the Empresa de Credito Comunal Datraban, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and, with it, he hopes to continue growing at a personal and economic level. In addition, he points out that thanks to this type of organization and through facilitators of credit, he is able to dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spicy chile plants and farming needs.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Don Gustavo V. M. es un señor de 45 años de edad que vive con su madre , en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.
Debido a las pocas fuentes de empleo que ofrece la  comunidad, don Gustavo quiere  incursionar como microempresario en el área de la agricultura especializándose en la siembra de arroz para vender  tanto en su comunidad como en lugares vecinos, que según su criterio, hay un excelente mercado ya sea por medio de venta a intermediarios o al público directamente.
