Desde muy joven don Gustavo se ha dedicado a la siembra de arroz, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo tiene un terreno en el cual ha sembrado arroz anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente
Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Gustavo es un micro crédito de ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del terreno, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del arroz y lograr una buena cosecha.

Don Gustavo es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Mr. Gustavo V. M. is 45 years old and lives with his mother in a small rural community of Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala, located in the Alajuela Province. Businesses here include double-branched produce (meat and milk) and growing various basic grains such as rice, beans, and corn among others. As there is high unemployment, Gustavo wishes to begin a small agricultural business specializing in growing rice to sell in the community. According to Gustavo, there is an excellent market to sell to middlemen or directly to the public. Gustavo has worked growing rice since he was very young so he has experience caring and maintaining this type of harvest. He has land in which he as grown rice before with good results, which is why he wants to grow more. Thanks to this type of business he has considerably improved his family's quality of life. Gustavo is now requesting a micro loan of 300,000 colones to prepare the land, and buy seed, fertilizer and other supplies necessary to guarantee an optimal rice harvest. Gustavo is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban (The Datraban Business Credit Collective), one of 100 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to grow personally and economically. He notes that thanks to this type of organization and other loan facilitating means he has been able to spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for rice production

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: La señora Raquel González, tiene la edad 32 años habita en le barrio, Las Enramadas, junto a su esposo el cual  trabaja, para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo una niña de doce años la cual estudia actualmente su secundaria, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a su hijas con sus estudios doña Raquel desde hace 5 años trabaja como comerciante, vende ropa, zapatos, adornos entre otros,  Con el financiamiento obtenido va a compra materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su vivienda y poder tener una vivienda digna, este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic el cual da las gracias por los beneficios obtenido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Raquel González is 32 years old and lives in the Las Enramadas neighborhood with her husband. He works to help with the household expenses. They care for a 12-year-old girl who is in high school. Their plans for the future include improving their living conditions and providing for their daughters' educations. Raquel has worked the past five years selling clothing, shoes, and home decor among other things. With the loan they are requesting they will buy construction materials to make some improvements on the building where they live in order make it livable. This is her sixth loan with Afodenic and she is grateful for the many benefits she has received to date.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve their home

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos P.  C. es un joven señor de 28 años de edad que vive con su padre en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Debido a las pocas fuentes de empleo que ofrece la  comunidad, Juan Carlos se propuso  incursionar como microempresario en el área de la agricultura, especializándose en la siembra de arroz para vender  tanto en su comunidad como en lugares vecinos, que según su criterio, hay un excelente mercado ya sea por medio de venta a intermediarios o al público directamente. 

Desde hace 2 años que Juan Carlos empezó con el proyecto de siembra de arroz, dice que su padre lo instruyó y le enseñó sobre  el cuidado y el mantenimiento que se requiere para esta clase de cultivo, tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual ha sembrado arroz anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo; por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Juan Carlos es un micro crédito de ¢684,000 (seiscientos ochenta y cuatro mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, compra de abono, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del arroz y lograr una buena cosecha.

Juan Carlos es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos P. C. is a 28-year-old young man who lives with his father in a small rural community of Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala, located in the Alajuela Province. Businesses here include double-branched produce (meat and milk) and growing various basic grains such as rice, beans, and corn among others. As there is high unemployment, Juan Carlos wishes to begin a small agricultural business specializing in growing rice to sell locally as well as to neighboring communities. According to Juan Carlos, there is an excellent market to sell to middlemen or directly to the public.

Two years ago he began to grow rice, taught by his father how to care and maintain for this type of crop. He has a small plot of land where he has previously sown rice and had good results. Now he would like to expand this crop since thanks to its profitability he has been able to improve his family's quality of life considerably.

Juan Carlos is now requesting a micro loan of 684,000 colones to prepare the land, and buy seed, fertilizer and other supplies necessary to guarantee an optimal rice harvest. Juan Carlos is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban (The Datraban Business Credit Collective), one of 100 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and with it he hopes to grow personally and economically. He notes that thanks to this type of organization and other loan facilitating means he has been able to spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for rice production

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena D., tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el barrio los madrigales Nortes, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como chofer para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos, los cuales estudian actualmente, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Maria desde hace quince años trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa privada, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento. Con el financiamiento obtenido va comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su vivienda y poder tener una casa digna, da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo y los beneficios que ha otorgado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elena D. is 38 years old, and lives with her husband in the Madrigales Nortes neighborhood. He works as a chauffeur to help with the household expenses. They have two school-aged daughters. Their future plans are to improve their living conditions. Maria has worked for fifteen years as a domestic worker in a private home. Their greatest obstacle is lack of financing. With this loan they will buy construction materials to make improvements on their home to make it livable. She is grateful to Afodenic for its support and the benefits received to date.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve their home

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es: El señor Orlando José M. Z. , tiene la edad de 69 años habita en el barrio , la borgoña , ubicado en l municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene cuatros hijos , ya todo casados e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es apoyar siempre a sus hijos y poder establecer mas  cultivos para que ellos trabajen juntos , don Orlando desde hace 40 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor afectación son las plagas y el mal tiempo , ya que en ocasiones ha perdido cultivo, con este crédito va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo y poder vender lograr una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio en el mercado
texts.en:
Mr. Orlando José M. Z. is 69 years old and lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood of the Ticuantepe municipality. Together with his wife, who maintains the house, he has four grown and independent children who are all married. His plans for his family are to always support his children and help them establish more agricultural fields so they may work together. Orlando has worked 40 years in agriculture. The worst problems he has experienced have been plagues and poor weather, at times causing him to lose the harvest. With this loan he will buy supplies and fertilizers to improve the yield in order to get the best price at market for a successful harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers to improve the harvest.

loans.name: Claricsa Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Claricsa del Socorro López, tiene la edad de 41 años, habita en el barrio , el edén , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , ella es madre soltera , tiene cuatro hijos , dos ya son casado y le apoyan con los gastos del hogar y los otros estudian todavía , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder terminar de construir su casa  desde hace 31 años doña Claricsa trabaja como agricultura , la mayor dificultad son las plagas invaden el cultivo  ya que por falta de financiamiento  no puede cubrir para funigar,  Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una mejor cosecha y poder tener mejores beneficios, ya que gracias Afodenic esta logrando poder salir adelante con sus proyecto.
texts.en:
Claricsa del Socorro López is 41 years old and lives in the El Edén neighborhood, which is located in the city of of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother to four children. Two of them are married and they help her with the household expenses. The others are still studying. Her plans for the future are to improve her living conditions and to be able to finish building her house. Claricsa has been working as a farmer for 31 years. The biggest difficulty is that pests invade the crop because, for lack of funds, she is unable to use pesticides. With the loan she will buy fertilizers and other inputs to obtain a better harvest and a better income. Thanks to Afodenic, she is able to make progress with her project.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other inputs to improve her crops

loans.name: Cecilio Efrain

texts.es: El señor Cecilio Efraín O., tiene la edad de 46 años, habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos, junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene tres hijos de catorce, once y seis años; ellos estudian y le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace 30 años don Cecilio se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado establecer parte de sus cultivos , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Cecilio Efraín O. is 46 years old. He lives in San José de los Ríos with is wife, who helps him with the household expenses. They have three children, who are 14, 11, and 6 years old. They study and also help with the agricultural work. His plan for his family is to improve their living conditions. Cecilio has been farming for 30 years. It is through his own initiative that he has been able to establish part of his crops. The biggest difficulty he has is the lack of financing. With the loan he will buy fertilizers and other inputs to apply to his crop so he can sell it at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other inputs to improve his crop

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: La señora Martha Rosa R. tiene la edad de 47 años, habita en el barrio las Conchitas, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienes siete hijos de los cuales tres ya son casado y cuatros que están a su cargo, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, desde hace 8 años doña Martha se dedica a la agricultura la mayor afectación ha sido por las plagas que afectan al cultivo por falta de fertilizantes e insumos. Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar los insumos necesarios para tener una mejor producción y vender a mejor precio en el mercado
texts.en:
Ms. Martha is 47 years old and lives in the Conchitas neighborhood with her husband. Her husband works to help her with household costs. They have seven children, of which three are married and four are still supported by them. Their plan for the future is to improve their living conditions.

For the past 8 years, Martha has worked in agriculture. Her worst problem has been with pests affecting her crops because of a lack of fertilizers and agricultural supplies. With this loan she will purchase agricultural supplies to improve production and sell at higher prices in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Carmen Lidia

texts.es:
Carmen Lidia U. B. es una señora de 51 años de edad, la cual vive con su pareja, un hijo y una nieta de 7 años. 

La comunidad en la cual vive doña Carmen se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a una hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable debido a las fuertes lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Años atrás, cuando no existían actividades productivas viables, muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajo en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Doña Carmen instaló su negocio, una “soda” (un pequeño restaurante de comida criolla) en su propia casa. Dice que de esta forma puede ayudar con los gastos en su casa y que además se siente feliz de tener su propio negocio ya que ha tenido muy  buena aceptación en su comunidad. Ella comenta que el mayor  atractivo de su soda son los tamales, los cuales son una comida muy típica de Costa Rica. 
Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢500.000(quinientos mil colones) para comprar más mercadería que pueda vender,  hacer más grande el negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a sus vecinos y turistas que pasen por la zona. Específicamente comprará una máquina de moler maíz, una olla extra grande para cocinar los Tamales, un recipiente grande para batir la masa, una canasta plástica para vender el producto y los ingredientes necesarios para su elaboración. 

Doña Carmen  es socia de Asociación de Productores del Sauce de Santa Teresita, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Carmen Lidia U. B. is 51 years old and lives with her partner, her son and her 7 year old granddaughter.

The community in which Ms. Carmen lives is called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the Cartago province. It is a small rural community of approximately two thousand inhabitants. The residents work in milk production and coffee planting. The terrain is uneven and much of the land is tropical rainforest. The community has a very picturesque landscape that combines the tropical forest with two beautiful lagoons, coffee plantations and dairies. El Sauce is located approximately an hour and a half by bus from Turrialba, the city and commercial center. Unfortunately, several times a year the road becomes impassible due to the heavy rains that batter the region. This is, without a doubt, one of community’s main challenges.

Years ago, when no viable productive activities existed, many people opted to leave and look for work in Turrialba or in banana plantations located in the Atlantic region of Costa Rica. Presently coffee and milk prices have improved so residents are figuring out how to invest in projects in the same area and this way avoid having to move.

Ms. Carmen started her business, a small restaurant with Creole food called a “soda”, in her own house. She says that this way she can help with household expenses and she also feels happy to have her own business because she has been very well received in the community. Carmen commented that the biggest attraction in her restaurant are the tamales, which are a very typical food in Costa Rica.

Right now she needs a loan of 500,000 colones (Costa Rican Currency) to purchase more merchandise that she can sell, to increase her business and offer better service to her neighbors and the tourists who pass through the area. More specifically, she will buy a machine to grind corn, an extra large pot to cook tamales in, a large container to mix the dough in, a plastic basket to sell the product, and the ingredients necessary for its production.

Ms. Carmen is a member of the Productores del Sauce de Santa Teresita Association, one of the 100 member groups of the EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and with it she hopes to grow on a personal and economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of utensils and supplies to make Tamales.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene tiene 52 años, vive en su casa propia con su última hija de 16 años. Desde hace más de 16 años vende productos lácteos (yogurt, mantequilla y quesos), se inició con poco, pero ahora reparte a los clientes regulares que tiene en las ferias comerciales cercanas a su localidad. Generalmente vende al crédito, reparte sus productos y luego de un tiempo, acordado con el cliente, regresa para el cobro. Con este tipo de trabajo realiza viajes constantes a las zonas aledañas a su ciudad, tanto para abastecerse, como para vender sus productos. Hasta el momento sus ventas han dado buenos resultados y puede sostener ella sola la economía de su casa, por lo que tiene planes de seguir con la misma modalidad de trabajo. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella se retiró por una temporada de su banco comunal, por motivo de viaje, pero ahora se reintegra porque sus compañeros conocen que es una persona responsable en sus pagos, además que ella misma se compromete a seguir trabajando así. El dinero que está solicitando es para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería en quesos y mantequilla.
texts.en:
Irene is 52 years old and lives in her own house with her oldest daughter who is 16. For more than 16 years she has been selling milk products (yogurt, butter and cheese). She began with little but now she distributes to regular clients at the markets in her area.

Generally she sells on credit, delivers her products, and after a time agreed upon with the client, she returns to collect payment. With this type of work she is constantly traveling to the small towns around her city, both to stock up and to sell her products. Up until now her sales have been producing good results and she can meet all her household expenses, so she plans to continue working the same way.

This is the 6th time she has had a loan from MFP. She had withdrawn from the communal bank for a while because of travel, but she has now returned because her fellow members know that she is responsible with her payments and she promises to continue this way. The loan she is requesting is to purchase a larger quantity of cheese and butter.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 28 años, vive en casa de sus padres con su pequeño hijo de 8 años. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de artículos variados para el arreglo personal y para el hogar, vendía de manera ambulante, pero recientemente adquirió la renta de un local comercial para poder vender de manera más estable, y ahora los riesgos a los que se exponía al vender en la calle se reducen, además que puede estar más tiempo al lado de su hijo. Debido a la dinámica de este trabajo, las ganancias que obtiene son muy buenas, por lo que Judith ha optado por  seguir vendiendo de esta forma y crecentar su mercadería. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de su actual banco comunal y se siente muy contenta por ello, ya que sabe que aprenderá mucho. El dinero que está solicitando es para adquirir más mercadería para implementar su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Judith is 28 years old and she lives in her parent’s house with her 8 year-old son. For 2 years she has been selling a variety of items for personal and household use. She was working as a street vendor, but recently she rented a store so she could sell in a more stable manner. Now she is exposed to fewer of the risks she confronted when selling in the street and she can also spend more time with her son. Because of the type of job this is, her earnings are very good, so Judith has decided to continue selling this way and increase her merchandise. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She was invited to join the current communal bank and she is very happy about this because she knows she will learn a lot. The loan she is requesting is to purchase more merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de artesanías y frazadas (cobertores de cama) que lleva hasta otra ciudad para su comercialización, su esposo la ayuda a realizar estos largos viajes, ya que no puede cargar sola la mercadería que compra. Este trabajo es una gran ayuda para la economía de su casa, a pesar de que es arriesgado por los largos viajes, debido a los accidentes en carretera, pero las ganancias la animan a continuar con esta actividad, ya que su meta es ahorrar lo suficiente para emprender otro negocio que le permita estar en su misma ciudad. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy satisfecha por la labor que viene realizando y se compromete, una vez más, a seguir siendo responsable y solidaria con su grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de más frazadas y artesanías.
texts.en:
Luz is 37 years old and she lives with her husband and 3 children. She sells crafts and bed covers, which she takes to another city to sell. Her husband helps her with these long trips since she can’t carry all of the merchandise by herself. This job is a big help to her household economy, even though it’s dangerous because of the long trips and traffic accidents on the road. However, the earnings motivate her to continue with this line of work, since her goal is to save enough to start another business that would allow her to work in her own town. This is the second loan she has had with MFP. She is happy with the work she is doing and promises, again, to continue being responsible and in solidarity with her group. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more bed covers and crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 34 años, vive con su hijo de 17 años en casa de su madre. Se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en la feria comercial de su ciudad, de preferencia sale los domingos, ya que en ese día hay mayores posibilidades de ventas, por lo que siempre cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo para cargar los paquetes de mercadería que transporta. Empezó hace 5 años, y hasta el momento su negocio le ha resultado rentable, lo que la motiva a continuar para incrementar cada vez más su capital de trabajo. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy segura de permanecer en su banco comunal, pues le agrada la forma de trabajo de todos sus compañeros. El dinero que está solicitando es para adquirir nueva mercadería, y con ella regresar a la feria de su localidad, ya que en las últimas oportunidades, por tener menos prendas, solo vendía por su barrio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 34 years old. She lives with her 17 year-old son in her mother’s house. She sells clothing as a street vendor in the city’s market. She prefers to sell on Sundays, since the possibility of making sales is greatest on this day. She always counts on her son’s help to carry the packages of merchandise that she transports. She began with this 5 years ago, and so far the business has been profitable. This is what motivates her to continue increasing her working capital. This the second time she has had a loan with MFP and she is certain that she will stay with her communal bank because she likes working with all of the group’s members. The loan she is requesting is to purchase new merchandise. With new merchandise she can return to selling in her town’s market; the last few times she only sold in her neighborhood because she didn’t have many items of clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.es: Nemesia tiene 59 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida, recientemente, hace 3 meses, alquiló un local donde atiende todos los días por las mañanas, ya que por las tardes se dedica a preparar todo lo necesario para el día siguiente. Debido a su buena sazón ha logrado incrementar su clientela regular, lo cual es muy importante porque sabe la cantidad de porciones seguras que vende diariamente, con las que obtiene las ganancias para sustentar las necesidades de su casa y el capital para su negocio al día siguiente. Sus planes a corto tiempo son de decorar su local e implementar mejor su cocina. Es la primera vez que Nemesia tiene un préstamo con MFP, y tiene grandes deseos de ser una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de mesas y una pequeña cocina a gas.
texts.en:
Nemesia is 59 years old and lives with her 4 children in her own home. She has been selling food for 4 years and recently, about 3 months ago, she rented a location from which she works during the morning since during the afternoon she works preparing food for the following day. Due to her flavorful food she has managed to increase the number of regular clients that she has, which is very important because she know the quantity of servings that she'll sell daily through which she obtains the income to cover the household expenses and the business capital for the following day. Her short-term plans are to decorate her business location and improve her kitchen. This is the first time that Nemesia has had a loan with MFP and she has a great desire to be one of the most active members of her communal bank. The requested money will be used to purchase tables and a small gas stove.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and improvments to restaurant kitchen

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela B., 59, is from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Miguela is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Miguela owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector farming. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Miguela has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns ~1,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Miguela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miguela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for growing corn. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Miguela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business and to support her family's basic needs.
 
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for growing corn

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna E. is a 46-year-old mother of one child. She and her husband work together in their farm to grow rice. The income generated from this business is spent to buy basic needs and to pay her children’s tuition fees. In addition to growing rice, she also raises pigs. Her pigsty is at a close distance from her house. Erna says pig-raising is as profitable as rice-farming. She would like to ask a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI to purchase fertilizers and chemicals to help improve her farm yield. 

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides financial services, trainings and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals to improve farm yield

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn L. manages a small rice field. She and her husband till a 1-hectare farm. She uses the proceeds from her harvest to feed and buy the things needed by their family. She is 38 years old and has two children. 

Genelyn is seeking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and chemicals for the farm, to improve the size of her harvest. 

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides not only loans, but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals for the farm

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D. is 19 years old and blessed with three children. She is married to Roque D., a plaser (a gold miner using the traditional system of mining). She sells vegetables and bananas.

Julieta is a hardworking mother. Everyday, she peddles her vegetables and bananas in her neighborhood and nearby villages. Unfortunately, the income is not sufficient to provide for the needs of her family. She wants to expand her business by adding some varieties of vegetables. She is planning to apply for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 5, 000. This will give her a higher income and help fulfill the demands of the customers. With this, she can give the family a good and comfortable living. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her application.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and bananas

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group comprised of five borrowers, all of whom live in the province of Siem Reap. Its leader, Mrs. B. is a 46-year-old widowed mother who has two children. One of them is single and the other is married and has ready started a new family home.

At present, B. has a job as a community consultant adviser in the village. Beside her civil seven work, she also sells both food and wine to the customers who come to eat and drink at her home. From this investment, she can generate approximately $4 each day.

Since 2007, B. has been facing difficulty with transportation - she always took a taxi at the highest price. To reduce the transportation costs, B. is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle so that she can use it to support her business operations.

The other borrowers who have joined this loan:

Mrs. S., a staff member for a hotel, is asking for a loan to pay an electricity bill.
Mr. C. will use the loan to replace his old motorbike taxi. 
Mr. K. requests a loan in order to buy a motor to replace a broken one.
Mrs. S. will be using a loan to purchase additional fruit to better meet her customer's requirements.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to reduce her transportation costs

loans.name: Chong

texts.en:
Chong C., age 49, is a local fisherman who has been fishing for more than nineteen years. He is very widely known in his business. He always goes fishing in and around the Tunle Sap River, which is full of fish. He brings his fish to the local market for his wife to sell.

Chong C. has four children who are single and are no longer in school. To help meet the family's expenses a little better, two of his children are employed as domestic building worker in the community.

Chong C. will use the loan money to purchase extra fishing equipment to support his business during the approaching fish season.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing equipment

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
"I have been helping my husband raise our pigs. This has been our livelihood since we got married and had children. Piggery is a profitable business. I enjoy taking care of our pigs so much so much and earning an income for our family," says Elisa L., a 50-year-old mother of nine children.

Elisa is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase feed for the pigs. The loan will also help her whole family to expand their businesses and increase their income.

CEVI is reaching out to people to sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides its clients not just with loans, but also with training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
"Before, I was selling food items in the streets. I stopped selling when we started to grow rice for our livelihood. My husband is a farmer. He is the one who manages our small rice field. Our harvest is mainly intended for family use. When there is excess, we sell our rice to our neighbors," says Janeth E., 44-year-old mother of two children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will definitely help her expand her harvest and improve her income.

CEVI is help more people to start businesses. CEVI provides its clients with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, such as fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria V. is from the village of Cabol-anonan in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 50 years old. Gleceria is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Gleceria makes and sells food. She sells a variety of food in the local community. Gleceria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In May 2009, Gleceria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gleceria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be Gleceria first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn C. helps her husband to till their two-hectare (~ 5-acre) rice farm. She is 39 years old and a mother of three children. She and her husband want to expand their business even more. They use the harvest from their farm to feed and clothe their children.

Analyn would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and chemicals. With the loan that she will borrow from CEVI, she has the chance to improve her harvest.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just credit, but training and insurance coverage, as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en:
Altansuh C. is married and the father of two daughters. His family lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic housing, like a yurt) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His eldest daughter goes to an elementary school, and his youngest, who is 3 years old, stays at home.

With his spouse, Gereltuya, Altansuh has been running a shoe sales business since 2001. He goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, twice every month and to Beijing once a quarter, to purchase girls' shoes at wholesale prices. His spouse, Gereltuya, sells the shoes at her shoe stall, which is located at the Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. The market runs year round despite the extreme winter temperatures.

During the last three years, he has been building a house for himself and for his family. He is planning to complete the house in the coming autumn and move in. Altansuh hopes to have his own indoor stall to prevent his wife from getting sick from working outside during the freezing winter. With this loan, he will buy more shoes for his business and construction material to complete the house where his family will live.

loans.use: To buy shoes and construction material

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane P. has been raising pigs for several years. She is 34 years old and the mother of six children. Her husband, Hernane P. Jr., is a farmer. They started their piggery business with only two piglets. Aside form pigs, the couple also grows rice. At present, they have one sow and nine piglets.

Mary Jane would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy pig feed. The feed is quite expensive. She needs additional resource to raise more pigs.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage, as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy A. is from the village of Libertad Alto in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 34 years old. Daisy is single. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in her local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 1,200.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

Daisy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Daisy's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Glesiel

texts.en:
Glesiel D. is from the village of Tinacla-an in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 34 years old. Glesiel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Glesiel raises pigs for sale. Glesiel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Glesiel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glesiel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell in future.

Glesiel is requesting a new loan of 9500 PHP that she will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Glesiel's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Hongorzul

texts.en:
Hongorzul H. is 31 years old. She is married and is the mother of two daughters. Her family lives in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter, Anujin, is 7 and attends an elementary school. The youngest is only 9 months old.

In 2003, Hongorzul and her husband, Undrah, opened an internet center and a cafe near her home. To increase her business income, she moved her business to a location downtown and switched from a cafe to a pub. Her monthly income has increased as a result of the good location, although her rent is dramatically higher.

Hongorzul is a humble and hard-working person who wishes to have a big family with many children. She says "My family had been living with my parents for many years. Only in the last two years, has my family has been living on our own. I really want to have my own condominium. My husband and I are planning to take out a mortgage from XacBank (Kiva's partner microfinance institution). We are working hard to save for a down payment."

With this loan, Hongorzul will pay her business rent for next 6 months.

loans.use: To pay her business rent for next six months.

loans.name: Jo-An

texts.en:
Jo-An H. raises pigs. She is 24 years old and has one child. She started her business with two piglets. Now she has one sow and seven piglets. Her business is doing so well. Her husband, Thelmo H., a farmer, has been very supportive of her in her business.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase pig feed. The loan will really give her a chance to expand her business more.

Through CEVI, she has been able to sustain her livelihood for a long time. CEVI provided her not just loans but training and insurance coverage, as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Cherry Belle

texts.en:
Cherry Belle C. is from the village of Poblacion in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 38 years old. Cherry Belle is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry Belle runs a repair service in her local community. Cherry Belle has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Cherry Belle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry Belle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000.00 PHP from PMPC. She use her previous loan to purchase business supplies. Cherry Belle is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP that she will use to buy more business supplies. This loan will be Cherry Belle's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy business supplies

loans.name: Liney

texts.en:
Liney S. is from the village of Tinaclaan in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 29 years old. Liney is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Liney owns and operates a construction business. Liney has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Liney joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liney has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000.00 PHP from PMPC. She used the previous loan to purchase materials that she needs for her business. Liney is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This loan will be Liney's third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory use as working capital

loans.name: Otgonpurev

texts.en:
Otgonpuregv O. is 34 years old. He is married and is the father of two children, both of whom attend an elementary school. His family lives in a small house with one room in a "ger" (a yurt or nomadic housing tent) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

With his spouse, Tuvshinjargal, he has been selling firewood. He buys timber mostly at wholesale prices, cuts and bags the wood, and resells it. To expand his retail business, he aims to open a small store next to his little house on the plot of land he owns.

In the summer of 2007, he started baking bricks manually to sell. Baking a brick manually takes time and hard work. Otgonpurev intends to buy an automated brick baker. His plan is to build a store and a big house instead of the one room small house in which they now live. Otgonpurev says that "it is tough to live with four people in such a small house. I'm looking forward to having a big beautiful house with many bedrooms where my daughters can grow up for several years."

With this loan, he will buy a brick baking machine.

In the picture, Otgonpurev is sawing firewood with his spouse and one of his son.

loans.use: To buy a brick-baking machine

loans.name: Rose Jone

texts.en:
Rose Jone C. raises and sells hogs. She is 45 years old and has five children. Her husband, Rafael C., is a farmer. In addition to raising pigs, they grow rice and other crops to supplement their income. She started her piggery with only two piglets. Now, she wanted to expand her piggery to earn more income for her family.

Rose Jone is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase feed for her pigs. She thinks that her loan will help greatly to expand her business.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients, not just with loans, but training and insurance coverage, as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of Senor in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 56 years old. Evangeline is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Evangeline grows and sells corn. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. She use her previous loan to purchase seed, seedlings, and young crops to raise, and to pay for services rendered to increase yield.

Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP that she will use to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be Evangeline's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn T. is from the village of Sinonoc,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Evelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling seafoods such as shrimp,fish,crabs and etc…. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafoods to the local community members. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Florgie

texts.en:
Florgie B. is from the village of Cabol-anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Florgie is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Florgie provides transportation services to local community members. Florgie is just starting this business.

In May 2009, Florgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florgie is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Florgie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda O. is 61 years old this year. She is a widow and has four married children. She has had a farm since 1964. At present, she still manages to farm with the help of her laborers. Based on past experience, she will earned 20,000 PHP to 30,000 PHP every harvest.
She needs additional capital to run her business. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities.
CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides its clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A., 51, is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns ~2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S., 33, is from the village of Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns ~2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members. 


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina S. has been engaged in rice farming since 20 years. Her husband, Loreto S., is experienced in tilling and sowing seeds. They have been growing rice all their life. They are able to earn PHP 20,000 from every harvest. They have eight children and they want to send all of them to school. Regina is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI to purchase farming materials such as fertilizers and insecticides. She feels that the loan will really help her achieve better farm yield.

CEVI provides credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage services to all its clients to help them grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase farming materials such as fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina L. is a 53 year old mother of six children. She is renting a rice farm. She grows rice to be able to buy the things they need in their home. Someday she wishes to have her own farm. In that way, she could enjoy all her harvest and improve their family living conditions.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. "With my loan, I could be able to improve our harvest", she said.

CEVI is helping people to sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides all their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en:
Oyuntuya D. lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The two oldest children are university students in the city and the youngest son goes to a local kindergarten.

Oyuntuya has a small business selling food. She rents a stall in the local food market and sells various food products, mostly half/un-processed poultry products. She started her business in 1993 with the help of her husband. She is an authorized seller of chicken products from Bohog Od, one of the largest poultry companies.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and make sure that she leaves a successful business for her children. She requests a loan to purchase more products from Bohog Od for her business.

loans.use: To purchase poultry products from poultry companies for her business.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia A. is 63 years old this year. She is a retired teacher.  Now she is just managing a small rice field in their location. She has three children. For 30 years she was able to sustain her farming business. Every harvest, she earned from Php 30,000 to Php 60,000 on her farm.

She needs additional resources to finance all her farming needs. She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

CEVI provides their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Soyol-Erdene

texts.en:
Soyol-Erdene B. lives with his wife and two year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Soyol-Erdene's mother-in-law lives with them and takes care of her infant grandson when his parents are away at work.

Soyol-Erdene has a small business in food retail, specifically focusing on fresh vegetables. He rents two stalls in "Burd" a local food market in which he sells various fresh vegetables. Although he just launched this business in early 2008, he has successfully opened one more stall for fresh vegetables and two other stalls for meat products. He is mainly in charge of the fresh vegetable stalls and his wife sits at the meat stalls.

In the future, Soyol-Erdene wants to enter the wholesale market for fresh vegetables and meat products. He requests a loan to purchase more fresh vegetables and meat for his business.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables and meat to sell.

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee D. lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest son is a student at the Mongolian University of Science and Technology and the youngest son goes to a local high school. Tsetsgee has a small business sewing. She opened her small shop in 2004 and now offers various sewing services, including alterations. Since the beginning, she has been quite successful and gained frequent loyal customers.

In the future, she would like to expand and leave a successful business for her children. She requests a loan to purchase more tailoring materials for her business and to fix the sewing shop.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and fix the sewing shop.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Boldbaatar G. lives with his wife and two children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two children go to a local kindergarten. Boldbaatar has a small butchery business, which he and his wife started in 2003. He travels to herders in remote areas in the countryside to purchases sheep and goats. Once he brings the livestock home, he slaughters them and sells the meat wholesale in the local food market and the meat markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since the start, his business has expanded and his business capital has increased from 800,000 to 3,500,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT).

In the future, he would like to expand his business and be more successful. He requests a loan to purchase more livestock for his business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his business.

loans.name: Savit

texts.en:
Mr. Savit U. is 35 years old and his wife, Sreypov But, is 36. They were married in 1991 and have five sons. Three of their sons are in school and the other two are still young. The family lives along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Savit has been driving a motor taxi for six years. He drives from his village to Phnom Penh and back. Mrs. Sreypov has been selling corn for eight years. She buys them from a nearby commune for resale in Phnom Penh market. Savit’s wife needs money to pay for corn before harvesting season, so he is asking for his first loan of $500 to help fund his wife's business.

loans.use: To purchase corn on contract for next season.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario B. is 55 years old this year. She is a widow and has eight children. She has a small rice field that she has been managing on her own since the death of her husband. For 25 years, she has been tilling the field and reaping an average of 80 sacks of rice grains every harvest. The farm has helped her buy the things the family needs. This will be the same farm that she will give to her children in the future.

She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will help increase her harvest and income.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. Tha T., 31, and her husband, Mr. Him Hong, 30, were married in 2004 and have just one young son. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Tha has been a silk weaver for ten years; it’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Mr. Him Hong has been driving a horse and cart for seven years. He is hired by his villagers to haul dirt for leveling their house foundations. 

Unfortunately, the horse has died and he could not continue his business. Therefore, Tha is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a horse for her husband’s business, and also to buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase a horse for her husband's business and silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: "I have a two-hectare (5-acre) farm. My husband and I have been tilling our farm for 20 years already. We want to grow our farm to be able to support the needs of our family," says Sally D., 43-year old mother of five children. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will help her farm achieve its maximum harvest. In that way, she could easily buy the things they need. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It gives its clients not just credit assistance but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon, 45, is a widow. She has one son (shown in the photograph) who is married, but lives in the family house. She also has her daughter-in law and one grandchild living with her. The family lives in a small village of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Pon has been cutting grass for sale as cow fodder for two years. Her son has been driving a motorcycle taxi since 2006. He drives from his village to Takhmao market which is about four kilometers from his village and back. But, his old motorbike doesn’t work properly which has upset his business. Therefore, Pon is requesting a loan of $300 in order to replace the old motorbike so that her son is able to continue his business.

loans.use: To replace her son's old motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
"My wife and I have been engaged in farming for 15 years now. We have been tilling a 1.5 hectare farm so that we can provide for our family's needs. We wanted to buy another hectare of farmland. The harvest is used to feed our children and for business as well", says Eugenio D., a 40-year-old father of one child.

Eugenio is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. He thinks that by doing so, he will be able to improve the harvest. With CEVI's help, Eugenio is able to sustain his livelihood. CEVI provides him not only with loans but with training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros, 55, and her husband, Mr. Then Tep, 52, live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1981 and have four children: one son and three daughters. All of the children are married, but two of her daughters live in the family home.

Ros has been selling flowers for 20 years; she buys thE. from farmers in her village for resale in the market in Phnom Penh. She is able to receive gross profit of about $10 to $12.50 per week. Mr. Then Tep has been driving a remoque taxi (a motorbike with a trailer at the back) for over seven years. 

Ros is applying for her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Mrs Chanthou S., 25, and her husband, Mr Sothea Phat, 20, live along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 2004 and have one young daughter.  Chanthou and her husband have full-time employment in the same company. They don’t have their own motorcycle so they spend a lot of money on travel costs, such as motor taxis and so on. Therefore, Chanthou is requesting her first loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S., age 46, and her husband, Mr. Yorn Yin, age 45, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1990 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of their children attend school, three children are weavers and the youngest son is still too young and stays at home.

Saroeun has been a silk weaver for almost eighteen years. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a house builder and rice grower for the last ten years. He is a horse and cart driver as well. 

Saroeun has set up two more looms for her children to weave on, but they don’t have enough silk materials to continue their business. Therefore, Saroeun is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for her children’s looms.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her children’s weaving business

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita A. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 32 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Lita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Lita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth L., a 44-year-old mother of three children, has owned a rice farm with her husband since the start of their marriage. Their farm income has enabled them to send their children to school. As well, they own one passenger multicab and raise pigs to supplement their income. Elizabeth is now requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI to purchase fertilizers and chemicals to help increase their farm yield.

CEVI is reaching out to people to start and maintain businesses, providing their clients not just with loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Mr. Theary V., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Soklim Nao, 30 were married in 2003 and have three sons and two daughters. Their eldest son attends school and the other two are still too young. The family lives in a small village on National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Mrs. Soklim Nao has been a garment factory worker for six years.

Theary has been selling cows for over twenty years. He buys them from his villagers and the nearby district for resale to a middleman who comes to buy the cows at his house. Theary is applying for his first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows for resale

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Noralyn S. has been a Paglaum member under its PDP-LP program since April 23, 2007. Residing at Nilabo, Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte, she is married to Rodelio S. and has two children.

She's requesting her loan of PHP 16,000 to use as additional capital in buying fertilizers for their camote (sweet potato) plantation and she's also planning to have their own banana trees as their additional source of income.

Her plan for her family is to finish her children in school until college so that they are able to find decent and stable jobs someday.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for farm production

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthol C., 40, and her husband, Mr. Sarun C., 47, were married in 1985 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of their daughters is a garment factory worker, three children are in school and the other one is still too young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chanthol has been selling onsorm cake for fish for three years (onsorm is a kind of Cambodian cake that has rice, coconut with soybean and pork in the middle). She buys ingredients in the market in Phnom Penh to make onsorm at her house and carry it to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a house builder for over two years.

Chanthol is requesting a loan of $500 to landfill and concrete her house foundation.

loans.use: To landfill and concrete her house foundation

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M., a 44-year-old married mother of two school-aged children from the city of Dipolog, owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products, including plastic wares, in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, Lilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be her third loan taken from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sitha C., 55, and her husband, Mr. Deth Sam, 56, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1980 and have two daughters. One of the daughters is married and lives outside the family home and the other one is a garment factory worker.
 
Her husband has been a house builder for five years; it’s a skill he learned from his master. He works in his village.

Sitha has been selling vegetables and pork in front of her house for two years. She hopes to expand her business, so she is asking for her first loan of $250 to purchase more vegetables and pork for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and pork for resale

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita B. is a rice grower. She is 48 years old and has five children. She and her husband have been tilling the land together. They do it as a labor of love to feed and clothe their children. Aside from farming, she wants to have a store. She plans to sell variety of goods in their small barrio to supplement their income.

She is asking a loan of PHP 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for her farm. The loan will also help her to get started in the new business. 

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Mrs. Lanie L., 38 years old, is a married resident of Calabayan, Ozamiz City.
