loans.use: Purchasing new shoes for selling

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2. 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 4 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2. 4 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre premiers   prêts, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de riz d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au marché de Fonfona, M’pessoba et Zansoni. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au marché de M’pessoba et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail et en gros, au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 4 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 70 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Ankabenkélenkan 2. 4 group is made up of married women from the village of Fonfona, town of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents- and sisters-in-law etc. Their average age is 45 and they have at least 6 children each. They mainly cultivate rice and peanuts.

Wishing to make their agricultural businesses more profitable, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2. 4 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After having correctly reimbursed their first four loans, they are now on their 5th rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut and rice seed, various minor materials, and entrants for their crops in the markets of Fonfona, M’pessoba, and Zansoni. After the rainy season, the harvests are stocked for a certain time so that they gain in value before being sold in the market of M’pessoba and the surrounding markets, retair and wholesale, for cash, to a clientele coming mostly from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2. 4 group expects to make a profit of 70,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seed, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: 43-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Gái Lê Thị (128) is a 59 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Gái is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 43-Nam Ngạn (17-02-43).




Gái is married and has 4 adult-aged children.  To making a living, Gái owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling sweets & confectionaries such as cookies & cakes in the local community.  Gái has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,100,000 VND a month from these activities.




In 2007, Gái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Gái has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,040,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Gái plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.




About the Other Borrowers in the Group:




1.  Ngô K. Nhật (21) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store (she buys shoes and resells them).




2.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri Y. is a 34 year old woman who lives in the Kuta area of Bali. She is married with 2 children. Her son Ardi is in 5th grade, and her daughter Fifah is 4 years old. 

Sri Y. buys recyclables like discarded plastic bottles every day from a network of collectors and collects them in a small storage area next to her home. She sells these items weekly to an agent. Sri Y. has been in this business for 6 years. She started off as a collector but has saved up enough so she can operate her own small business that allows her to work from home and spend time with her children. She wants to borrow 3m IDR (about USD 300) to purchase more recyclables. 

This is her 1st loan with Kiva, but she has had 4 previous loans with Dinari Foundation Bali, Kiva’s field partner. She is a conscientious borrower and has always made repayments on time or even ahead of schedule. 

translated by Zev Lowe

loans.use: Buy materials from waste collectors

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
Since he was a young man, Bahrom has known how to work hard. His parents taught him how to get by as an agriculturist, and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of a family, he still works as an agriculturalist. Thanks to his parents, Bahrom now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer, and he hopes to increase his agricultural produce so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life.

Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive, but without them his production will not improve. You can help Bahrom keep moving forward with his development plans.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dalerjon

texts.en:
O. Dalerjon is 30 years old. He is married with 3 children. For more than 10 years, Dalerjon have been working at baking “lepeshka”- the national bread. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes the lepeshka and other breads so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

All the input materials like flour, salt, and yeast he purchases at the local market. Now, due to high demand, Dalerjon wants to increase the amount of bread he produces so that he requests a loan of 800 US Dollars. The loan will be spent for purchasing flour and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. Dalerjon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale

loans.name: Nia Safi Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been a retail business-woman in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She sells perfumes, shoes, and soap. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately US$ 90. Every day she works at her business from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more perfumes, shoes and soap to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatma is 29 years old, married, and has three children: ages 13, 12 and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mtukwao, Mtumwa, and Maryam. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, perfume and soap to add to her current stock

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma has been a food seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to Furaha moyoni group loan (Group code 2072). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately US$ 225. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items, to add to her current stock, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwajuma is 35 years old, married, and has four children: ages 19,17, 15 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more food items to add to her current stock

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn A. is 43 years old and a resident of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City in the southern part of the Philippines. She is married to Doming A. and blessed with three school-age children, ages 17, 14, and 13. Her husband works as a farmer on their small parcel of land.

Merlyn sells "banana cue", "camote cue" (homemade snack foods) and other tasty dishes through peddling. Her business has been up and running for about three months now. Every day, she sells her goods in their neighborhood and nearby villages. She earns approximately Php 100 daily, six days a week; Sunday is for family and church day.

Merlyn wants to expand her business by cooking some other varieties of "viands" (tasty dishes). She is applying for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 5,000 to purchase additional ingredients. With this amount, she can sell more food to her "suki" (regular customers) and gain higher income. If granted, this will be her first loan with HSPFI.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for dishes to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Ce jeune garçon de 30ans marié et sans enfant est tailleur et a son atelier de couture dans la maison familiale  à Mbour. Il fait de la coupe confection et couture, il a une expérience de près de 10 ans. Dans son atelier il forme quatre 4  jeunes au métier de tailleur. Avec le crédit qu’il sollicite il veut confectionner de nouveaux modèles pour la clientèle.
texts.en:
This young boy is 30 years old, married, and without children. He is a tailor and has a workshop in the family house in Mbour. He does the cutting, producing, and sewing. He has nearly ten years of experience. In his workshop, he is training four young people in the trade of tailoring. With this loan he's requesting, he wants to make new designs for his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma G. is 37 years old and blessed with two school-age children, ages 17 and 13. She is married to Ronnie G., a motorcycle transport driver in their village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City in the southern part of the Philippines. She engages in a sari-sari (variety) store and a carinderia (food stall).

Emma's business is getting better and she earns approximately Php 400 daily. The business has run for about ten months now.

Emma wants to provide for the needs of her family, especially enrolling her children in school. To earn more income, she wants to apply for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) of Php 5,000 to purchase two piglets and also to purchase grocery items for her store.

She is hoping, that through HSPFI, Kiva lenders will grant her application.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and to purchase grocery items for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: 21-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en: Năng T. Thị (141) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The official name of this borrowing group is 21-Nam Ngạn (17-03-21). Năng is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2007, Năng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Năng is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will again be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 3rd loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Lê Thị Mùi (18) is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. N. Thị Hạnh (142) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. N. Thị Loan (144) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her bakery business. 4. N. Thị Ngọc (145) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business running a general store. 5. N. Thị Thuý (27) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business running a general store. 6. P. Thị Thảo (147) is a 65-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Năng T. Thị (141) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Năng là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 21-Nam Ngạn (17-03-21). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Năng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Năng kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND. Vào 2007, Năng đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Năng đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lê Thị Mùi (18) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. Thị Hạnh (142) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. N. Thị Loan (144) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh lò bánh mì. 4. N. Thị Ngọc (145) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 5. N. Thị Thuý (27) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 6. P. Thị Thảo (147) là 65 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche is 30 years old and married with one child. She sells clothes. She is requesting a loan of N30,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

They live in big traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents- and sisters-in-law etc. Their average age is 42 and they have at least 6 children each. They mainly cultivate rice and peanuts.

Wishing to make their agricultural businesses more profitable, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.6 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After having correctly reimbursed their first four loans, they are now on their 5th rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut and rice seed, various minor materials, and intrants for their crops in the markets of Fonfona, M’pessoba, and Zansoni. After the rainy season, the harvests are stocked for a certain time so that they gain in value before being sold in the market of M’pessoba and the surrounding markets, retail and wholesale, for cash, to a clientele coming mostly from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.6 group expects to make a profit of 65,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Mariam has been selling clothes at a small shop she owns in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She belongs to the Umoja group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of  approximately $125. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more clothes ant other items for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Mariam is 31 years old and married with five children. She also cares for two additional dependents. 

Mariam will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mwanaenzi, who has her own small business selling clothes in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and other items for resale

loans.name: Mwanacha

texts.en:
Mwanacha has been a firewood and bread seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to the Nia safi group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately  $80. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.  

She is requesting her second loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood and wheat flour for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business as well as be able to save money for a future use, to improve her home and to pay school fees for her children.  

Mwanacha is 27 years old and married with two children, ages 11 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and wheat flour for her business

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2. 7 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 7 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala  région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide comme activité  secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2.7 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre premiers   prêts, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de riz, d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au marché de Fonfona, M’pessoba et Zansoni. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au marché de M’pessoba et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail et en gros, au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 7 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Ankabenkélenkan 2.7 is a group of married women of the village of Fonfona in Koutiala City, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. And they have an average age of 35 and at least five children. They grow mainly rice, and they grown peanuts as a secondary business. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program five years ago. After having correctly repaid the first four loans, they are now on their fifth farm loan. The current loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds for planting rice and peanuts; some minor supplies and equipment; and fertilizers and such, for farming. Supplies are gotten at the marketplaces of Fonfona, M’pessoba, and Zansoni. Following the off-season, the crops are stored for a certain time, so that they gain in value. Then the crops are sold retail in cash transactions at the M’pessoba market and at surrounding markets. Their customers come generally from large cities. After selling their produce, the group members each intend to realize a profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong S. is a 43-year-old married woman and is the mother of four teenage children. Two of the children are students in the local secondary school, while the other two are employed by a company as garment workers.

Vong S. currently sells a few produces at her small wooden store located near her house. She sells items like pork, fish, and vegetables, and earns an average of $4 profit each day.

As another source of family income, Vong S.’s husband drives a trailer motorbike taxi. He has been attracting a lot of customers and generating much income. Unfortunately, the trailer motorbike taxi often breaks down; therefore, Vong S. has decided to request a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to hire a vehicle repairer to repair their old motorbike.

loans.use: To hire a vehicle repairer to repair her husband's old motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2. 9 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala  région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide comme activité  secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. texts.en:
The Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 group is made up of married women from the village of Fonfona, town of Koutiala, region of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law etc. They have an average age of 40 and at least 6 children. They cultivate principally rice with peanuts as a secondary crop.

With the intention of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After having correctly reimbursed their first four loans, they are on their 5th rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of rice seedlings, of peanuts, minor agricultural material, and intrants for their crops at the market of Fonfona, M’pessoba, and Zansoni. After the rainy season, the harvests will be stockpiled for a certain time so that they gain increased value before being sold at the market of M’pessoba and in the surrounding markets, retail and wholesale, for cash, to a clientele coming generally from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2. 10 group expects to make, after their yield is sold, a profit of 60,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and cover current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seed, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 22 years old and she is single. She has been a clothes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to M/hanuni  group loan (Group code 2031).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of  approximately  US$ 90. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.  


Mariam is requesting her second  loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi has been a retail saleswoman in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She sells different items like charcoal, firewood, clothes and other items, She belongs to Tuew sote imara group loan (Group code 2050). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately US$ 80. Every day she works at her business for 9 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal, firewood, clothes and other items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mkasi is married, and has two children, ages 10 and 8.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, firewood, clothes, and other items for her business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is a woman from the mountainous city of Antipolo in the Province of Rizal, Philippines. She is 47 years old and married to Nandito Lumerio, a carpenter and a hired construction worker. They were blessed with 3 daughters. The eldest daughter Jesamin is 23-year-old and a college graduate. The youngest daughter Joymay is 12-year-old and in elementary grade.

In 2006, Josefina joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap,Inc.) an MFI in the Philippines and a Kiva partner. During her previous loans, she tried a general store but she realizes that there are many general stores now going up on their village. Then she decided to try retailing assorted goods such as smoked and dried fish, among many others.

Now in her 6th loan, she is requesting the amount of 35,000 Philippine Pesos to be used as additional capital in her primary business, retail. Now, she will be retailing, fishes, rice and dried fish. She is hopeful that the business will bring them enough profit so they can sustain the needs of her family.

Not having a house of their own, she dreams of building a safer and more durable house on her own lot. As for her business, she dreams of having a rickshaw someday to be used in the easy transportation of her goods for retail.

loans.use: To buy fish and rice for resale

loans.name: Tujielimeshe Group

texts.en:
Maulid, who belongs to Tujielimishe loan (Group code 2055), has been a juice and bites seller in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years, working eight hours everyday at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more wheat flour, sugar, fruits and cooking oil for her enterprise. Maulid is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Maulid, 30 years old and single, will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Sharifa, who has her own small shop in Zanzibar

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, sugar, fruits and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Luduvina Z. is a 59-year-old woman from the beautiful city of Antipolo, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is widowed and doesn’t have a child. She is living on her own. But despite the situation, she has not lost determination and the industry to strive for a better living.
Life was not easy for Luduvina after losing her husband. She decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) an MFI in the Phillipines to have access to capital for her planned business. From the start of being a member, she tried her luck in putting up a General store where her neighbors can buy the basic needs.
Now on her 3rd loan, she is requesting a loan amounting to 15,000 to be used to pay for soft drinks, additional stocks, and she proposes to buy a second-hand refrigerator.
Luduvina is hopeful that her general store will grow into a mini-mart someday. She also plans to renovate a portion of her house someday if she has enough savings.

loans.use: Additional Capital for General Store and to purchase second hand refrigerator.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila S. is a 54-year-old woman who hails from Antipolo City, the capital of Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is married to a 52-year-old rickshaw driver named Alberto S.. Leonila is the mother to of one son and two daughters. Her eldest son, Alberto Jr., 24, and her youngest child, Josephine, 21, are both college graduates.

Since she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an organization associated with MFI in the Philippines and a Kiva partner, Leonila has used loans for her general store and ran it smoothly. The business played a large role in sending her children to school. Now, for her fourth loan, she is requesting an amount of 19,000 Philippine pesos (or about $425 US) as additional capital for her general store. She will use the loan to purchase the in-demand products in her store such as rice, charcoal and cigarettes.

Leonila dreams that someday, her general store's profits will grow enough for her to save money and pay for the educational expenses of her grandchildren. Also, she really dreams of having a durable concrete house.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Kariati Group

texts.en:
Fatuma has sold firewood, charcoal and bricks the Msamvu neighborhood of Morogoro for 8 years. She belongs to Kariati group loan.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $40 US. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal, firewood and cement for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Fatuma is 46 years old, married, and has three children ages 16, 14 and 10. She also cares for four additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Tausi, Husna and Hadija. Each woman also has her own small business in Morogoro.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, firewood, and cement for her business.

loans.name: Kariati Group

texts.en:
Tatu has been a charcoal seller and a food vendor in the Msamvu neighborhood of Morogoro for 4 years. She belongs to Kariati, a group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of  approximately  $80 US. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and food items to add to her current inventory. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.

Tatu is 38 years old, widowed, and has three children ages 17, 9 and 2. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwajab, Naomi and Mariam. Each woman also has her own small business in Morogoro.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and food items to add to her current inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Starting a rabbit-raising business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 54 years old and married with 5 children. She sells drinks and provisions in her community in Ibadan, Oyo State. She is requesting a loan of 120,000 Nigerian naira (or about $825 US) to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Samuela

texts.en:
Samuela D. is a 56-year-old woman from the mountainous city of Antipolo, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is married to a jeepney (small bus) driver, Romeo, who is 63-years old. They are blessed with three children: the eldest child, Rosalinda, is 35 years old and a college graduate; the youngest son, Rico, is 26 years old and a high school graduate. All of her children have families of their own.

In 2004, Samuela joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. When she received her first loan, she invested the money in the selling of fabric conditioners and later expanded the business with additional products. She now also retails sandals, bed sheets, mosquito nets and even peanut butter.

Now on her 9th loan, she requested 40,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. She is optimistic that her business will grow since she already has regular customers requesting orders from her.

She dreams of having a space in the market where she can sell her products, building a durable, concrete house and also experiencing a life that is far away from poverty.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her retail operation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase small farm tools and training

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is 43 years old and married with six children. She makes a living selling women's clothing and underwear. She is applying for a loan to buy more garments to sell to her customers, and wishes to express her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more garments to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn V. is active in ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, particularly its branch in Antipolo City in Rizal provence. She is 33 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom are in elementary school.

She joined ASHI 2004 but at that time had no real intention of starting her own business. Marilyn began selling goods little by little, and used whatever money she made to buy more items to sell. She is now on her seventh loan, which she plans to use to buy additional inventory, particularly rice, fabric conditioner, detergent and also pigs.

Marilyn's main goal is to save for the future of her children and send them to school until they finish college and find good jobs. She is also working hard on the success of her business and looking forward to having space in the local market, which would give her easier access to customers.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies to sell

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is 40 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living selling stationery and various provisions. Toyin is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell, and wishes to extend her thanks and appreciation to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pipes and a pump to carry water to his new farm.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 40 years old, married and has two children. He runs a shop where he sells electrical materials and services. He is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell, and wishes to extend his sincere thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more electrical materials to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She has a shop where she sells foodstuffs and drinks. She hopes for a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She sells plastic bowls and foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and plastic bowls to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and bowls to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She sells snacks, cooked food and ice blocks. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase a generator and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a generator and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the rent for retail business and to increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 54 years old and married with 5 children. She has a shop where she sells drinks. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sofronia

texts.en:
Sofronia V. is a member of Rizalwest Branch of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) in Antipolo City, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She joined the institution in 2007 and she was given the opportunity to have access to capital. As a mother to two, she was very determined and optimistic of establishing a business. She ventured into the retail sale of chicken and soap. The business ran smoothly with the able support of her husband, Teodoro, who is also a part-time welder.

Now she is requesting a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. She is optimistic that her business will grow and will give them enough proceeds to save for their future since they are getting older now. She still hopes to build a house of her own.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for the retail sale of chicken and soap.

loans.name: Babatunde

texts.en: Babatunde is 31 years old and married with a child. He has a shop where he sells building materials like paints, etc. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth Noemi

texts.es: Elizabeth Noemí Ojeada G. tiene la edad de 24 años. Es una mujer casada y tiene 1 hijo y todavía no asiste a una escuela. La actividad económica es la pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Comenzó con esfuerzo propio vendiendo mercadería en general como ropa, calzado, perfumes pero debido a la circunstancias tenia que como cuidar a su hijo fue que decidió establecer una pulpería en su vivienda. Elizabeth tiene muchas esperanzas de salir adelante con su negocio y lo ha logrado. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales y gaseosas. Su deseo es que su hijo logre tener una vida digna y que nunca le falte el alimento diario.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Noemi G. is a 24 year old married woman with one child who does not attend school yet. She runs a grocery shop at her home and has been in this business for the last 5 years. She started the business with her own efforts, selling general merchandise such as clothes, shoes and perfumes. Since she had to take care of her child, she decided to establish a grocery shop at her home. Elizabeth has high expectations and wants to keep the business growing.

The loan requested is for working capital, the purchase of basic grains, candies, soft drinks and natural sodas. She hopes that her son can have a dignified life and that he will never miss a day with out food.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She sells second hand clothes. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
C. Đỗ Thị (727020927) is a 35 year old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To making a living, C. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. C. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. C. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: Julia del Carmen C. tiene 43 años de edad, ella ha sido una madre soltera,  ya que hay hombres que no cumplen con sus responsabilidades, ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos de los que 3 ya están preparados y viven por su propia cuenta y 1 menor aun esta bajo su cuidado, al que también lo llena de amor y le provee su alimentación y educación, ella inicia su negocio cuando su esposo la abandono, pues para ese entonces ella no trabajaba por que acababa de dar a luz, aun asi en medio de todo esto Julia dice que Dios le dio la sabiduría para emprender un negocio que le ayudara en la manutención de sus 4 hijos, aunque al principio estuvo trabajando en las huertas, consiguió juntar dinero y empezó a comprar cerdos para criarlos y luego destazarlos y vender la carne, hoy en día Julia tiene también tiene una pulpería, y su estabilidad familiar y económica ha mejorado mucho, ella requiere de un financiamiento que le permita comprar mas productos para su pulpería y comida para sus cerdos, acude a Fundación León 2000 porque esta institución ha sido de beneficio a ella con otros financiamientos que se le han otorgado, el sueño mas grande que ella tiene es lograr establecer una abarrotería muy surtida.
texts.en:
Julia del Carmen C. is a 43-year-old single mom dealing with men in her life who don’t meet their responsibilities. Despite this, she has been able to raise her four children. Now, three of her four children are living on their own, and the youngest one is still under her loving care as she provides him with food and education. She started her business when her husband left her. At that time she wasn’t working because she had just given birth. Even then, in the middle of all of this, Julia says that God gave her the wisdom to start a business that would help her raise her four children.


Although she began gardening, she put enough money together to buy and raise pigs, slaughter them and sell the meat. Today, Julia has a general store. Her family situation and her financial stability have greatly improved. She needs a loan that will allow her to buy more products for her general store and food for her pigs. She turns to Fundación León 2000, because this institution has been beneficial to her by granting her other loans. Her biggest dream is to be able to set up a well-stocked general store.


Translated from Spanish by Lee Bruner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for general store and food for her pigs.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is 50 years old and married with three children. She sells lightly-used clothes. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more lightly-used clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more lightly-used clothes to sell

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
T. Đỗ Thị (727020923) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has four school-aged children.

T. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Bờ Nguyễn Thị (727020918) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has two school-aged children.

Bờ owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling herbs and spices in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, Bờ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Bờ is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a las tareas de la agricultura, con las que ha sostenido, junto a su esposo, a su familia, durante todos estos años. Lo que principalmente cultiva es la papa y otro producto nativo de su zona, llamado oca. Clarisa y su esposo disfrutan de estas actividades, aunque son jornadas agotadoras bajo un sol intenso, pero han sido bien recompensados con las ganancias obtenidas. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias de su banco comunal que siempre promueve la unión del grupo, aun en tiempos de conflictos y circunstancias difíciles. El dinero que viene solicitando Clarisa es para la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima  campaña de siembra, para que obtenga una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Clarisa is 50 years old and lives with her husband at their own home. She has worked in the agricultural field for over 20 years. It has been the source of their income and the way how along side with her husband has supported their family all these years. Their main crop is potatoes and other product of the region, called oca. Clare and her husband enjoy these activities, although the exhausting days under intense sun. They have been well rewarded with the profits. This is the sixth time she has a loan with MFP.

She is one of the members of the community bank that always promotes the union of the group, even in times of conflict and difficult circumstances. The loan she requested is to buy sacks of fertilizer for next year, in order to obtain a good harvest

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy  fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị is a 36 year-old woman living in the town of Mê Linh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  L. owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong a month (or about $280 US) from these activities.

In 2000, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 dong (or about $1120 USD) from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 dong which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the 8th taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en: Abdo is a 30-year-old married man with one child living in Al Borjain, Mount Lebanon. Since 2006 he has owned a shop for electrical car repairs. Now Abdo is requesting to borrow $1,200 USD to increase his merchandise.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert M. is a small-business Tanzanian man. He runs a business selling charcoal at Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam.

Charcoal is the main source of heat for cooking in Africa and the third world countries as a whole due to the high cost of electricity. He purchases his charcoal direct from the producers in wholesale and sells in retail to his customers.

Robert has been in the business for six years and is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to buy more charcoal. His business income is used to meet his daily family needs.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 23 años, vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se dedica a la agricultura, crianza y venta de animales, todos los días, junto a su esposa cuidan de sus tierras de cultivo, y llevan a sus animales al campo donde haya abundantes pastos frescos para alimentarlos. El producto que principalmente cultivan es la papa, por el momento, Juan siembra en tierras que le cedieron sus padres, y su experiencia como agricultor le dice que las mejores ganancias se obtienen de la venta directa de sus productos en los mercados locales, así como la venta de animales en las ferias ganaderas cada 2 meses. Para un futuro cercano, Juan planea adquirir sus propias tierras de cultivo para incrementar su producción. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, es un socio relativamente nuevo en su banco comunal, y ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos, por lo que ha sido nuevamente considerado para este ciclo. Esto lo motiva a permanecer constante y comprometido con su grupo. Viene solicitando este dinero para la compra de sacos de fertilizantes y abono para sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Juan is 23 years old and lives with his wife and small son in his own home. Since his childhood he has worked in agriculture as well as raising and selling animals. Everyday, along with his wife, he takes care of his land and brings his animals to fields where there are abundant fresh grass to feed from. His principal crop is potatoes and for the time being, he is planting on land that his parents gave to him. His experience as a farmer tells him that he can gain more income by selling his product directly in the local markets, as well as selling his animals in the markets every two months. In the near future, Juan plans on adquiring his own farmland to increase his production. This is the second time that Juan has had a loan with MFP. He is a relatively new member of his communal bank and has demonstrated responsibility with his payments, which is why he has been considered again for a loan in this loan cycle. This in turn motivates him to remain committed to his group. With this loan he will purchase bags of natural and chemical fertilizers for his next crop planting.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Rukayat

texts.en: Rukayat M. is 35 years old and married with three children. She is a fashion designer, and is requesting the loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Blanca Nidia

texts.es: Blanca Nidia C. A. tiene 42 años de edad, y tiene 2 hijas menores de edad y que aun van a la escuela, como es común, ella es una madre soltera, el negocio de Blanca es la venta de ropa, zapatos y una pequeña pulpería en su hogar, empezó con este negocio desde hace 8 años, empezó vendiendo ropa y zapatos en la calle de manera ambulante con una canasta, hasta que sus hijas de 11 y 12 años le dieron la idea de establecer una pulpería en su hogar de habitación, de esta  manera las pequeñas se comprometieron en atender la pulpería en el tiempo que no estuviesen en clases y asi su mama Blanca podría salir a vender los otros artículos, luego Blanca obtuvo muchos clientes a quienes les dio la dirección de su casa y no tener que caminar demasiado de esta manera sus hijas pueden entregarse por completo al estudio ahora que ya están por entrar a la universidad, su sueño es ampliar su negocio y establecer una miscelánea y su mas grande desafío es terminar de preparar a sus hijas y para lograr esto necesita mantener su negocio estable es por eso que necesita que se le otorgue un préstamo que le ayude a surtir su pulpería para abastecer todo el reparto en el cual vive.
texts.en:
Blanca Nidia C. A. is 42. She has two minor daughters who still go to school. As is common, she is a single mother. Blanca’s business is selling clothes and shoes. She also has a small mini market in her home. She started this business eight years ago. She started as a street vendor selling clothes and shoes from a basket. She did this until her eleven and twelve year old daughters gave her the idea to set up a mini market in their home. This way the little ones promised to tend the store when they were not in class. Then, their mother, Blanca, would be able to sell the other articles. Blanca then got many customers to whom she gave her home address. This way she does not have to walk too much, and her daughters can completely devote themselves to their studies. Her daughters will be entering the university. Her dream is to expand her business and open a general store. Her biggest challenge is to finish preparing her daughters. In order to do this she needs to keep her business stable. That is why she needs a loan. She needs help to stock her mini market in order to meet the demands of her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
V. Đỗ Thị (721000685) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, V. owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing construction services to local community members. V. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, V. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed for her business. V. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the eighth taken out by V. Đỗ Thị from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ali's Group

texts.en: Ali is a 34-year-old married man with one child. He has been a taxi driver for the past five years. Today, Ali is hoping to borrow $1,200 to be able to fix his taxi.

loans.use: To fix his taxi

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn THị is a 46 year-old woman living in the town of Mê Linh.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  C. owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  C. has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (or about $280 US) a month from these activities.

In 2000, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 dong from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to breed.  C. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 dong which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Thisloan will be the eighth taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to breed

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián tiene 34 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en la casa propia que tiene en su tierra natal. Desde niño se viene dedicando a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, ya que proviene de una familia de agricultores que le enseñaron todo lo concerniente a esta actividad, el producto que principalmente siembra es la papa y cría animales como ovejas y cerdos. Cuenta con el apoyo constante de su esposa y de sus hijos, y durante todos estos años de trabajo, Julián comenta que lo que sostiene la economía de su casa durante la espera de la cosecha es la venta de sus animales, es por ello, que para más adelante está planeando tener una establo más grande, además de extender sus terrenos para cultivar. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él es uno de los socios más activos de su banco comunal, donde se compromete, nuevamente, a continuar con un trabajo responsable. El dinero que está solicitando le servirá para la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas para  asegurar una buena cosecha en los próximos meses.
texts.en:
Julián, 34, lives with his wife and children in their own house, which is in their native land. He has been a farmer and raised animals since he was a child. Because he comes from a family of farmers, they taught him everything about this business. He mostly plants potatoes and raises animals like sheep and pigs. His wife and children help him all of the time. Throughout all these years of work, Julián says that what keeps them going economically while they wait for the harvest is the sale of his animals. That is why he is planning to have a bigger stable in the future. He also will extend the fields he cultivates. This is his second loan with MFP. He is one of the most active members of his community bank. He promises, again, to continue to work responsibly. The loan is to buy fertilizers and insecticides to assure a good harvest in the coming months.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
B. Nguyễn THị (708070237) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has three school-aged children.

B. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month.

In 1998, B. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

B. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 12th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca  vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, en la calle kilometro 7 de la zona de Alto san Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz; ella  trabaja en una escuela de futbol y su esposo trabaja en una emisora de radio, ambos con su trabajo mantienen a su familia.

El crédito que solicitan es para pagar el costo de matriculas para la educación de sus hijos.

Ya fue parte de Kiva y pagó muy bien; por el carácter social del crédito puede acceder a uno nuevo.
texts.en:
Francisca lives in her own house with her husband and children on Calle Kilometro 7, in the Alto San Pedro zone, in the city of La Paz. She works in a soccer school, and her husband works for a radio station. They both work to support their family. The loan is to pay enrollment costs for their children’s education. She has had a loan with Kiva, and she did very well making her payments. Her credit history qualifies her for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enrollment costs for her children's education

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is a 31-year-old married man. He has been working with decorative balloons for the past six years. Today, he is requesting $1,200 to purchase more inventory for the upcoming summer season.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị is a 37 year-old woman living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Huệ raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Huệ has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month.

In 1996, Huệ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000000 VND from TYM Fund used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Huệ requests a loan of 15000000 VND to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the twelth taken out from TYM Fund.

Huệ plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Eric

texts.es:
El señor Eric vive en alquiler en la calle Antofagasta de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en una imprenta grafica lugar donde empezó solo como compaginador y ahora es jefe de producción.

El crédito que solicita es para seguir capacitándose y comprar material educativo en su rama (libros especializados) y seguir ascendiendo de cargo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007 y su historial de pagos es muy bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Eric lives in an apartment on Antofagasta street in the Pasankeri zone in the city of La Paz. He works in a graphic printing business where he started as a graphic print worker and now is the chief of production. The loan that he is requesting is to continue his training and to purchase educational materials in his field (technical books) in order to continue growing in this field since it is his only source of income. He has been a client of Impro since 2007 and his repayment history is very good, and thus he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tecnical books in his field of study to continue his training

loans.name: Hamis

texts.en:
Hamis Mchika is a married man who runs a small business; a tailoring mart at Yombo Makangarawe ward, in Dar es Salaam.

He makes clothes for women and men. He also receives orders of school uniforms. Business materials are purchased from Kariakoo wholesale shops and other retailers.

Business income is used to meet daily family demands. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: Boost up business.

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
Trần Thị is a 48 year-old woman who lives in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Trần Thị raises livestock. Her main source of income is from raising cattle for sale. T. has been in this business for over six years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month.

In 1996, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. T. is requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 12th taken out from TYM Fund.

Trần Thị plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 38-year-old man. He has owned a garage since 2000. Today, Jihad is hoping to borrow $1,000 to buy new tools to improve his work.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde niña realiza las actividades de la agricultura, donde su esposo y sus hijos trabajan a su lado. A Modesta le gusta mucho estar en el campo y respirar el aire puro, además, a pesar de los problemas climáticos que ocurran, siempre sus cultivos les deja ganancias suficientes para sostener las necesidades de la familia. Modesta está muy acostumbrada a realizar estas tareas, por lo que siempre planea su futuro en torno a esta actividad, donde generalmente produce papa. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, su trabajo en su banco comunal ha sido muy satisfactorio, por lo que ha decidido continuar trabajando de manera solidaria con su grupo. El dinero que está requiriendo será invertido en la compra de semillas mejoradas de papa y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Modesta is 48 and lives with her husband and children in their own home. Since she was a girl, she has practiced agriculture. Now her husband and children work at her side. She likes to be in the fields a lot and breathe the fresh air. In spite of the problems with weather that might occur, her crops always earn enough profits for them to sustain their family. Modesta is very accustomed to doing this work, and she always has planned her future according to it. She generally produces potatoes. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. Her work with her communal bank has been very satisfying, so she has decided to continue working in a supportive manner with her group. The money that she needs will be invested in the purchase of improved potato seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana vive en casa propia en la calle Tocopilla de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, la actividad que ella tiene es la venta de chompas las cuales lleva de  de La Paz a varias comunidades en otros departamentos del país; con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia y es su única fuente de ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más chompas  e incrementar sus ingresos y poder seguir trabajando.

En Febrero de 2008 ella obtuvo un crédito via Kiva y su historial de pagos fue muy bueno; esto hace posible que Juana pueda acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana lives in her own home on Tocopilla Street in the zone Pasankeri in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. Her commercial activity consists of selling sweaters, which she takes from La Paz to various other communities in other counties. She is able to support her family through her sales, which is also their only source of income. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy more sweaters which will in turn increase her returns and will help her to continue working.

In February 2008, she obtained a loan through Kiva and was consistent in her payments. Her reliability has made it possible for Juana to apply for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more sweaters to satisfy customer demand.

loans.name: Ola-Oladia

texts.en: T. is 47 years old and married with 3 children.  T. sells provisions to make a living. She is requesting a loan of N 60,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 20-year-old man living in Saida El Kadimeh in southern Lebanon. He has been manufacturing pastry for the past two years. Today, Hani is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase his purchases.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Adan Jesus

texts.es: Adán de Jesús Caves Bermúdez tiene 45 años de edad y esta casado con María, ellos tienen 2 hijos. La actividad económica de Adán es brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace más 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicialmente comenzó como cobrador de las unidades de trasporte, posteriormente tubo la oportunidad de conducir y fue así como lo aprovecho. Adán no sabía muchas cosas de su oficio y con el tiempo fue que aprendiendo lo más necesario para sacar adelante a su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que pr5oporcionarle a su vehiculo algunas mejoras con el fin de brindar un buen servicio. Sus sueños son de comprar otro camión para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Adán de Jesús Caves Bermúdez is 45 years old and is married to his wife, Maria. They have two children. His main commercial activity is providing transportation services. He has been working in transportation for 5 years. Initially, he began as conductor for different transportation types. Afterward, he had the opportunity to drive and took advantage of this opportunity. Adan at first did not know many things that went along with his trade, but with time he learned all that was necessary and was able to improve his family's situation. The financing he is asking for will be applied as working capital which will also help him to improve his vehicles with the final goal of offering a better service. His dream is to purchase another bus and improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia H. is a micro-business Tanzanian woman. She runs a tailoring business at Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam. She owns three sewing machines, employing two people in the business. She makes various clothes for both women and men. She also sews school uniforms for both primary and secondary pupils. She plans to buy more sewing machines. She needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is 26-year-old married man with one child, living in Choueifat, Mount Lebanon. He has been selling industrial tools for the past three years. Today, Hassan is requesting a loan of $700 to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Lỗ Thị

texts.en:
M. Lỗ Thị is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Mê Linh.  She is married and has 4 adult children.  To make a living, M. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  M. has been engaged in this business for more than 8 years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  M. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  M. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid is 43-year-old married man with three children, living in Keter Maya, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a car service and maintenance shop since 2003. Today, Walid is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica tiene 42 años, vive con sus 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 12 años en la casa de su madre. Desde hace 15 años, junto a sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa en las diferentes ferias comerciales de su ciudad. Ella considera que la actividad que realiza la relaja y además le genera  los recursos económicos que favorecen la estabilidad de su familia. Para asegurar sus ventas trabaja todos los días, y ofrece un trato amable con algunas ofertas, que son las estrategias que utiliza para atraer clientes. Para un futuro cercano, Verónica quiere seguir dedicándose a esta actividad, pero con mayor cantidad de mercadería. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal, el cual se llama “Manos Solidarias”. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería, para tener suficiente stock para las fiestas patrias que se aproximan, temporada cuando tiene muy buenas ventas.
texts.en:
Veronica is 42 years old and lives with her 3 children, ages 20, 18 and 12, in her mother's house. For 15 years, along with her children, she sells clothes in various markets across the city. She believes that her job helps to relax her and also generates enough income to help stabilize her family's economic situation. In order to assure her daily sales, she works every day, and offers a friendly service to her clients, which are her main strategies to attract customers. In the near future, Veronica would like to continue working in sales, but with a larger quantity of merchandise. This is the second time she is asking for a micro-loan, and is very happy to be a member of a communal bank called "Manos Solidarias" or Hands of Solidarity. The money that she is asking for will be invested in purchasing more merchandise in order to have sufficient stock for the national holidays that are approaching, a time in which her sales increase.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase quantity of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, H. raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for more than years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, H. joined TYM Fund, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build shelter for the borrower's livestock. H. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
