Thế Nguyễn Thị is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Thế makes and sells herbs and spices in her community. Thế has been engaged in this business for more than six years and earns approximately 4000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Thế joined TYM Fund, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thế has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Thế is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Thế plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is 23-year-old man. He has been working as a plumber since 2003. Today, he is hoping to borrow $1,200 to be a part of an upcoming project.

loans.use: To be a part of an upcoming project

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung T. Thị (3220000603) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Phúc Yên. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nhung owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Nhung has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, Nhung joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nhung has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Nhung is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Nhung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị, age 35, lives in the town of Phúc Yên. She is married and has two school-aged children. To earn a living, T. owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 1999, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the ninth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 40 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en la casa de unos familiares. Desde hace 2 años vende cosméticos por catálogo de las marcas más reconocidas del país, todos los días va de casa en casa de sus amistades, vecinos y otras personas que conoce para ofrecer sus productos, luego, por las tardes, hace un inventario de lo que vendió y de los pedidos que le hicieron. Días posteriores, visita nuevamente a sus clientes para cobrar, ya que generalmente vende al crédito, y aunque sea cansado realizar estas tareas, para ella es una gran satisfacción, ya que tiene sus propias metas, las cuales alcanza cada mes. Para un futuro cercano, Vilma desea establecerse en un puesto de ventas en una zona céntrica y comercial de su localidad. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy agradecida por la invitación que le hicieron para formar parte de su actual banco comunal, donde sus demás compañeros ya están en su 5to crédito. El dinero que viene solicitando comprará más cosméticos para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Vilma is 40 and lives with her 2 children in a family member's home. For two years, she has sold cosmetics by catalog. She sells one of the most well-known brands in the country. Every day she goes to the homes of her friends, neighbors, and other people that she knows to sell her products. Then, in the afternoons, she takes inventory of what she sold and the orders she took. Days later, she visits her customers again to collect the money, since she generally sells on credit. Although it is tiring to do this work, it gives her great satisfaction. She has her own goals, which she reaches every month. In the near future, Vilma hopes to establish a sales stand in a central commercial area in her community. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very grateful for the inviitation they gave her to become a part of her current communal bank where her fellow members are on their fifth loan. The credit she is requesting will go towards purchasing more cosmetics to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Ngọ Nguyễn Thị, 53 years old, is a woman living in the town of Phúc Yên. She is married and has two grown children. To make her living, Ngọ owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ngọ has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2000, Ngọ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Ngọ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Ngọ is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the ninth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Ngọ plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Diệp Tố

texts.en:
U. Diệp Tố, age 38, lives in the town of Phúc Yên. She is married and has two school-aged children. U. earns her living by owning and operating a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. U. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 1999, U. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. U. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

U. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND ,which will be used to invest in expanding her business by buying breeding livestock. The loan will be the ninth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. U. plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
Hồ Trần Thị is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Phúc Yên. She is married and has two school-aged children. Hồ earns her living by owning and operating a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food items and daily-use products in the local community. Hồ has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Hồ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Hồ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business premises.

Hồ is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Hồ plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 2 años decidió abrir un hotel, donde brinda el servicio de hospedaje a personas que no son de su localidad, ella atiende durante las mañanas y en algunas ocasiones le ayuda su esposo, cuando tiene días libres en su trabajo. Este negocio le permite solventar los gastos de la educación de sus hijos, además de otros gastos familiares. El mes de junio se inicia la temporada alta en su región, ya que se acercan los feriados por fiestas patrias, por lo que Yanina quiere mejorar los ambientes de su hotel para recibir a los turistas. Esta es la primera vez tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue muy bien informada acerca de la dinámica del trabajo en su banco comunal, por su parte, se compromete a trabajando por el bienestar de todos. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de camas y colchones para amoblar otras habitaciones de su hospedaje.
texts.en:
Yanina, 36, lives with her husband and two children in her own house. Two years ago she decided to open a hotel where she offers hospitality services to people who are not from her area. She takes care of the hotel in the mornings. Sometimes her husband helps her when he has days off from work. This business allows her to pay the educational costs of her children, and it covers other family expenses. The month of June starts high season in her region. The National Holidays are getting close, and Yanina wants to improve the hotel’s environment for the coming tourists. This is her first loan with MFP. She was very well informed about the work dynamic in her community bank. She promises to work for the well being of all. The loan is to buy beds and mattresses to furnish other rooms in her hotel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beds and mattresses for her hotel

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ylis

texts.es: Ylis tiene 19 años, vive en casa de sus padres con su esposo y su bebé. Junto a su esposo, se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, su familia está recientemente formada y por el momento han recibido el apoyo de sus padres y sus suegros con algunas tierras de cultivo que están utilizando para la siembra de papa. También crían animales, tales como cuyes y gallinas, además Ylis borda fustanes, todos estos esfuerzos los realiza con el único fin de consolidar la economía familiar. Hasta el momento el trabajo que ha realizado con su esposo ha dado buenos frutos, por lo que se proyectan un buen futuro como agricultores. Esta es la primera vez que tiene una experiencia en bancos comunales, fue invitada a formar parte del grupo al que actualmente pertenece porque vieron en ella a una joven madre muy responsable en sus cuentas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará aproximadamente 8 sacos de abono para sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Ylis, 19, lives in her parents’ house with her husband and her baby. She and her husband work together as farmers. Her family is recently formed, and at the moment they are receiving help from her parents and parents-in-law. Her parents and in-laws have given them some fields to cultivate. They are using the fields to plant potatoes. They also raise animals like guinea pigs and chickens. Ylis embroiders "fustanes" (clothing typical of her region, like a skirt). All of her efforts are made for the sole purpose of strengthening the family’s finances. Up until now the work she and her husband have done has born good fruit. Therefore, they project a good future as farmers. This is her first experience with a community bank. She was invited to join the group that she currently belongs to because they saw in her a young mother who is very responsible with her accounts. The loan is to buy approximately eight bags of fertilizer for their next crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kuruthumu

texts.en:
Kuluthumu M. is a married Tanzanian woman. She runs her own small business selling scrapers of different types, used as industrial raw materials, to different industries in Dar es Salaam. She collects her products from different areas, and she sells them within various industrial areas. The materials include iron scrapers, used plastics, aluminum materials, and used bottles. Kuruthumu helps considerably in keeping the city clean, and her business has employed many jobless men in the city.

She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to extend the business.

loans.use: To extend the business

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es: Peregrina tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, y desde hace más de 20 años, junto a su esposo y sus hijos, trabajan en la tarea de sembrar y cosechar papa y maíz. También cría animales que vende en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Ambas actividades son el sostén de su familia y las que han hecho posible la educación y superación de sus hijos. Para un futuro cercano, Peregrina tiene planes de arreglar algunas estructuras de su casa para poder ampliar los espacios que utiliza como almacén de sus productos. Ella es una de las socias más antiguas de su banco comunal, que ha demostrado en lo largo de estos 14 ciclos de préstamo, aproximadamente 7 años, mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora viene solicitando será para invertirlo en la ampliación de sus almacenes.
texts.en:
Peregrina is 49 and lives in her own home with her husband and 4 children. Since she was young, she has worked in agriculture. For more than 20 years, she has worked with her husband and kids. They work planting and harvesting potatoes and corn. She also raises animals that she sells at the livestock markets in her area. Both activities sustain her family, and they have made it possible to educate her children. In the near future, Peregrina has plans to fix up her home to expand the areas that she uses to store her products. She is one of the oldest members of her communal bank, and this is her fourteenth loan. She has been a member for approximately 7 years, and she is very responsible with her payments. The money she is requesting will be invested in expanding her storage areas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the areas she uses to store her products

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles K. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur. He is an ex-soldier of the JWTZ (Tanzania People's Defence Force), where he served as a doctor. He is married and has three children, the youngest of whom is in form six.

He runs a pub and guesthouse business in the Yombo Kilakala ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells a variety of both soft and alcoholic drinks in his pub. The income from this business has allowed him to be able to pay school fees for his three children.

He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to boost up his business.

loans.use: To boost up his business

loans.name: Kalaza

texts.en:
Kalaza A. is a Tanzanian businessman and entrepreneur. He runs two grocery store businesses in the Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells different types of food crop products in his shops as well as selling different types of soft drinks, including Coca-Cola products, Pepsi products, and juices. His business goods are purchased from the wholesale shops and from the Coca-Cola and Pepsi agents.

He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business goods to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Djidja 2 .1 Group

texts.fr:
Djidja 2. 1 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village  Siguémona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 50 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
 Elles cultivent  principalement  du riz et  de l’arachide comme activité Secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Djidja 2 .1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  des semences de riz  d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au marché de Zansoni, M’pessoba et de Fonfona. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au  marché de M’pessoba et  de Koutiala, en détail ou en gros au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Djidja 2 .1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 85 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djidja 2. 1 is a group of married women from the village of Siguémona, town of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families and have an average age of 50 and at least 6 children. They cultivate principally rice, with peanuts as a secondary crop.

With the intention of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Djidja 2 .1 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After having correctly reimbursed the three preceding loans, they are on their fourth rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy rice seedlings, peanut seeds, minor material and intrants for their crops at the markets of Zansoni, M’pessoba, and Fonfona. After the rainy season, the harvests are stockpiled for a certain time so that they gain in value before being sold at the market of M’pessoba and of Koutiala, retail and wholesale, for cash, to a clientele generally coming from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Djidja 2 .1 group expects to make, after their crops have been sold, a profit of 85,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seed, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses M. is a Tanzanian businessman and entrepreneur. He runs a food shop business in the Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells different types of food crop products, particularly cereal crop products including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and ground nuts. He purchases his business goods direct from the producers in wholesale, and purchases others from Kariakoo Market city shopping center.

He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods for sale in his food shop.

loans.use: To buy more business goods for sale in his food shop

loans.name: Djidja 2. 2 (Soyez Courageux). Group

texts.fr:
Djidja 2 .2 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village  Siguémona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  principalement  du riz et  de l’arachide comme activité Secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Djidja 2 .2 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  des semences de riz,  d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au marché de Zansoni, M’pessoba et de Fonfona. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au  marché de M’pessoba et  de Koutiala, en détail ou en gros au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Djidja 2. 2 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 85 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djidja 2. 2 is a group of married women from the village of Siguémona, town of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They have an average age of 45 and at least 6 children. They cultivate principally rice, with peanuts as a secondary crop.

With the intention of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Djidja 2 .2 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After having correctly reimbursed the three preceding loans, they are on their fourth rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy rice seedlings, peanut seeds, minor material and intrants for their crops at the markets of Zansoni, M’pessoba, and Fonfona. After the rainy season, the harvests are stockpiled for a certain time so that they gain in value before being sold at the market of M’pessoba and of Koutiala, retail and wholesale, for cash, to a clientele generally coming from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Djidja 2 .2 group expects to make, after their crops have been sold, a profit of 85,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu I. is a married Tanzanian woman and small business owner. She owns and operates two separate types of business in Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. First, she runs a beauty salon. Secondly, she sells both fried and fresh fish at Buguruni.

Tatu purchases her salon products from the beauty salon shops at the Kariakoo city shopping center. She buys her fish from the Ferry fish market, direct from the fishermen.

She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more goods for both her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more business goods for her salon and fish-selling businesses

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver P. I. is a Tanzanian small-business married woman. She runs a business selling soft and alcoholic drinks in her shop at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business goods from the wholesale shops and sells to customers at her kiosk. The income generated is used to meet her family’s daily needs. She has been running the business for four years. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to meet the customers' demands

loans.name: Djidja 2 .3 (Soyez Courageux). Group

texts.fr:
Djidja 2 .3 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village  Siguémona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  principalement  du riz et  de l’arachide comme activité Secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Djidja 2 .3 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  des semences de riz,  d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au marché de Zansoni, M’pessoba et de Fonfona. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au  marché de M’pessoba et  de Koutiala, en détail ou en gros au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Djidja 2. 3 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djidja 2 .3 is a group of married women of the village of Siguémona in Koutiala City, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They have an average age of 35 and at least 6 children. They grow mainly rice, and they grown peanuts as a secondary business. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. After having correctly repaid the three preceding loans, they are now on their fourth farm loan. The current loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds for planting rice and peanuts, some minor supplies and equipment, and fertilizers and such, for farming. Supplies are gotten at the marketplaces of Zansoni, M’pessoba, and Fonfona. Following the off-season, the crops are stored for a certain time, so that they gain in value. Then the crops are sold retail and wholesale in cash transactions at the M’pessoba and Koutiala markets. Their customers come generally from large cities. After selling their produce, the group members each intend to realize a profit of 65,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Roxana María

texts.es:
Roxana V. F. es una joven señora de 25 años de edad. Vive con su esposo y sus dos  hijos. 
La comunidad en la cual vive doña Roxana se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago. 

Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Doña Roxana se dedica a la producción de leche y queso como una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contenta porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de los niños. 

El queso de la región donde vive José Eduardo es famoso en todo Costa Rica. Es un queso fresco que se le conoce tradicionalmente como “queso tipo Turrialba”. A los “ticos” (como se les conoce a los habitantes de Costa Rica) les gusta mucho consumir este producto; se le encontrará en las mesas acompañando cualquier tipo de comida.  Por esta razón, el mercado para dicho producto es realmente bueno.

Doña Roxana desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera más y así aumentar la producción de leche. Ella sabe que contar con una vaca más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresaria exitosa y  sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, la motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero y dedicación.

Doña Roxana es cliente de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una organización local socia de la micro financiera EDESA. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico
texts.en:
Roxana V. F. is a young lady, 25 years of age, who lives with her husband and two children. The community where they live is called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in Cartago Province. It's a small rural community of some 2,000 residents. The townspeople work at producing milk and growing coffee. The area has a varied terrain and much of the land is preserved as tropical rain forest. The community has very picturesque scenery which combines tropical forest with two beautiful lagoons, coffee plantations and dairy farms. El Sauce is located about 90 minutes by bus from the nearest commercial center, Turrialba. However, at various times of the year the road is impassable due to the flooding that afflicts the area. This is without a doubt one of the principal challenges for the community. When there was nothing to do, many people decided to leave to look for work in Turrialba or in the banana plantations located in the Atlantic zone of Costa Rica. Currently the prices for coffee and milk have improved and therefore the locals are looking to invest in projects in this area so as to avoid having to migrate. Doña Roxana works at producing milk and cheese as a way of generating income for her family. She say she is very satisfied because thanks to this project she has been able to get ahead and help her husband with the expenses for their household and the children. The cheese from the region where she lives, José Eduardo, is famous throughout Costa Rica. It is a "queso fresco" (fresh cheese) which is traditionally known as Turrialba-style. Ticos, as Costa Ricans are called, love to consume this product and it is found on the table as an accompaniment to all types of food. For this reason the market for this product is quite good. Doña Roxana would like to obtain a micro-credit loan of 500,000 Colons in order to buy another milk cow so as to increase milk production. She knows that having another cow is a great sacrifice and will require more work. However, the desire to be a successful small businesswoman and to get started improving her family's living conditions motivates her to exert herself with great care and dedication. Doña Roxana is a client of the Producers' Association of El Sauce, a member organization of EDESA Micro-Finance. This will be her first loan and she hopes to continue growing both personally and economically.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar una vaca lechera.

loans.name: Djidja 2 .4 Group

texts.fr:
Djidja 2 .4 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village  Siguémona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles cultivent  principalement  du riz et  de l’arachide comme activité Secondaire.

They grow mainly rice, and they grown peanuts as a secondary business. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra R. M. tiene 27 años de edad, ella es una madre soltera y tiene 2 niños los cuales están bajo su propio cuido, la mayor lucha que ha tenido que enfrentar como madre es la salud de su niña, ya que se le enferma constantemente, el negocio de Mayra es la venta de hornados, refrescos y tajadas de plátano, ella se desarrollo en este negocio desde los 13 años de edad cuando tenia que ayudarle a sus padres pues ellos eran muy pobres y toda la familia se dedicaba al trabajo, por lo que no pudo tener educación, pasado 3 años ella decidió establecer su propio negocio y de esta manera proporcionar un poco mas de ingresos a sus padres, luego cuando formo su hogar empezó a vender en los buses hasta que pudo conseguir un toldo el cual es puesto en una acera donde ella vende sus refrescos, hornados y tajadas de plátano, su mayor deseo es criar de la mejor manera a sus hijos proveyéndoles, una buena alimentación, educación que ella nunca tuvo y un negocio sólido que le permita dar a sus hijos las cosas materiales que ellos necesiten pues el amor ella ya se los da, actualmente Mayra tiene la necesidad de un financiamiento ya que ella comprara mercadería a su negocio para que este pueda seguir funcionando y lograr todas sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Mayra R. M. is 27 and is the single mother of 2 children under her care. The biggest fight she has had to face as a mother is the health of her daughter, since she is constantly sick. Mayra sells pork, beverages, and sliced plantains. She has been developing this business since she was 13, when she had to help her parents because they were very poor and the entire family worked. This is why she couldn't have an education. Three years ago, she decided to start her own business so she could contribute a little more income to her parents. When she started her own family, she started to sell her food on buses until she could obtain a stand on the street where she sells her beverages, pork, and sliced plantains. Her biggest dream is to raise her children in the best way possible, offering them good nutrition and the education she never received. A solid business would let her give her children the material things that they need. She already gives them love. Mayra needs financing so she can buy merchandise for her business so she can keep working and accomplish all of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Silvio R. de 40 años de edad, habitante del barrio Augusto Cesar Sandino en la capital de Managua, su compañera de vida es ama de casa, tiene tres hijos todos los tienen estudiando. Se desempeña de técnico de pista en una gasolinera, trabajo que intercalan las horas de trabajo algunas veces de día y otras de noche, desde hace un año y medio trabajo en ese puesto, aspira a otro forma de vida en la cual gane más. Los planes que tiene para el futuro es mejorar su vivienda para darles seguridad a sus hijos. Por falta de financiamiento no ha realizado las mejoras que necesita su humilde casa. Gracias al préstamo que le brinda Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, Hierro, zinc, bloques y ladrillos. Para la construcción de un cuarto para estar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Señor Silvio R. is 40 and lives in the Augusto Cesar Sandino neighborhood in the capital city, Managua. His wife is a housewife, and all three of their children are in school. He works at a gas station, where he sometimes works days and sometimes works nights. He has had this job for a year and a half. He hopes to find another job where he can make more money. His plans for the future are to improve his home to give his children safety. Because of the lack of financing, he hasn't made improvements to his humble home. Thanks to the loan that Afodenic is offering him, he will be able to buy construction materials like cement, iron, metal, and bricks. He is going to build a room so his house will be in better condition.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es: Marvin José Gutiérrez A. tiene 47 años, es un hombre soltero. Tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Marvin es una farmacia. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Marvin inicio este negocio porque el mismo, quería ser el propietario, por lo que tenia que sufragar los gastos de su familia. Para Marvin fue muy difícil dejar de recibir un salario y mantener a su familia solamente con los ingresos de la farmacia. Con este financiamiento que solicita es destinado solamente para capital de trabajo para la compra de medicamento en general porque la mayoría de sus clientes solicitan una variedad de productos. Sus sueños son que toda su familia se mantenga con vida y obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Marvin José Gutiérrez A. is 47 and single. He has 2 children who go to school. He has had a pharmacy for 9 years. Marvin started this business because he wanted to be the owner since he has to provide for his family. For Marvin, it was hard to leave a job where he received a salary to sustain his family with only the income from his pharmacy. He will use this financing as working capital to purchase general medication because the majority of his customers request a variety of products. He hopes that his family stays healthy and to obtain more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: El señor Ramón Cortez, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 44 años de edad, casado, su esposa le tiene  tres hijos de 14,17 y 19 años de edad, los tres estudian, su esposa es costurera con sus ingresos apoya  a su familia. El señor Ramon es guarda de seguridad desde hace dos años. Este es el tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para levantar un poco mas la casa y reparar el techo, para que quede en mejores condiciones y seguridad ya que tiene parte de las paredes de tabla y están en mal estado. Sus planes es poder apoyar a sus hijos para que se preparen profesionalmente
texts.en:
Señor Ramón Cortez lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood and is 44 and married. He and his wife have 3 children who are 14, 17, and 19. His children go to school, and his wife works as a seamstress. She uses her income to support their family. Ramón has worked as a security guard for 2 years. This is his third loan with Afodenic. He will use it to invest in construction materials to raise his house a little more and to repair the roof so it will be in better condition and provide more safety. Part of the wooden walls are in bad shape. His plans are to be able so support his children so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make repairs to his home

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flor María R. G. es una señora de 31 años de edad la cual vive  con su esposo y sus 4 hijas: Helen, Yerlin, Angie y  Grettel. Ellos viven en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico,  ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; reconocida como una comunidad amiga de la tranquilidad  y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería  y turismo. 

Doña Flor esta afiliada al grupo ecológico Mujeres el Abanico, ella se dedica a la siembra de Tilo, una planta medicinal, dice que la producción de ella  y la  de sus compañeras de grupo  la compra una empresa llamada “Manzaté”, la cual es una empresa nacional que se especializa en la elaboración de té de diferentes hierbas. 

Desde hace más de 10 años doña Flor se dedica a la producción de tilo, la cual le ha traído grandes beneficios  tanto a ella como a su familia, dice que se ha esforzado mucho y a puesto mucho empeño para que el proyecto salga adelante. 

Doña Flor dice que la demanda en el mercado por este producto es muy alta por lo que desea ampliar su plantación de tilo y hacer el secador más grande. Por lo tanto ella requiere un préstamo de ¢600.000 (seiscientos mil colones)  para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del tilo y además espera comprar: madera, plástico, clavos, maya etc; todos estos materiales necesarios para ampliar el secador.

Doña Flor forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socia ha recibido un microcrédito, el cual le  ha permitido desarrollarse como microempresaria y sentirse mejor con ella misma.
texts.en:
Flor María R. G. is a 31-year-old woman who lives with her husband and their 4 daughters: Helen, Yerlin, Angie and Grettel. They live in a rural community in Costa Rica called Abanico. It is located in San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Alajuela Province. It is known as a quiet community dedicated to productive activities such as agriculture, livestock and tourism.

Mrs. Flor is a member of the ecological group Mujeres el Abanico. She works sowing Lime Flower, a medicinal plant. She says a company called Manzaté buys her crops as well as those of the other group members. It’s a national company specialized in producing different herbal teas.

Mrs. Flor has worked in lime flower production for more than 10 years. It has been very profitable for her and her family. She says she has worked very hard and put a lot of effort into making the project successful.

Mrs. Flor says the market demand for this product is very high which is why she would like to increase her lime flower tree plantation and make the drying area larger. Therefore she needs a loan of ¢600.000 (six hundred thousand CRC) to help with preparing the soil and purchasing seeds and fertilizers, among other supplies which are necessary to guarantee the optimal sowing of the lime flower. She also hopes to purchase: wood, plastic, nails, netting, etc. All these materials are necessary to increase the drying area.

Mrs. Flor is part of the Abanico Community Credit Company. It is one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. She has received a micro loan since she is a member. This has allowed her to develop as a micro businesswoman and feel better about herself.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to produce and dry lime flower

loans.name: Elda Maritza

texts.es: Elda Maritza B. M. tiene 32 años de edad. Es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos  a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por la necesidad de brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias, los comienzos de Elda no fueron nada fáciles porque empezó a trabajar desde muy joven, pero esto le ayudo a tener experiencia para su negocio y así mantenerlo hasta estos días. Ella recurre a Fundación León 2000 con la intención de facilitarle un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, calzado, ropa para niños y cosméticos. Elda tiene los sueños de obtener una distribuidora donde los precios sean muy accesibles.
texts.en:
Elda Maritza B. M. is 32 years old. She is a single mother of four children, all of whom are in school. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise, which she has done for more than five years to support her family. Elda's beginnings were not easy, as she started working at a very young age, but this helped her gain experience in the business and allowed her to maintain it up to now. She is returning to Fundación León 2000 to get a loan to buy clothing, shoes, children's clothing and cosmetics. Elda wishes to get a distributor where the prices are very affordable.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: La señora Maria Nicolása, tiene la edad de 42 años, casada y con  tres hijos dos trabajan y uno cursa los  estudios, su esposo trabaja de chofer, y reside en el barrio 19 de Febrero de la cooperativa dos de Agosto 2 cuatro abajo en la capital de Managua. Su negocio es la venta de  cosméticos y perfumes, desde hace diez años el cual inicio con ahorros, y las costura que ha sido un medio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, con este préstamo es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de ropa, cosmético, y poder ofertar variedad a sus clientes. Da las gracias a la institución por el desarrollo que ha obtenido en su inversión de comercio ya que gracias a los créditos a la largo plazos ha podido generar beneficios en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Maria Nicolása is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children work and one is in school. Her husband is a driver. She lives in the 19 de Febrero neighborhood and is in the 2 de Agosto cooperative in the capital city of Managua. Her business is selling cosmetics and perfumes, which she began 10 years ago with her own savings. Sewing has also been a medium for helping her husband with their expenses. With this, her ninth loan from Afodenic, she will invest in the purchase of clothing and cosmetics to be able to offer a greater variety to her customers. She thanks the institution for the commercial development she has achieved, because the long-term loans have enabled her to benefit in her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Ernesto de 42 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Lleva 10 años cocinando para la gente que asiste a su restaurante, el cual está ubicado en una de las calles más céntricas de la ciudad de Juliaca, su negocio es uno de los más visitados, ya que tiene una gran variedad de platos que ofrecer, como ella misma dice, “hay para todos los gustos”.  A ella le gustaría tener un restaurante más grande, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes, puesto que disfruta mucho de cocinar y conversar con sus comensales, eso sí, lo que le resulta difícil es atender a toda la gente que ingresa a su restaurante, ya que es demasiado cansado para ella sola. Es el primer préstamo al que accede Olga con MFP, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más sillas para su restaurante y así poder atender a más gente.
texts.en:
Olga is 40 years old, and a very hardworking and driven woman. She lives in her own house with her spouse, 42-year-old Ernesto, and what she desires most is to improve her quality of life. She has spent 10 years cooking for patrons of her restaurant, which is located in one of the most central streets of the city of Juliaca. Her business is one of the most frequented spots because it offers a great variety of dishes--as she says, "something for all tastes". She would like to have a larger restaurant where she could tend to more customers. She really enjoys cooking for and conversing with her diners, but the difficult part is taking care of everyone who visits her restaurant because it is too tiring for her alone. This is Olga's first loan with MFP. She hopes to pay it back on time and without problems. She is well respected in her communal bank, as she is the most active and committed member. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will buy more chairs for her restaurant so she can cater to more people.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chairs

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 52 años, es divorciada y vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo Edgar D. 24 años, desea progresar y vivir una vida tranquila. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, que a lo largo D. su vida ha luchado mucho por salir adelante, ha trabajado en muchas cosas, pero por fin hace 5 años pudo encontrar un negocio más cómodo para ella, la venta D. ropa le ha traído muchos beneficios y ha hecho que ya no tenga tantos problemas a la hora D. cubrir sus gastos, su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que siempre venD. ropa muy a la moda y D. buena calidad. Simona anhela que su negocio progrese y así poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo, es conversar con sus compañeras D. venta, pero lo que no le agrada es quedarse todo el día en su puesto sin poder ir a ningún sitio, aun así, se siente feliz D. tener su negocio propio y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sacarlo adelante. Este es el primer préstamo D. Simona con MFP, y tiene muchas ganas D. pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, es una socia muy alegre y querida en su banco comunal y espera poder seguir trabajando en armonía con sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa D. la ciudad D. Tacna y así incrementará la variedad D. su mercadería.
texts.en:
Simona is 52 years old, divorce and lives in her own house with her son Edgar who is 24 years old. She wants to progress and live a quiet life. She is a hard-working woman, who throughout her life has fought hard to get ahead. She has worked on many fields. She started her business 5 years ago selling clothes. It has brought many benefits and has helped to cover her expenses. Her shop is very popular as she always sells very fashionable and good quality clothes.

Simona hopes to grow her business and increase her income. What she likes the most about her job, is chatting with her partners, but what she does not like is to stay all day in her booth. Yet she is happy to have her own business and is willing to work very hard to take it forward. This is her first loan with MFP, and is committed to pay her dues on time.

She is a very happy and appreciated member of the community bank and hopes to continue working in harmony with the other members. The loan requested is to buy more merchandise in the city of Tacna and increase the variety of her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa León de 55 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene cinco hijos tres mayores de edad y dos estudian, es soltera y su negocio es la venta de fritanga y una pequeña pulpería que administra desde hace seis años, este negocio lo inicio con ahorros y es su sexto crédito en Afodenic y lo va invertir en la compra de granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz, productos lácteos, para incrementar su inventario y elevar las ventas. Los planes para su familia es poder hacer mejoras a su vivienda ya que es sencilla e insegura por que parte de la vivienda esta forrada de zinc y desea dejar a sus hijos una casa digna.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa L. is 55 years old, single and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliacion. She has five children three of them are adults and two are students. Her business is the sale of fried meals and a grocery shop that she has managed for six years, which she started with her savings.

This is her sixth loan with Afodenic. She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains such as beans, rice and dairy products, to increase her inventory and sales. She hopes to be able to make improvements in her house because it is basic and unsafe since part of it is lined with zinc. She wants to give a decent home to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Ulloa 1 Group

texts.en:
Tomasina has been with Esperanza for almost four years now and has proven to be very faithful with her attendance and repayments. Tomasina has a small store named Colmado Orquídea where she sells fruits and vegetables as well as basic household products. Tomasina is a mother of four and hopes that one day her store will reach a big enough size that the profits would be able to sustain her family. 

Please help Tomasina increase the size of her business.  Thank you.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables and other items for a family run grocery store

loans.name: Ulloa 2 Group

texts.en:
Carlos and his wife Cecilia have two grown children. Both Carlos and Cecilia work in their family run grocery store, Colmado Cecilia. Carlos is the primary supplier of milk and cheese. Because there is large demand for both these products he is requesting this loan to increase his milk and cheese production.

He is aiming to significantly grow their business but says that his main goal is to always look forward towards the future. Please help Carlos reach significant growth so he can employ people in his community who are in need of employment. Thank you.

loans.use: Expand his milk and cheese making business
